quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Courage is grace under pressure.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Courage is the most important of all the virtues, because without courage you can't practice any other virtue consistently. You can practice any virtue erratically, but nothing consistently without courage.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.

author: Robert Frost
quote: It's a funny thing that when a man hasn't anything on earth to worry about, he goes off and gets married.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Bride: A woman with a fine prospect of happiness behind her.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.

author: Heraclitus
quote: The chain of wedlock is so heavy that it takes two to carry it - and sometimes three.

author: Nick Cave
quote: Getting married, for me, was the best thing I ever did. I was suddenly beset with an immense sense of release, that we have something more important than our separate selves, and that is the marriage. There's immense happiness that can come from working towards that.

author: Lord Byron
quote: I am about to be married, and am of course in all the misery of a man in pursuit of happiness.

author: Paris Hilton
quote: I'd imagine my wedding as a fairy tale... huge, beautiful and white.

author: James M. Barrie
quote: That is ever the way. 'Tis all jealousy to the bride and good wishes to the corpse.

author: Adam Sandler
quote: I sang a song at my sister's wedding. My mother forced me into that, too. But that one felt all right.

author: John Mayer
quote: A man's got two shots for jewelry: a wedding ring and a watch. The watch is a lot easier to get on and off than a wedding ring.

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: My mother says I didn't open my eyes for eight days after I was born, but when I did, the first thing I saw was an engagement ring. I was hooked.

author: Helen Rowland
quote: A bride at her second marriage does not wear a veil. She wants to see what she is getting.

author: Friedrich Schiller
quote: A gloomy guest fits not a wedding feast.

author: Claire Forlani
quote: There's a higher form of happiness in commitment. I'm counting on it.

author: Brian May
quote: The Wedding March has a bit of a death march in it.

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
quote: When the wedding march sounds the resolute approach, the clock no longer ticks, it tolls the hour. The figures in the aisle are no longer individuals, they symbolize the human race.

author: Heinrich Heine
quote: Music played at weddings always reminds me of the music played for soldiers before they go into battle.

author: Cat Cora
quote: I believe that parents need to make nutrition education a priority in their home environment. It's crucial for good health and longevity to instill in your children sound eating habits from an early age.

author: Jack LaLanne
quote: The only way you get that fat off is to eat less and exercise more.

author: Bruce Barton
quote: Cereal eating is almost a marker for a healthy lifestyle. It sets you up for the day, so you don't overeat.

author: Calvin Trillin
quote: Health food makes me sick.

author: Kristen Bell
quote: I find it almost comforting to count calories, because it makes me conscious of what I'm eating. But on Super Bowl Sunday, I thought, 'Surrender to it. It's nacho time.' Then I ate nothing but Doritos all day.

author: Jean Kerr
quote: I feel about airplanes the way I feel about diets. It seems to me that they are wonderful things for other people to go on.

author: Robin Quivers
quote: I'm nutty for nutrition. I've become one of those people who can't stop talking about the connection between food and health. Now that I know how much changing what you eat can transform your life, I can't stop proselytizing.

author: Caroline Rhea
quote: Don't compare yourself with someone else's version of happy or thin. Accepting yourself burns the most calories.

author: Tommy Lasorda
quote: When we win, I'm so happy I eat a lot. When we lose, I'm so depressed, I eat a lot. When we're rained out, I'm so disappointed I eat a lot.

author: Joely Fisher
quote: I don't believe in depriving myself of any food or being imprisoned by a diet.

author: Gro Harlem Brundtland
quote: A safe and nutritionally adequate diet is a basic individual right and an essential condition for sustainable development, especially in developing countries.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.

author: Walter Scott
quote: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practise to deceive!

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.

author: Confucius
quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: Trouble shared is trouble halved.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.

author: Dan Rather
quote: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.

author: Michelangelo
quote: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.

author: John Muir
quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?

author: Carl Jung
quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.

author: Louie Schwartzberg
quote: I think we need to do some deep soul searching about what's important in our lives and renew our spirit and our spiritual thinking, whether it's through faith-based religion or just through loving nature or helping your fellow man.

author: Amy Sedaris
quote: I have always wanted a bunny and I'll always have a rabbit the rest of my life.

author: Basil Hume
quote: The great gift of Easter is hope - Christian hope which makes us have that confidence in God, in his ultimate triumph, and in his goodness and love, which nothing can shake.

author: Bernhard Langer
quote: To a Christian, Easter Sunday means everything, when we celebrate the resurrection of Jesus Christ.

author: Bede Griffiths
quote: God had brought me to my knees and made me acknowledge my own nothingness, and out of that knowledge I had been reborn. I was no longer the centre of my life and therefore I could see God in everything.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
quote: What is the real purpose behind the Tooth Fairy, the Easter Bunny and Santa Claus? They seem like greater steps toward faith and imagination, each with a payoff. Like cognitive training exercises.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: We were old sinners - but when we came to Christ we are not sinners anymore.

author: Daniel Morgan
quote: I believe in one God, the first and great cause of goodness. I also believe in Jesus Christ, the rebirth of the world. I also believe in the Holy Ghost, the comforter.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: Like all dreamers, I mistook disenchantment for truth.

author: Joseph Barbera
quote: That's what keeps me going: dreaming, inventing, then hoping and dreaming some more in order to keep dreaming.

author: Akira Kurosawa
quote: Man is a genius when he is dreaming.

author: Leo Fender
quote: The design of each element should be thought out in order to be easy to make and easy to repair.

author: Paul Rand
quote: Design is everything. Everything!

author: Richard Gere
quote: I don't know any of us who are in relationships that are totally honest - it doesn't exist.

author: Chris Martin
quote: I've never been cool and I don't really care about being cool. It's just an awful lot of time and hair gel wasted.

author: Lenny Kravitz
quote: People see my photos and think I labor over my image and I'm this cool, brooding artist. But I'm just having fun with it.

author: Ashton Kutcher
quote: I'm from Iowa, we don't know what cool is!

author: Anthony Kiedis
quote: Sometimes life's so much cooler when you just don't know any better and all the painful lessons have not hammered your head open yet.

author: Nicholas Negroponte
quote: Computing is not about computers any more. It is about living.

author: Tim O'Reilly
quote: We're entering a new world in which data may be more important than software.

author: Craig Bruce
quote: It's hardware that makes a machine fast. It's software that makes a fast machine slow.

author: Elayne Boosler
quote: I am thankful the most important key in history was invented. It's not the key to your house, your car, your boat, your safety deposit box, your bike lock or your private community. It's the key to order, sanity, and peace of mind. The key is 'Delete.'

author: Andy Rooney
quote: Computers make it easier to do a lot of things, but most of the things they make it easier to do don't need to be done.

author: Robert Orben
quote: To err is human - and to blame it on a computer is even more so.

author: James H. Clark
quote: The Internet is not just one thing, it's a collection of things - of numerous communications networks that all speak the same digital language.

author: Marc Andreessen
quote: In short, software is eating the world.

author: Edward Tufte
quote: If you like overheads, you'll love PowerPoint.

author: Bob Dylan
quote: There is nothing so stable as change.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

author: Confucius
quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.

author: Will Smith
quote: Money and success don't change people; they merely amplify what is already there.

author: Moliere
quote: It is a fine seasoning for joy to think of those we love.

author: Bernard Manning
quote: I once bought my kids a set of batteries for Christmas with a note on it saying, toys not included.

author: Carrie Fisher
quote: I don't think Christmas is necessarily about things. It's about being good to one another, it's about the Christian ethic, it's about kindness.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: Christmas is the perfect time to celebrate the love of God and family and to create memories that will last forever. Jesus is God's perfect, indescribable gift. The amazing thing is that not only are we able to receive this gift, but we are able to share it with others on Christmas and every other day of the year.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: When we were children we were grateful to those who filled our stockings at Christmas time. Why are we not grateful to God for filling our stockings with legs?

author: David Friedrich Strauss
quote: The supernatural birth of Christ, his miracles, his resurrection and ascension, remain eternal truths, whatever doubts may be cast on their reality as historical facts.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: Speak clearly, if you speak at all; carve every word before you let it fall.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.

author: George Eliot
quote: Blessed is the man, who having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.

author: Wallace Stevens
quote: In the world of words, the imagination is one of the forces of nature.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.

author: Hans Hofmann
quote: The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: Writing, to me, is simply thinking through my fingers.

author: Jack Welch
quote: Number one, cash is king... number two, communicate... number three, buy or bury the competition.

author: Florence Scovel Shinn
quote: The game of life is a game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.

author: J. B. Priestley
quote: The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.

author: Ray Romano
quote: If my father had hugged me even once, I'd be an accountant right now.

author: Herbert Kaufman
quote: Rich men's sons are seldom rich men's fathers.

author: William Hurt
quote: Being a father, being a friend, those are the things that make me feel successful.

author: Adam Sandler
quote: I never had a speech from my father 'this is what you must do or shouldn't do' but I just learned to be led by example. My father wasn't perfect.

author: E. B. White
quote: The time not to become a father is eighteen years before a war.

author: Joseph Joubert
quote: Love and fear. Everything the father of a family says must inspire one or the other.

author: Robert Frost
quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.

author: David O. McKay
quote: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!

author: Anne Frank
quote: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.

author: Ann Landers
quote: Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don't recognize them.

author: Sam Ewing
quote: Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don't turn up at all.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: It is the working man who is the happy man. It is the idle man who is the miserable man.

author: Chanakya
quote: Before you start some work, always ask yourself three questions - Why am I doing it, What the results might be and Will I be successful. Only when you think deeply and find satisfactory answers to these questions, go ahead.

author: Ray Kroc
quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.

author: Henry J. Kaiser
quote: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.

author: Buddha
quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.

author: Mark Twain
quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
quote: Once you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: There are risks and costs to action. But they are far less than the long range risks of comfortable inaction.

author: Mary Tyler Moore
quote: Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.

author: Richard M. Nixon
quote: If you take no risks, you will suffer no defeats. But if you take no risks, you win no victories.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.

author: Confucius
quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

author: Marcel Proust
quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

author: Buddha
quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.

author: George A. Moore
quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.

author: Matsuo Basho
quote: Every day is a journey, and the journey itself is home.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: I measure the progress of a community by the degree of progress which women have achieved.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
quote: Women, can't live with them, can't live without them.

author: Timothy Leary
quote: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.

author: Mao Zedong
quote: Women hold up half the sky.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Wives are young men's mistresses, companions for middle age, and old men's nurses.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: Man does not control his own fate. The women in his life do that for him.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: Know thy self, know thy enemy. A thousand battles, a thousand victories.

author: Herbert Hoover
quote: Older men declare war. But it is the youth that must fight and die.

author: George Washington
quote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effective means of preserving peace.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: If we don't end war, war will end us.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: We are going to have peace even if we have to fight for it.

author: Herodotus
quote: In peace, sons bury their fathers. In war, fathers bury their sons.

author: William Tecumseh Sherman
quote: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
quote: There is no avoiding war; it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: When the rich wage war, it's the poor who die.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Mankind must put an end to war before war puts an end to mankind.

author: Robert E. Lee
quote: It is well that war is so terrible, otherwise we should grow too fond of it.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.

author: Henrik Ibsen
quote: Never wear your best trousers when you go out to fight for freedom and truth.

author: Bernard Law Montgomery
quote: Every soldier must know, before he goes into battle, how the little battle he is to fight fits into the larger picture, and how the success of his fighting will influence the battle as a whole.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: Live as brave men; and if fortune is adverse, front its blows with brave hearts.

author: Charles M. Schulz
quote: All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.

author: Frank Morgan
quote: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.

author: George Edward Moore
quote: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.

author: John Updike
quote: We are most alive when we're in love.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: I'd rather have roses on my table than diamonds on my neck.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: Soul meets soul on lovers' lips.

author: Robert Herrick
quote: Give me a kiss, and to that kiss a score; Then to that twenty, add a hundred more: A thousand to that hundred: so kiss on, To make that thousand up a million. Treble that million, and when that is done, Let's kiss afresh, as when we first begun.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

author: Stephen King
quote: The trust of the innocent is the liar's most useful tool.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters.

author: Stephen Covey
quote: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships.

author: Corrie Ten Boom
quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.

author: Barack Obama
quote: If the people cannot trust their government to do the job for which it exists - to protect them and to promote their common welfare - all else is lost.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Trust, but verify.

author: Golda Meir
quote: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.

author: Andre Gide
quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.

author: Thomas Szasz
quote: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.

author: Jennifer Aniston
quote: One tradition I have with my friends is that when one of us gets married, we have a ton of fragrance oils and pretty bottles at the bachelorette party. Everyone puts a drop or two in a bottle for the bride and makes a wish, and the bride wears our creation on her wedding day.

author: Honore de Balzac
quote: A young bride is like a plucked flower; but a guilty wife is like a flower that had been walked over.

author: Nicholas Sparks
quote: The first thing I did when I sold my book was buy a new wedding ring for my wife and asked her to marry me all over again.

author: Vera Wang
quote: When I design a wedding dress with a bustle, it has to be one the bride can dance in. I love the idea that something is practical and still looks great.

author: Dave Grohl
quote: There's a big difference between falling in love with someone and falling in love with someone and getting married. Usually, after you get married, you fall in love with the person even more.

author: Edward VIII
quote: Of course, I do have a slight advantage over the rest of you. It helps in a pinch to be able to remind your bride that you gave up a throne for her.

author: Valerie Bertinelli
quote: I've realized that I'm more important than food is. I love a big slice of pizza, but I love myself more. Being thin is about changing the way you think about yourself. It's about saying that you deserve to be healthy.

author: Jennifer Aniston
quote: Look I eat really well and I work out, but I also indulge when I want to. I don't starve myself in an extremist way. You're not taking away my coffee or my dairy or my glass of wine because I'd be devastated.

author: Mike Ditka
quote: So, when it comes to eating healthy, it's just doing the right thing. And it's not something you have to do 365 days a year, but I think it's something you have to do 25 days a month. Let's put it that way.

author: Tipper Gore
quote: Our society's strong emphasis on dieting and self-image can sometimes lead to eating disorders. We know that more than 5 million Americans suffer from eating disorders, most of them young women.

author: Helena Rubinstein
quote: Leave the table while you still feel you could eat a little more.

author: Cameron Diaz
quote: French fries. I love them. Some people are chocolate and sweets people. I love French fries. That and caviar.

author: Lara Stone
quote: I think of dieting, then I eat pizza.

author: Leighton Meester
quote: I used to drink tons of caffeine. Now I make smoothies with frozen berries and Green Vibrance health powder.

author: Alicia Silverstone
quote: I never count calories, but I eat so well.

author: Gene Tunney
quote: A boxer's diet should be low in fat and high in proteins and sugar. Therefore you should eat plenty of lean meat, milk, leafy vegetables, and fresh fruit and ice cream for sugar.

author: Courteney Cox
quote: If I like myself at this weight, then this is what I'm going to be. I don't have an eating disorder.

author: LeAnn Rimes
quote: I am constantly working out-circuit training, jumping rope, and stair-stepping, and sticking to 1200 calories a day. It can't be something that you're doing to lose weight, and then once you do, you're done. I do it every day of my life.

author: Mark Hyman
quote: The very fact that we are having a national conversation about what we should eat, that we are struggling with the question about what the best diet is, is symptomatic of how far we have strayed from the natural conditions that gave rise to our species, from the simple act of eating real, whole, fresh food.

author: Will Rogers
quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.

author: John Wooden
quote: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.

author: John C. Maxwell
quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.

author: Satchel Paige
quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.

author: E. Stanley Jones
quote: Continuing a Lenten series on prayer: Prayer is co-operation with God. It is the purest exercise of the faculties God has given us - an exercise that links these faculties with the Maker to work out the intentions He had in mind in their creation.

author: Walter Martin
quote: What makes you a Christian is whether or not you really are in accord with biblical theology and whether you know Jesus Christ as your Saviour.

author: Phillips Brooks
quote: Let every man and woman count himself immortal. Let him catch the revelation of Jesus in his resurrection. Let him say not merely, 'Christ is risen,' but 'I shall rise.'

author: Keith O'Brien
quote: I know that many of you do wear such a cross of Christ, not in any ostentatious way, not in a way that might harm you at your work or recreation, but a simple indication that you value the role of Jesus Christ in the history of the world, that you are trying to live by Christ's standards in your own daily life.

author: Gordon B. Hinckley
quote: There would be no Christmas if there was no Easter.

author: Reba McEntire
quote: Easter is very important to me, it's a second chance.

author: Trey Parker
quote: Even if you're not Christian, just from being in our culture you know Jesus and resurrection and redemption.

author: Josh McDowell
quote: The first thing that stuck in the minds of the disciples was not the empty tomb, but rather the empty grave clothes - undisturbed in form and position.

author: Charles Stanley
quote: The Bible tells us that God will meet all our needs. He feeds the birds of the air and clothes the grass with the splendor of lilies. How much more, then, will He care for us, who are made in His image? Our only concern is to obey the heavenly Father and leave the consequences to Him.

author: Frederica Mathewes-Green
quote: Easter tells us of something children can't understand, because it addresses things they don't yet have to know: the weariness of life, the pain, the profound loneliness and hovering fear of meaninglessness.

author: Ethel Merman
quote: At one time I smoked, but in 1959 I couldn't think of anything else to give up for Lent so I stopped - and I haven't had a cigarette since.

author: Dwight L. Moody
quote: A rule I have had for years is: to treat the Lord Jesus Christ as a personal friend. His is not a creed, a mere doctrine, but it is He Himself we have.

author: Christopher Alexander
quote: Complexity is one of the great problems in environmental design.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.

author: Donald Norman
quote: Everyday people are not very good designers.

author: Niklaus Wirth
quote: A good designer must rely on experience, on precise, logic thinking; and on pedantic exactness. No magic will do.

author: Charles Eames
quote: Recognizing the need is the primary condition for design.

author: Arthur Erickson
quote: The details are the very source of expression in architecture. But we are caught in a vice between art and the bottom line.

author: Rem Koolhaas
quote: Designs are increasingly winning competitions because they are literally green, and because somewhere they feature a small windmill.

author: Paul Rand
quote: Design is the method of putting form and content together. Design, just as art, has multiple definitions; there is no single definition. Design can be art. Design can be aesthetics. Design is so simple, that's why it is so complicated.

author: Bonnie Raitt
quote: I never saw music in terms of men and women or black and white. There was just cool and uncool.

author: Tony Dungy
quote: People look at me and see a calm, cool guy on the sidelines and I want them to know that my Christian faith affects my coaching and everything I do.

author: Vin Diesel
quote: You get a timeless cool card in New York.

author: Harry Styles
quote: I think you have to be cool to be a good flirt, and I don't think I'm very cool.

author: Cher
quote: Some years I'm the coolest thing that ever happened, and then the next year everyone's so over me, and I'm just so past my sell date.

author: Adrian Edmondson
quote: A lot of people are obsessed with looking cool. They feel they have to look after their image.

author: John Mayer
quote: I've never done anything because I thought it would look cool.

author: Jean-Claude Van Damme
quote: It looks good when you see someone kicking at the age of 51 with no double. It's kinda cool for people to know that past 50 we can keep flexible.

author: Demetri Martin
quote: I think it would be cool if you were writing a ransom note on your computer, if the paper clip popped up and said, 'Looks like you're writing a ransom note. Need help? You should use more forceful language, you'll get more money.'

author: Rob Corddry
quote: Apparently it's cool to watch The Daily Show.

author: Simon Mainwaring
quote: Your computer needn't be the first thing your see in the morning and the last thing you see at night.

author: Ken Olsen
quote: Software comes from heaven when you have good hardware.

author: Richard Dawkins
quote: Personally, I rather look forward to a computer program winning the world chess championship. Humanity needs a lesson in humility.

author: Marissa Mayer
quote: When people think about computer science, they imagine people with pocket protectors and thick glasses who code all night.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Change is inevitable. Change is constant.

author: Nikos Kazantzakis
quote: Since we cannot change reality, let us change the eyes which see reality.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Change your opinions, keep to your principles; change your leaves, keep intact your roots.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: It may be hard for an egg to turn into a bird: it would be a jolly sight harder for it to learn to fly while remaining an egg. We are like eggs at present. And you cannot go on indefinitely being just an ordinary, decent egg. We must be hatched or go bad.

author: Gilda Radner
quote: Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next.

author: Anatole France
quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.

author: Jack Welch
quote: Change before you have to.

author: Jon Bon Jovi
quote: Miracles happen everyday, change your perception of what a miracle is and you'll see them all around you.

author: Frank Herbert
quote: Without change, something sleeps inside us, and seldom awakens. The sleeper must awaken.

author: Dave Barry
quote: Once again, we come to the Holiday Season, a deeply religious time that each of us observes, in his own way, by going to the mall of his choice.

author: Ellen DeGeneres
quote: Nothing says holidays, like a cheese log.

author: Taylor Caldwell
quote: Don't let the past steal your present. This is the message of Christmas: We are never alone.

author: Alice Cooper
quote: The two most joyous times of the year are Christmas morning and the end of school.

author: Pope Paul VI
quote: We consider Christmas as the encounter, the great encounter, the historical encounter, the decisive encounter, between God and mankind. He who has faith knows this truly; let him rejoice.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: Moving between the legs of tables and of chairs, rising or falling, grasping at kisses and toys, advancing boldly, sudden to take alarm, retreating to the corner of arm and knee, eager to be reassured, taking pleasure in the fragrant brilliance of the Christmas tree.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: What I don't like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.

author: Ralph W. Sockman
quote: Christmas renews our youth by stirring our wonder. The capacity for wonder has been called our most pregnant human faculty, for in it are born our art, our science, our religion.

author: Mary Ellen Chase
quote: Christmas, children, is not a date. It is a state of mind.

author: Thomas S. Monson
quote: Christmas is the spirit of giving without a thought of getting. It is happiness because we see joy in people. It is forgetting self and finding time for others. It is discarding the meaningless and stressing the true values.

author: E. B. White
quote: To perceive Christmas through its wrappings becomes more difficult with every year.

author: Clement Clarke Moore
quote: T'was the night before Christmas, when all through the house, not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse.

author: Dale Evans
quote: Christmas, my child, is love in action. Every time we love, every time we give, it's Christmas.

author: Katharine McPhee
quote: Christmas is a time of year that's so romantic.

author: Johnny Carson
quote: Mail your packages early so the post office can lose them in time for Christmas.

author: Washington Irving
quote: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Everything becomes a little different as soon as it is spoken out loud.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: There is only one rule for being a good talker - learn to listen.

author: John Galsworthy
quote: One's eyes are what one is, one's mouth is what one becomes.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: The best way to solve problems and to fight against war is through dialogue.

author: Matthew Arnold
quote: Journalism is literature in a hurry.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.

author: Rita Mae Brown
quote: Language exerts hidden power, like the moon on the tides.

author: Emma Thompson
quote: Any problem, big or small, within a family, always seems to start with bad communication. Someone isn't listening.

author: Federico Fellini
quote: A different language is a different vision of life.

author: Earl Wilson
quote: Science may never come up with a better office communication system than the coffee break.

author: Edward R. Murrow
quote: The speed of communications is wondrous to behold. It is also true that speed can multiply the distribution of information that we know to be untrue.

author: Jada Pinkett Smith
quote: My belief is that communication is the best way to create strong relationships.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: Quote me as saying I was mis-quoted.

author: George Herbert
quote: Good words are worth much, and cost little.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.

author: DeForest Kelley
quote: The most important influence in my childhood was my father.

author: Anthony Quinn
quote: Thirteen, 13 children, and I love - I love them all. And I think I've been a good father to all of them.

author: Robert Bly
quote: When a father, absent during the day, returns home at six, his children receive only his temperament, not his teaching.

author: Daisy Donovan
quote: My dad always said, 'Don't worry what people think, because you can't change it.'

author: Anthony Hopkins
quote: My father was grounded, a very meat-and-potatoes man. He was a baker.

author: Barry White
quote: I kept my babies fed. I could have dumped them, but I didn't. I decided that whatever trip I was on, they were going with me. You're looking at a real daddy.

author: Sean Penn
quote: Child-rearing is my main interest now. I'm a hands-on father.

author: Sam Ewing
quote: Nobody ever asks a father how he manages to combine marriage and a career.

author: Jay London
quote: I wanted to take up music, so my father bought me a blunt instrument. He told me to knock myself out.

author: Victor Borge
quote: My father invented a cure for which there was no disease and unfortunately my mother caught it and died of it.

author: Kiefer Sutherland
quote: I've had some amazing people in my life. Look at my father - he came from a small fishing village of five hundred people and at six foot four with giant ears and a kind of very odd expression, thought he could be a movie star. So go figure, you know?

author: Joel Osteen
quote: I made a decision when my father passed away that I was going to be who God made me to be and not try to preach like my father.

author: Lenny Kravitz
quote: A dramatic thing, the first time you stand up to your dad.

author: Jeff Foxworthy
quote: My father-in-law gets up at 5 o'clock in the morning and watches the Discovery Channel. I don't know why there's this big rush to do this.

author: Michael Jackson
quote: I just wish I could understand my father.

author: Charley Pride
quote: I grew up not liking my father very much. I never saw him cry. But he must have. Everybody cries.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: An angry father is most cruel towards himself.

author: Walt Disney
quote: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn't know how to get along without it.

author: Grover Cleveland
quote: Honor lies in honest toil.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.

author: Louis C. K.
quote: I've learned from experience that if you work harder at it, and apply more energy and time to it, and more consistency, you get a better result. It comes from the work.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: We have a system that increasingly taxes work and subsidizes nonwork.

author: George Burns
quote: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.

author: Albert Camus
quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.

author: Jesus Christ
quote: I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

author: George Washington
quote: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.

author: Iris Murdoch
quote: We live in a fantasy world, a world of illusion. The great task in life is to find reality.

author: Elvis Presley
quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't goin' away.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth.

author: John Keats
quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.

author: James A. Garfield
quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will make you miserable.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.

author: Martin Luther
quote: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.

author: Unknown
quote: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Half a truth is often a great lie.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: It's true hard work never killed anybody, but I figure, why take the chance?

author: Maimonides
quote: The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.

author: Robert Collier
quote: Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: Buy the ticket, take the ride.

author: Mario Andretti
quote: If you're so afraid of failure, you will never succeed. You have to take chances.

author: Anais Nin
quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.

author: Anais Nin
quote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.

author: Danny Kaye
quote: To travel is to take a journey into yourself.

author: Martin Buber
quote: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: Ah, women. They make the highs higher and the lows more frequent.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: Disguise our bondage as we will, 'Tis woman, woman, rules us still.

author: Phylicia Rashad
quote: Any time women come together with a collective intention, it's a powerful thing. Whether it's sitting down making a quilt, in a kitchen preparing a meal, in a club reading the same book, or around the table playing cards, or planning a birthday party, when women come together with a collective intention, magic happens.

author: George Santayana
quote: Only the dead have seen the end of the war.

author: e. e. cummings
quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.

author: Elon Musk
quote: When I was in college, I wanted to be involved in things that would change the world.

author: Aristotle
quote: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.

author: Melody Beattie
quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.

author: Bill Gates
quote: The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.

author: Steve Ballmer
quote: The number one benefit of information technology is that it empowers people to do what they want to do. It lets people be creative. It lets people be productive. It lets people learn things they didn't think they could learn before, and so in a sense it is all about potential.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity, just as brave soldiers triumph in war.

author: Horatio Nelson
quote: Gentlemen, when the enemy is committed to a mistake we must not interrupt him too soon.

author: John Keegan
quote: Soldiers, when committed to a task, can't compromise. It's unrelenting devotion to the standards of duty and courage, absolute loyalty to others, not letting the task go until it's been done.

author: Sebastian Junger
quote: The only thing that makes battle psychologically tolerable is the brotherhood among soldiers. You need each other to get by.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: When the will defies fear, when duty throws the gauntlet down to fate, when honor scorns to compromise with death - that is heroism.

author: Alfred M. Gray
quote: I go where the sound of thunder is.

author: Tom Clancy
quote: The U.S. Military is us. There is no truer representation of a country than the people that it sends into the field to fight for it. The people who wear our uniform and carry our rifles into combat are our kids, and our job is to support them, because they're protecting us.

author: George Eliot
quote: The reward of one duty is the power to fulfill another.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: In war the heroes always outnumber the soldiers ten to one.

author: Rand Beers
quote: The precondition to freedom is security.

author: Solomon Ortiz
quote: As a former veteran, I understand the needs of veterans, and have been clear - we will work together, stand together with the Administration, but we will also question their policies when they shortchange veterans and military retirees.

author: Oliver Cromwell
quote: A few honest men are better than numbers.

author: Norman Schwarzkopf
quote: It takes a hero to be one of those men who goes into battle.

author: Doc Hastings
quote: We owe our World War II veterans - and all our veterans - a debt we can never fully repay.

author: Ira Hayes
quote: I am not a hero but the brave men who died deserved this honor.

author: Michel de Montaigne
quote: If you press me to say why I loved him, I can say no more than because he was he, and I was I.

author: Yoko Ono
quote: There's a long life ahead of you and it's going to be beautiful, as long as you keep loving and hugging each other.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: I'll love you, dear, I'll love you till China and Africa meet and the river jumps over the mountain and the salmon sing in the street.

author: Bil Keane
quote: They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Love shall be our token; love be yours and love be mine.

author: Joyce Carol Oates
quote: In love there are two things - bodies and words.

author: Cameron Diaz
quote: I'd kiss a frog even if there was no promise of a Prince Charming popping out of it. I love frogs.

author: George MacDonald
quote: To be trusted is a greater compliment than being loved.

author: Eminem
quote: Trust is hard to come by. That's why my circle is small and tight. I'm kind of funny about making new friends.

author: Bo Bennett
quote: For every good reason there is to lie, there is a better reason to tell the truth.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen.

author: Frank Crane
quote: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough.

author: Charles Spurgeon
quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.

author: Lincoln Chafee
quote: Trust is built with consistency.

author: Benjamin Spock
quote: Trust yourself, you know more than you think you do.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.

author: John Wooden
quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.

author: John Wayne
quote: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.

author: Marcus Garvey
quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: My message, especially to young people is to have courage to think differently, courage to invent, to travel the unexplored path, courage to discover the impossible and to conquer the problems and succeed. These are great qualities that they must work towards. This is my message to the young people.

author: Billy Graham
quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.

author: Aristotle
quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: There are no easy answers, but there are simple answers. We must have the courage to do what we know is morally right.

author: Anais Nin
quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Have no fear of moving into the unknown. Simply step out fearlessly knowing that I am with you, therefore no harm can befall you; all is very, very well. Do this in complete faith and confidence.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
quote: I chose my wife, as she did her wedding gown, for qualities that would wear well.

author: Helen Reddy
quote: In the '50s, a lot of girls never saw beyond the wedding day.

author: William Feather
quote: An invitation to a wedding invokes more trouble than a summons to a police court.

author: Niecy Nash
quote: Falling in love was the easy part; planning a wedding - yikes!

author: Christopher Morley
quote: The trouble with wedlock is that there's not enough wed and too much lock.

author: James Beattie
quote: No jealousy their dawn of love overcast, nor blasted were their wedded days with strife; each season looked delightful as it past, to the fond husband and the faithful wife.

author: Antisthenes
quote: Quarrels often arise in marriages when the bridal gifts are excessive.

author: Charles Simmons
quote: A person's character is but half formed till after wedlock.

author: Lois Capps
quote: My experience as a school nurse taught me that we need to make a concerted effort, all of us, to increase physical fitness activity among our children and to encourage all Americans to adopt a healthier diet that includes fruits and vegetables, but there is more.

author: Henry Ford
quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: If the world were perfect, it wouldn't be.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.

author: Saint Basil
quote: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.

author: Sigmund Freud
quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.

author: Henry Van Dyke
quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.

author: George S. Patton
quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.

author: Alan Kay
quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

author: Judy Garland
quote: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.

author: Amy Sedaris
quote: My mom used to say that Greek Easter was later because then you get stuff cheaper.

author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
quote: During my life I have heard many sermons on the Resurrection. I can recite the events of that first Easter Sunday. I have marked in my scriptures passages regarding the Resurrection.

author: Basil Hume
quote: Christ shared our experience; he suffered as we suffer; he died as we shall die, and for forty days in the desert he underwent the struggle between good and evil.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: People respond when you tell them there is a great future in front of you, you can leave your past behind.

author: Charles Stanley
quote: The moment someone chooses to trust in Jesus Christ, his sins are wiped away, and he is adopted into God's family. That individual is set apart as a child of God, with a sacred purpose.

author: Michael Leunig
quote: Easter is not limited to the passion and death of Christ; it also includes the dismal tragedy of life unlived by the many, and all the loss of passion and truth that goes with it.

author: Denis Leary
quote: Here's the problem with Easter. The Catholic Church needs to pick a date because it keeps moving. And I think the reason they always have Easter moving to different dates is to catch us.

author: Kenneth Scott Latourette
quote: The primary source of the appeal of Christianity was Jesus - His incarnation, His life, His crucifixion, and His resurrection.

author: Robert Collier
quote: Every contrivance of man, every tool, every instrument, every utensil, every article designed for use, of each and every kind, evolved from a very simple beginnings.

author: Terence
quote: Perhaps believing in good design is like believing in God, it makes you an optimist.

author: Alexander McQueen
quote: Clothes and jewellery should be startling, individual. When you see a woman in my clothes, you want to know more about them. To me, that is what distinguishes good designers from bad designers.

author: Mitch Kapor
quote: What is design? It's where you stand with a foot in two worlds - the world of technology and the world of people and human purposes - and you try to bring the two together.

author: Ivan Chermayeff
quote: Design is directed toward human beings. To design is to solve human problems by identifying them and executing the best solution.

author: Channing Tatum
quote: I think all jocks have a sensitive side. It's just, will they show it to anybody? Will they let their guard down and stop being tough and the cool jock guy around their friends, or just relax? I don't know if it's best to say opening up, but just relax and really say what you're actually thinking, and not what you think people want to hear.

author: Adlai Stevenson I
quote: To act coolly, intelligently and prudently in perilous circumstances is the test of a man - and also a nation.

author: Trent Reznor
quote: I wanted to escape Small Town U.S.A. To dismiss the boundaries, to explore. My life experience came from watching movies, TV, and reading books and magazines. When your culture comes from watching TV everyday, you're bombarded with images of things that seem cool, places that seem interesting, people who have jobs and careers and opportunities.

author: Emeril Lagasse
quote: The cool thing is that now that people have made this evolution where cooking is cool, people are doing it on weekends, they're doing their own challenges. It's back to cooking. And it's real cooking.

author: Dave Barry
quote: The simple truth is that balding African-American men look cool when they shave their heads, whereas balding white men look like giant thumbs.

author: Elena Kagan
quote: It was a very cool thing to be a smart girl, as opposed to some other, different kind. And I think that made a great deal of difference to me growing up and in my life afterward.

author: Jim Carrey
quote: Morgan Freeman is so class. He's so cool. He's so scary.

author: Eugene Jarvis
quote: The only legitimate use of a computer is to play games.

author: Thabo Mbeki
quote: Many of our own people here in this country do not ask about computers, telephones and television sets. They ask - when will we get a road to our village.

author: Alan Perlis
quote: If your computer speaks English, it was probably made in Japan.

author: Louis V. Gerstner, Jr.
quote: Computers are magnificent tools for the realization of our dreams, but no machine can replace the human spark of spirit, compassion, love, and understanding.

author: Danielle Berry
quote: No one ever said on their deathbed, 'Gee, I wish I had spent more time alone with my computer'.

author: Mike Royko
quote: It's been my policy to view the Internet not as an 'information highway', but as an electronic asylum filled with babbling loonies.

author: Ralph Merkle
quote: Nanotechnology will let us build computers that are incredibly powerful. We'll have more power in the volume of a sugar cube than exists in the entire world today.

author: Larry Ellison
quote: Bill Gates is the pope of the personal computer industry. He decides who's going to build.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: All great change in America begins at the dinner table.

author: Denis Waitley
quote: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.

author: A. C. Benson
quote: Very often a change of self is needed more than a change of scene.

author: Gail Sheehy
quote: If we don't change, we don't grow. If we don't grow, we aren't really living.

author: Edna Ferber
quote: Christmas isn't a season. It's a feeling.

author: Jerry Seinfeld
quote: That's the true spirit of Christmas; people being helped by people other than me.

author: Karl Rahner
quote: Every year we celebrate the holy season of Advent, O God. Every year we pray those beautiful prayers of longing and waiting, and sing those lovely songs of hope and promise.

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: A lovely thing about Christmas is that it's compulsory, like a thunderstorm, and we all go through it together.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: The communication of the dead is tongued with fire beyond the language of the living.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: Oaths are but words, and words are but wind.

author: Chief Joseph
quote: My father... had sharper eyes than the rest of our people.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: The fundamental defect of fathers, in our competitive society, is that they want their children to be a credit to them.

author: Harrison Ford
quote: I wanted to be a forest ranger or a coal man. At a very early age, I knew I didn't want to do what my dad did, which was work in an office.

author: Chuck Noll
quote: Good things happen to those who hustle.

author: Pearl S. Buck
quote: To find joy in work is to discover the fountain of youth.

author: Gloria Macapagal Arroyo
quote: The power of one, if fearless and focused, is formidable, but the power of many working together is better.

author: George Sand
quote: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength and his pleasure.

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: I guess we all like to be recognized not for one piece of fireworks, but for the ledger of our daily work.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.

author: Harry Golden
quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: I believe that it is better to tell the truth than a lie. I believe it is better to be free than to be a slave. And I believe it is better to know than to be ignorant.

author: Ismail Haniyeh
quote: Some people think that the truth can be hidden with a little cover-up and decoration. But as time goes by, what is true is revealed, and what is fake fades away.

author: Denis Diderot
quote: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The universe is transformation: life is opinion.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Silence is the mother of truth.

author: Stephen King
quote: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.

author: William Blake
quote: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Facts are stubborn things.

author: Antisthenes
quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself - an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.

author: Brad Henry
quote: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.

author: Carl Jung
quote: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feelings. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.

author: Henry Adams
quote: A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.

author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
quote: Some memories are unforgettable, remaining ever vivid and heartwarming!

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: I am grateful for what I am and have. My thanksgiving is perpetual.

author: William Blake
quote: The thankful receiver bears a plentiful harvest.

author: Al Green
quote: I'm thankful for every moment.

author: Henry Van Dyke
quote: Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling. Thanksgiving is the following of that impulse.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: To give thanks in solitude is enough. Thanksgiving has wings and goes where it must go. Your prayer knows much more about it than you do.

author: Bill Gates
quote: You may have heard of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. There's another day you might want to know about: Giving Tuesday. The idea is pretty straightforward. On the Tuesday after Thanksgiving, shoppers take a break from their gift-buying and donate what they can to charity.

author: Jim Davis
quote: Vegetables are a must on a diet. I suggest carrot cake, zucchini bread, and pumpkin pie.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Pride slays thanksgiving, but a humble mind is the soil out of which thanks naturally grow. A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: If you are really thankful, what do you do? You share.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.

author: Bil Keane
quote: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present.

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
quote: Time and tide wait for no man.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
quote: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.

author: John Wooden
quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Lost time is never found again.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.

author: Evelyn Waugh
quote: Punctuality is the virtue of the bored.

author: Walter Anderson
quote: Our lives improve only when we take chances - and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.

author: Bruce Springsteen
quote: When it comes to luck, you make your own.

author: Cesare Pavese
quote: If you wish to travel far and fast, travel light. Take off all your envies, jealousies, unforgiveness, selfishness and fears.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: The use of travelling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they are.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: A journey is a person in itself; no two are alike. And all plans, safeguards, policing, and coercion are fruitless. We find that after years of struggle that we do not take a trip; a trip takes us.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: The traveler sees what he sees, the tourist sees what he has come to see.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Never go on trips with anyone you do not love.

author: Giotto di Bondone
quote: Rome is the city of echoes, the city of illusions, and the city of yearning.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.

author: John Lennon
quote: As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: The connections between and among women are the most feared, the most problematic, and the most potentially transforming force on the planet.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another; but women are by nature enemies.

author: Anais Nin
quote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.

author: Evita Peron
quote: I am my own woman.

author: Charlotte Whitton
quote: Whatever women do, they must do twice as well as men to be thought half as good. Luckily, this is not difficult.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: An unjust peace is better than a just war.

author: Paul Valery
quote: War: a massacre of people who don't know each other for the profit of people who know each other but don't massacre each other.

author: Ulysses S. Grant
quote: I have never advocated war except as a means of peace.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: There was never a good war, or a bad peace.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: The most shocking fact about war is that its victims and its instruments are individual human beings, and that these individual beings are condemned by the monstrous conventions of politics to murder or be murdered in quarrels not their own.

author: Johnny Depp
quote: As a teenager I was so insecure. I was the type of guy that never fitted in because he never dared to choose. I was convinced I had absolutely no talent at all. For nothing. And that thought took away all my ambition too.

author: Samuel Ullman
quote: Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind; it is not a matter of rosy cheeks, red lips and supple knees; it is a matter of the will, quality of the imagination, a vigor of the emotions; it is the freshness of the deep springs of life.

author: Bryan White
quote: We never really grow up, we only learn how to act in public.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: The youth need to be enabled to become job generators from job seekers.

author: Friedrich Schiller
quote: Keep true to the dreams of your youth.

author: G. Stanley Hall
quote: Adolescence is a new birth, for the higher and more completely human traits are now born.

author: Eddie Vedder
quote: No matter how good you are, at some point your kids are gonna have to create their own independence and think that Mom and Dad aren't cool, just to establish themselves. That's what adolescence is about. They're gonna go through that no matter what.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Youth comes but once in a lifetime.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: Adolescents are not monsters. They are just people trying to learn how to make it among the adults in the world, who are probably not so sure themselves.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.

author: Christina Aguilera
quote: It's been quite a roller coaster ride, but I've grown and learned a lot about myself. The greatest thing is being able to interact with fans and touch people's lives... for that I give thanks.

author: Willie Nelson
quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.

author: Alfred North Whitehead
quote: No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.

author: Travis Barker
quote: Thank you for life, and all the little ups and downs that make it worth living.

author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
quote: Whatever we are waiting for - peace of mind, contentment, grace, the inner awareness of simple abundance - it will surely come to us, but only when we are ready to receive it with an open and grateful heart.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

author: Andrew Brown
quote: The Internet is so big, so powerful and pointless that for some people it is a complete substitute for life.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.

author: Unknown
quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.

author: Alan Kay
quote: People who are really serious about software should make their own hardware.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.

author: Michael J. Saylor
quote: Bitcoin is a swarm of cyber hornets serving the goddess of wisdom, feeding on the fire of truth, exponentially growing ever smarter, faster, and stronger behind a wall of encrypted energy.

author: Judd Gregg
quote: The veterans of our military services have put their lives on the line to protect the freedoms that we enjoy. They have dedicated their lives to their country and deserve to be recognized for their commitment.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: When soldiers have been baptized in the fire of a battle-field, they have all one rank in my eyes.

author: Molly Ivins
quote: The thing is this: You got to have fun while you're fightin' for freedom, 'cause you don't always win.

author: Bill Frist
quote: The valor and courage of our young women and men in the armed services are a shining example to all of the world, and we owe them and their families our deepest respect.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: Brave men are all vertebrates; they have their softness on the surface and their toughness in the middle.

author: Nick Lampson
quote: But this Veterans Day, I believe we should do more than sing the praises of the bravery and patriotism that our veterans have embodied in the past. We should take this opportunity to re-evaluate how we are treating our veterans in the present.

author: Steve Buyer
quote: Because all of us believe and understand in the fabric of the common bond of why we call ourselves American is to care for the men and women who wear the uniform; and when they take off the uniform, we care for them when they are veterans.

author: Barbara Bush
quote: Well, look at what people are doing for returned veterans now. The wounded warriors. They're working hard to make the wounded veterans feel that they are loved and welcomed home, unlike Vietnam. It was not a very kind, gentle world then. I think we are kinder and gentler.

author: Douglas MacArthur
quote: Duty, Honor, Country. Those three hallowed words reverently dictate what you ought to be, what you can be, what you will be.

author: Plautus
quote: Courage in danger is half the battle.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: Perfect Valor is to do, without a witness, all that we could do before the whole world.

author: Randy Neugebauer
quote: While only one day of the year is dedicated solely to honoring our veterans, Americans must never forget the sacrifices that many of our fellow countrymen have made to defend our country and protect our freedoms.

author: John Doolittle
quote: America's Veterans have served their country with the belief that democracy and freedom are ideals to be upheld around the world.

author: Henry Waxman
quote: The sanctity of our battlefields, monuments, and veterans institutions is of utmost importance to preserve military history and pay respect to those who fought.

author: Robert Browning
quote: So, fall asleep love, loved by me... for I know love, I am loved by thee.

author: Rupert Brooke
quote: A kiss makes the heart young again and wipes out the years.

author: Willa Cather
quote: Where there is great love, there are always wishes.

author: e. e. cummings
quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.

author: Christian Nestell Bovee
quote: It is the passion that is in a kiss that gives to it its sweetness; it is the affection in a kiss that sanctifies it.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: How did it happen that their lips came together? How does it happen that birds sing, that snow melts, that the rose unfolds, that the dawn whitens behind the stark shapes of trees on the quivering summit of the hill? A kiss, and all was said.

author: Jennifer Aniston
quote: The best smell in the world is that man that you love.

author: Allyson Felix
quote: The most important lesson that I have learned is to trust God in every circumstance. Lots of times we go through different trials and following God's plan seems like it doesn't make any sense at all. God is always in control and he will never leave us.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: You must trust and believe in people or life becomes impossible.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: He who does not trust enough, Will not be trusted.

author: Sophocles
quote: Trust dies but mistrust blossoms.

author: Munshi Premchand
quote: Trust is the first step to love.

author: Booker T. Washington
quote: Few things can help an individual more than to place responsibility on him, and to let him know that you trust him.

author: Eric Sevareid
quote: Better to trust the man who is frequently in error than the one who is never in doubt.

author: Arthur Ashe
quote: Trust has to be earned, and should come only after the passage of time.

author: Hillary Clinton
quote: In almost every profession - whether it's law or journalism, finance or medicine or academia or running a small business - people rely on confidential communications to do their jobs. We count on the space of trust that confidentiality provides. When someone breaches that trust, we are all worse off for it.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: Sometimes it is said that man cannot be trusted with the government of himself. Can he, then be trusted with the government of others? Or have we found angels in the form of kings to govern him? Let history answer this question.

author: Herodotus
quote: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.

author: Amelia Earhart
