quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.

author: Plato
quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.

author: Morihei Ueshiba
quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: He who is brave is free.

author: Franklin P. Jones
quote: Bravery is being the only one who knows you're afraid.

author: Gwen Stefani
quote: I remember when I was in school, they would ask, 'What are you going to be when you grow up?' and then you'd have to draw a picture of it. I drew a picture of myself as a bride.

author: Debra Messing
quote: I don't think it's possible to have a wedding without it being stressful!

author: Emily Blunt
quote: Personally, I'm an advocate for short engagements. Long sometimes means there is a reason for it. Two years engaged and no wedding... I'd be upset.

author: Mike Epps
quote: I don't know nothing about no marriages or nothing. I ain't even never been to a wedding.

author: Helen Hunt Jackson
quote: O month when they who love must love and wed.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: In Hollywood, brides keep the bouquets and throw away the groom.

author: Vera Wang
quote: When I decided to get married at 40, I couldn't find a dress with the modernity or sophistication I wanted. That's when I saw the opportunity for a wedding gown business.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: Our dog died from licking our wedding picture.

author: Joseph Addison
quote: A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.

author: Heinrich Heine
quote: The Wedding March always reminds me of the music played when soldiers go into battle.

author: Peter Ustinov
quote: Monica Seles: I'd hate to be next door to her on her wedding night.

author: Lord Byron
quote: I have great hopes that we shall love each other all our lives as much as if we had never married at all.

author: Liz Smith
quote: All weddings, except those with shotguns in evidence, are wonderful.

author: Jane Seymour
quote: I think a lot of people get so obsessed with the wedding and the expense of the wedding that they miss out on what the real purpose is. It's not about a production number, it's about a meaningful moment between two people that's witnessed by people that they actually really know and care about.

author: Jerry O'Connell
quote: I get very nervous when I have to take my wedding ring off.

author: Jessi Klein
quote: I see an insidious problem in the marketing of weddings as 'the happiest day of your life.' The pressure that is placed upon this event to be the alpha and omega of your entire existence makes it, I think, into a kind of nuptial New Year's Eve, and we all know how that usually turns out.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.

author: Robert H. Schuller
quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.

author: Walt Disney
quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Once you label me you negate me.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.

author: Josh McDowell
quote: Christ appeared alive on several occasions after the cataclysmic events of that first Easter.

author: Michael Leunig
quote: Easter is reflecting upon suffering for one thing, but it also reflects upon Jesus and his non compliance in the face of great authority where he holds to his truth - so there's two stories there.

author: Olivia De Havilland
quote: I read the Scriptures at the American Cathedral on Christmas and Easter; that's it. It's a task I love.

author: William Tyndale
quote: To see how Christ was prophesied and described therein, consider and mark, how that the kid or lamb must be with out spot or blemish; and so was Christ only of all mankind, in the sight of God and of his law.

author: Frederica Mathewes-Green
quote: Easter may seem boring to children, and it is blessedly unencumbered by the silly fun that plagues Christmas. Yet it contains the one thing needful for every human life: the good news of Resurrection.

author: Michael Leunig
quote: It is at Easter that Jesus is most human, and like all humans, he fails and is failed. His is not an all-powerful God, it is an all-vulnerable God.

author: Spike Milligan
quote: The experience of being in the Army changed my whole life; I never believed that an organization such as ours could ever go to war, leave alone win it. It was, as Yeats remarked of the Easter Rising, 'A terrible beauty.'

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Those have a short Lent who owe money to be paid at Easter.

author: Jane Elliot
quote: I loved raising my kids. I loved the process, the dirt of it, the tears of it, the frustration of it, Christmas, Easter, birthdays, growth charts, pediatrician appointments. I loved all of it.

author: Robert H. Schuller
quote: I built my church on Easter services, Christmas Eve services, and Norman Vincent Peale.

author: Hilary Farr
quote: Every Easter, at one household or another, I find a battle begins and the conversation of how to 'properly eat' a chocolate bunny.

author: Jacques Torres
quote: I understand Christmas, and I understand Easter. But Halloween is one of those things where, if you don't grow with it? The French, they tried Halloween for a few years, and I think they're dropping it.

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
quote: Easter is an arts and crafts moment where your whole family and friends can get involved.

author: Adam Brody
quote: And in a world without heroes, as the movie trailer voice-over guy might say, the slightly awkward can be slightly cool.

author: Jack Welch
quote: I was afraid of the internet... because I couldn't type.

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quote: A wonderful thing about a book, in contrast to a computer screen, is that you can take it to bed with you.

author: Doug Larson
quote: Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: Reading computer manuals without the hardware is as frustrating as reading sex manuals without the software.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.

author: Dave Parnas
quote: As a rule, software systems do not work well until they have been used, and have failed repeatedly, in real applications.

author: Seymour Cray
quote: I just bought a Mac to help me design the next Cray.

author: Gillian Anderson
quote: I hope everyone that is reading this is having a really good day. And if you are not, just know that in every new minute that passes you have an opportunity to change that.

author: Harold Wilson
quote: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.

author: Rupert Murdoch
quote: The world is changing very fast. Big will not beat small anymore. It will be the fast beating the slow.

author: Sydney J. Harris
quote: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.

author: Bill Copeland
quote: Not only is women's work never done, the definition keeps changing.

author: Keri Russell
quote: Sometimes it's the smallest decisions that can change your life forever.

author: Andy Rooney
quote: One of the most glorious messes in the world is the mess created in the living room on Christmas day. Don't clean it up too quickly.

author: Phillips Brooks
quote: The earth has grown old with its burden of care, but at Christmas it always is young, the heart of the jewel burns lustrous and fair, and its soul full of music breaks the air, when the song of angels is sung.

author: Star Jones
quote: My dad taught me true words you have to use in every relationship. Yes, baby.

author: Billie Joe Armstrong
quote: I'm a father. It isn't just my life any more. I don't want my kid finding bottles in the house or seeing his father completely smashed.

author: Byron Dorgan
quote: Working hard and working smart sometimes can be two different things.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
quote: The supreme accomplishment is to blur the line between work and play.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: Management is nothing more than motivating other people.

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: Inspiration comes of working every day.

author: John Locke
quote: All wealth is the product of labor.

author: Dylan Thomas
quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.

author: Horace
quote: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.

author: A. A. Milne
quote: Organizing is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it is not all mixed up.

author: Nick Carter
quote: It's like Forrest Gump said, 'Life is like a box of chocolates.' Your career is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you're going to get. But everything you get is going to teach you something along the way and make you the person you are today. That's the exciting part - it's an adventure in itself.

author: L'Wren Scott
quote: I believe in stopping work and eating lunch.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth - and truth rewarded me.

author: Norman Cousins
quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: That though the radiance which was once so bright be now forever taken from my sight. Though nothing can bring back the hour of splendor in the grass, glory in the flower. We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet, strange, I am ungrateful to those teachers.

author: Alexander the Great
quote: I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul.

author: Solomon Ortiz
quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.

author: Confucius
quote: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: I have come to believe that a great teacher is a great artist and that there are as few as there are any other great artists. Teaching might even be the greatest of the arts since the medium is the human mind and spirit.

author: Anatole France
quote: The whole art of teaching is only the art of awakening the natural curiosity of young minds for the purpose of satisfying it afterwards.

author: Christa McAuliffe
quote: I touch the future. I teach.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: My cooking is so bad my kids thought Thanksgiving was to commemorate Pearl Harbor.

author: Frank A. Clark
quote: If a fellow isn't thankful for what he's got, he isn't likely to be thankful for what he's going to get.

author: Jon Stewart
quote: I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land.

author: Irv Kupcinet
quote: An optimist is a person who starts a new diet on Thanksgiving Day.

author: Konrad von Gesner
quote: Best of all is it to preserve everything in a pure, still heart, and let there be for every pulse a thanksgiving, and for every breath a song.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.

author: Robert Collier
quote: Success is the sum of small efforts - repeated day in and day out.

author: Vince Lombardi
quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.

author: Edward Everett Hale
quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in.

author: Thomas Hardy
quote: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.

author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield
quote: Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.

author: William Gibson
quote: Time moves in one direction, memory in another.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: What then is time? If no one asks me, I know what it is. If I wish to explain it to him who asks, I do not know.

author: Earl Nightingale
quote: Don't let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: How did it get so late so soon? Its night before its afternoon. December is here before its June. My goodness how the time has flewn. How did it get so late so soon?

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: Nobody sees a flower really; it is so small. We haven't time, and to see takes time - like to have a friend takes time.

author: Thomas Hardy
quote: Some folk want their luck buttered.

author: Walter Scott
quote: One hour of life, crowded to the full with glorious action, and filled with noble risks, is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum, in which men steal through existence, like sluggish waters through a marsh, without either honor or observation.

author: Richard Dawkins
quote: The chances of each of us coming into existence are infinitesimally small, and even though we shall all die some day, we should count ourselves fantastically lucky to get our decades in the sun.

author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
quote: I must learn to love the fool in me - the one who feels too much, talks too much, takes too many chances, wins sometimes and loses often, lacks self-control, loves and hates, hurts and gets hurt, promises and breaks promises, laughs and cries.

author: George S. Patton
quote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.

author: David Packard
quote: Take risks. Ask big questions. Don't be afraid to make mistakes; if you don't make mistakes, you're not reaching far enough.

author: Elon Musk
quote: I would like to die on Mars. Just not on impact.

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: The moon is a friend for the lonesome to talk to.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.

author: Sally Ride
quote: The stars don't look bigger, but they do look brighter.

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: Modern science says: 'The sun is the past, the earth is the present, the moon is the future.' From an incandescent mass we have originated, and into a frozen mass we shall turn. Merciless is the law of nature, and rapidly and irresistibly we are drawn to our doom.

author: Marshall McLuhan
quote: There are no passengers on spaceship earth. We are all crew.

author: Frank Borman
quote: Exploration is really the essence of the human spirit.

author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
quote: Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.

author: Mary Ritter Beard
quote: Certainly, travel is more than the seeing of sights; it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: He travels the fastest who travels alone.

author: Wilbur Wright
quote: The desire to fly is an idea handed down to us by our ancestors who... looked enviously on the birds soaring freely through space... on the infinite highway of the air.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.

author: Hans Christian Andersen
quote: Travelling expands the mind rarely.

author: George Carlin
quote: What does it mean to pre-board? Do you get on before you get on?

author: Lin Yutang
quote: No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow.

author: John Muir
quote: To the lover of wilderness, Alaska is one of the most wonderful countries in the world.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote; they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: No doubt exists that all women are crazy; it's only a question of degree.

author: Camille Paglia
quote: Woman is the dominant sex. Men have to do all sorts of stuff to prove that they are worthy of woman's attention.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot.

author: Mary Shelley
quote: I do not wish women to have power over men; but over themselves.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.

author: Jeannette Rankin
quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: War is a defeat for humanity.

author: Thomas Mann
quote: War is only a cowardly escape from the problems of peace.

author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
quote: A state of war only serves as an excuse for domestic tyranny.

author: Shel Silverstein
quote: I will not play tug o' war. I'd rather play hug o' war. Where everyone hugs instead of tugs, Where everyone giggles and rolls on the rug, Where everyone kisses, and everyone grins, and everyone cuddles, and everyone wins.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: It is incumbent on every generation to pay its own debts as it goes. A principle which if acted on would save one-half the wars of the world.

author: Francois Fenelon
quote: All wars are civil wars, because all men are brothers.

author: William Westmoreland
quote: The military don't start wars. Politicians start wars.

author: George McGovern
quote: I'm fed up to the ears with old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.

author: John Stuart Mill
quote: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse.

author: John Adams
quote: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.

author: Havelock Ellis
quote: There is nothing that war has ever achieved that we could not better achieve without it.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: There will one day spring from the brain of science a machine or force so fearful in its potentialities, so absolutely terrifying, that even man, the fighter, who will dare torture and death in order to inflict torture and death, will be appalled, and so abandon war forever.

author: Carol Burnett
quote: Adolescence is just one big walking pimple.

author: Louise J. Kaplan
quote: Adolescence is the conjugator of childhood and adulthood.

author: Thomas Friedman
quote: When I was growing up, my parents told me, 'Finish your dinner. People in China and India are starving.' I tell my daughters, 'Finish your homework. People in India and China are starving for your job.'

author: Marilyn vos Savant
quote: Teens think listening to music helps them concentrate. It doesn't. It relieves them of the boredom that concentration on homework induces.

author: David Elkind
quote: Friendships in childhood are usually a matter of chance, whereas in adolescence they are most often a matter of choice.

author: Anita Brookner
quote: Time misspent in youth is sometimes all the freedom one ever has.

author: Sophia Bush
quote: Being a teenager is an amazing time and a hard time. It's when you make your best friends - I have girls who will never leave my heart and I still talk to. You get the best and the worst as a teen. You have the best friendships and the worst heartbreaks.

author: Victoria Justice
quote: Being a teen can be tough. Just try to surround yourself with really good friends that really have your back, and also be a really good friend to those who really care about you. If you're not sure about certain things, talk to your friends that you trust and your family.

author: Joan Chen
quote: All teenagers have this desire to somehow run away.

author: Mary Pipher
quote: Adolescence is when girls experience social pressure to put aside their authentic selves and to display only a small portion of their gifts.

author: Aesop
quote: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.

author: Ralph Marston
quote: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.

author: John Wooden
quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.

author: Karl Barth
quote: Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.

author: Usain Bolt
quote: I'd like to say to all my fans out there, thanks for the support. And to all my doubters, thank you very much because you guys have also pushed me.

author: Alice Walker
quote: 'Thank you' is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.

author: Alan Cohen
quote: Appreciation is the highest form of prayer, for it acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.

author: Serena Williams
quote: I'm thankful to my family, friends, and fans for all of their support.

author: Tecumseh
quote: When you rise in the morning, give thanks for the light, for your life, for your strength. Give thanks for your food and for the joy of living. If you see no reason to give thanks, the fault lies in yourself.

author: B. F. Skinner
quote: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.

author: Omar N. Bradley
quote: If we continue to develop our technology without wisdom or prudence, our servant may prove to be our executioner.

author: Mitch Kapor
quote: Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.

author: Bob Dole
quote: The internet is a great way to get on the net.

author: Alfred North Whitehead
quote: Civilization advances by extending the number of important operations which we can perform without thinking of them.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: The march of science and technology does not imply growing intellectual complexity in the lives of most people. It often means the opposite.

author: Dan Lipinski
quote: On this Veterans Day, let us remember the service of our veterans, and let us renew our national promise to fulfill our sacred obligations to our veterans and their families who have sacrificed so much so that we can live free.

author: John Warner
quote: Tragically, the effort to make America and the world safer and to defend freedom around the world is not without an enormous cost to this Nation in terms primarily of lost lives and those who bear the scars and the wounds of war, and their families who must bear these losses.

author: John Linder
quote: Our soldiers have nobly fought to protect freedom since our country's birth, and have fought to protect those that could not protect themselves, even in foreign lands when called upon.

author: Charles B. Rangel
quote: Honoring the sacrifices many have made for our country in the name of freedom and democracy is the very foundation of Veterans Day.

author: R. Lee Ermey
quote: America's trying to do the best for its veterans.

author: Chris Kyle
quote: I'm trying to raise the awareness of the troops that, when they deploy and go to war, it's not just them at war - it's also their family. Their family is having to go through all the hardships and the stresses.

author: John Boehner
quote: Spending time with America's soldiers is always inspiring.

author: Thomas Hood
quote: Oh, if it be to choose and call thee mine, love, thou art every day my Valentine!

author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec
quote: Love is when the desire to be desired takes you so badly that you feel you could die of it.

author: William Penn
quote: Only trust thyself, and another shall not betray thee.

author: Robert E. Lee
quote: I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.

author: Gisele Bundchen
quote: The more you trust your intuition, the more empowered you become, the stronger you become, and the happier you become.

author: Anne Wilson Schaef
quote: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.

author: Eubie Blake
quote: Never trust anyone who wants what you've got. Friend or no, envy is an overwhelming emotion.

author: Walter Anderson
quote: We're never so vulnerable than when we trust someone - but paradoxically, if we cannot trust, neither can we find love or joy.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Boldness be my friend.

author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
quote: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.

author: J. K. Rowling
quote: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.

author: Jim Hightower
quote: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.

author: Haile Selassie
quote: We must become bigger than we have been: more courageous, greater in spirit, larger in outlook. We must become members of a new race, overcoming petty prejudice, owing our ultimate allegiance not to nations but to our fellow men within the human community.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: We must build dikes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.

author: Socrates
quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it.

author: Helen Rowland
quote: Wedding: the point at which a man stops toasting a woman and begins roasting her.

author: Elizabeth Gilbert
quote: I think a lot of people who feel as though they desperately want to be married oftentimes simply desperately want to have a wedding.

author: Samuel Pepys
quote: Saw a wedding in the church. It was strange to see what delight we married people have to see these poor fools decoyed into our condition.

author: Sinead O'Connor
quote: People always complain, 'you never invited me to your wedding', but I prefer casual weddings.

author: Peter O'Toole
quote: For me, life has either been a wake or a wedding.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.

author: Elizabeth Kenny
quote: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.

author: Muriel Strode
quote: I will not follow where the path may lead, but I will go where there is no path, and I will leave a trail.

author: A. C. Benson
quote: People seldom refuse help, if one offers it in the right way.

author: Margaret Thatcher
quote: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.

author: Steve Harvey
quote: I don't think it's cool for people to say, 'You shouldn't reference God because I don't believe that, and I don't want to hear it.' Well, there's a lot of stuff I don't believe that I still gotta hear.

author: Bruce Schneier
quote: I am regularly asked what the average Internet user can do to ensure his security. My first answer is usually 'Nothing; you're screwed'.

author: Jef Raskin
quote: Imagine if every Thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining.

author: Alain Robert
quote: Modern people are only willing to believe in their computers, while I believe in myself.

author: Jonathan Shapiro
quote: Gee, I am a complete Luddite when it comes to computers, I can barely log on!

author: Paul Vixie
quote: The internet is not for sissies.

author: Flannery O'Connor
quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.

author: William Glasser
quote: If you want to change attitudes, start with a change in behavior.

author: Timothy Leary
quote: You're only as young as the last time you changed your mind.

author: Arnold Bennett
quote: Any change, even a change for the better, is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.

author: Aristotle
quote: Change in all things is sweet.

author: Jeff Bezos
quote: What's dangerous is not to evolve.

author: Thomas S. Monson
quote: The spirit of Christmas is the spirit of love and of generosity and of goodness. It illuminates the picture window of the soul, and we look out upon the world's busy life and become more interested in people than in things.

author: B. C. Forbes
quote: Christmas is a tonic for our souls. It moves us to think of others rather than of ourselves. It directs our thoughts to giving.

author: Victor Borge
quote: Santa Claus has the right idea - visit people only once a year.

author: Gwyneth Paltrow
quote: My father, he was like the rock, the guy you went to with every problem.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: I know you've heard it a thousand times before. But it's true - hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. If you don't love something, then don't do it.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.

author: Harold S. Geneen
quote: It is an immutable law in business that words are words, explanations are explanations, promises are promises-but only performance is reality.

author: Harold Wilson
quote: One man's wage increase is another man's price increase.

author: Stevie Wonder
quote: Ya gots to work with what you gots to work with.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: Every noble work is at first impossible.

author: Frank Gehry
quote: For me, every day is a new thing. I approach each project with a new insecurity, almost like the first project I ever did. And I get the sweats. I go in and start working, I'm not sure where I'm going. If I knew where I was going I wouldn't do it.

author: Bob Dylan
quote: All the truth in the world adds up to one big lie.

author: Niels Bohr
quote: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.

author: Lord Byron
quote: Adversity is the first path to truth.

author: Shel Silverstein
quote: Tell me I'm clever, Tell me I'm kind, Tell me I'm talented, Tell me I'm cute, Tell me I'm sensitive, Graceful and wise, Tell me I'm perfect - But tell me the truth.

author: Confucius
quote: The object of the superior man is truth.

author: Arthur Miller
quote: Betrayal is the only truth that sticks.

author: David Bowie
quote: The truth is of course is that there is no journey. We are arriving and departing all at the same time.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Truth is so rare that it is delightful to tell it.

author: Georges Braque
quote: Truth exists; only lies are invented.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: The truth is more important than the facts.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.

author: John Calvin
quote: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: We must reject the idea that every time a law's broken, society is guilty rather than the lawbreaker. It is time to restore the American precept that each individual is accountable for his actions.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children.

author: James Baldwin
quote: The most dangerous creation of any society is the man who has nothing to lose.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Think where man's glory most begins and ends, and say my glory was I had such friends.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: We have always found the Irish a bit odd. They refuse to be English.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
quote: I love everything that's old, - old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wine.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.

author: Hilaire Belloc
quote: Loss and possession, death and life are one, There falls no shadow where there shines no sun.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Unable are the loved to die, for love is immortality.

author: Aeschylus
quote: There is no pain so great as the memory of joy in present grief.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

author: Corrie Ten Boom
quote: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow. It empties today of its strength.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.

author: Steve Harvey
quote: Failure is a great teacher, and I think when you make mistakes and you recover from them and you treat them as valuable learning experiences, then you've got something to share.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts.

author: John Strachan
quote: To this end the greatest asset of a school is the personality of the teacher.

author: Charles Kuralt
quote: Good teachers know how to bring out the best in students.

author: John Henrik Clarke
quote: A good teacher, like a good entertainer first must hold his audience's attention, then he can teach his lesson.

author: Mark Van Doren
quote: The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.

author: Edward Teller
quote: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: Problems are not the problem; coping is the problem.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: Thanksgiving dinners take eighteen hours to prepare. They are consumed in twelve minutes. Half-times take twelve minutes. This is not coincidence.

author: Storm Jameson
quote: For what I have received may the Lord make me truly thankful. And more truly for what I have not received.

author: Amy Grant
quote: Thanksgiving Day is a good day to recommit our energies to giving thanks and just giving.

author: Nigel Hamilton
quote: Thanksgiving is a time of togetherness and gratitude.

author: Lawrence Welk
quote: Over and over I marvel at the blessings of my life: Each year has grown better than the last.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.

author: Gary Lineker
quote: Football is a simple game. Twenty-two men chase a ball for 90 minutes and at the end, the Germans always win.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: When the going gets weird, the weird turn pro.

author: Mark Twain
quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.

author: Henry Ford
quote: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.

author: Bill Gates
quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.

author: Joseph Hall
quote: Perfection is the child of time.

author: Jules Verne
quote: Put two ships in the open sea, without wind or tide, and, at last, they will come together. Throw two planets into space, and they will fall one on the other. Place two enemies in the midst of a crowd, and they will inevitably meet; it is a fatality, a question of time; that is all.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.

author: Pericles
quote: Time is the wisest counselor of all.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Necessity is the mother of taking chances.

author: Garth Brooks
quote: Just keep taking chances and having fun.

author: Konstantin Tsiolkovsky
quote: The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever.

author: Steven Wright
quote: If you are in a spaceship that is traveling at the speed of light, and you turn on the headlights, does anything happen?

author: Kalpana Chawla
quote: When you look at the stars and the galaxy, you feel that you are not just from any particular piece of land, but from the solar system.

author: Valentina Tereshkova
quote: Hey sky, take off your hat, I'm on my way!

author: Carl Sagan
quote: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: I dislike feeling at home when I am abroad.

author: Dan Rather
quote: If all difficulties were known at the outset of a long journey, most of us would never start out at all.

author: Satchel Paige
quote: Airplanes may kill you, but they ain't likely to hurt you.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: One travels more usefully when alone, because he reflects more.

author: Solange Knowles
quote: You get educated by traveling.

author: Clifton Fadiman
quote: When you travel, remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.

author: Truman Capote
quote: Venice is like eating an entire box of chocolate liqueurs in one go.

author: Alphonse de Lamartine
quote: If one had but a single glance to give the world, one should gaze on Istanbul.

author: Michael Palin
quote: I am not a great cook, I am not a great artist, but I love art, and I love food, so I am the perfect traveller.

author: Lawrence Durrell
quote: Travel can be one of the most rewarding forms of introspection.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: Paris is always a good idea.

author: Al Gore
quote: Airplane travel is nature's way of making you look like your passport photo.

author: Barbara De Angelis
quote: Women need real moments of solitude and self-reflection to balance out how much of ourselves we give away.

author: Joseph Conrad
quote: Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men.

author: Cher
quote: Women are the real architects of society.

author: Kat Graham
quote: There was a time when men thought it was sexy to have a housewife waiting for him to come home from work in her slippers, but in modern society, I think an independent woman is even more sexy.

author: Anna Quindlen
quote: After all those years as a woman hearing 'not thin enough, not pretty enough, not smart enough, not this enough, not that enough,' almost overnight I woke up one morning and thought, 'I'm enough.'

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: I feel there is something unexplored about woman that only a woman can explore.

author: Anna Held
quote: A woman should be like a single flower, not a whole bouquet.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: You can tell the strength of a nation by the women behind its men.

author: Sophie Tucker
quote: From birth to age 18 a girl needs good parents. From 18 to 35 she needs good looks. From 35 to 55 she needs a good personality. From 55 on, she needs good cash.

author: Audre Lorde
quote: I write for those women who do not speak, for those who do not have a voice because they were so terrified, because we are taught to respect fear more than ourselves. We've been taught that silence would save us, but it won't.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.

author: Sofia Vergara
quote: I guess at the end of the day, all women like to be appreciated and treated with respect and kindness.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: In our society, the women who break down barriers are those who ignore limits.

author: Farrah Fawcett
quote: God gave women intuition and femininity. Used properly, the combination easily jumbles the brain of any man I've ever met.

author: Will Rogers
quote: You can't say civilization don't advance... in every war they kill you in a new way.

author: Euripides
quote: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head.

author: Joan Baez
quote: If it's natural to kill, how come men have to go into training to learn how?

author: Omar N. Bradley
quote: Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war that we know about peace, more about killing that we know about living.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: Sometime they'll give a war and nobody will come.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.

author: Erwin Rommel
quote: Sweat saves blood.

author: William Tecumseh Sherman
quote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.

author: Plautus
quote: Conquered, we conquer.

author: Unknown
quote: All warfare is based on deception.

author: John Abbott
quote: War is the science of destruction.

author: Gilbert Parker
quote: War is cruelty, and none can make it gentle.

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Wars have never hurt anybody except the people who die.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.

author: Donald Rumsfeld
quote: If it were a fact, it wouldn't be called intelligence.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: It is not only the living who are killed in war.

author: John Paul Jones
quote: I have not yet begun to fight!

author: Sallust
quote: In battle it is the cowards who run the most risk; bravery is a rampart of defense.

author: Constance Baker Motley
quote: I grew up in a house where nobody had to tell me to go to school every day and do my homework.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: We must tell girls their voices are important.

author: Ethel Waters
quote: I wanted to be with the kind of people I'd grown up with, but you can't go back to them and be one of them again, no matter how hard you try.

author: Jules Feiffer
quote: Maturity is only a short break in adolescence.

author: Justin Timberlake
quote: My teenage years were exactly what they were supposed to be. Everybody has their own path. It's laid out for you. It's just up to you to walk it.

author: Fran Lebowitz
quote: As a teenager you are at the last stage in your life when you will be happy to hear that the phone is for you.

author: Fred G. Gosman
quote: Teenagers who are never required to vacuum are living in one.

author: Marian Wright Edelman
quote: To all those mothers and fathers who are struggling with teen-agers, I say, just be patient: even though it looks like you can't do anything right for a number of years, parents become popular again when kids reach 20.

author: Robert Cormier
quote: I have always had a sense that we are all pretty much alone in life, particularly in adolescence.

author: Vanessa Hudgens
quote: So many people try to grow up too fast, and it's not fun! You should stay a kid as long as possible!

author: Winona Ryder
quote: You've got to grow up sometime.

author: Jena Malone
quote: Adolescence isn't just about prom or wearing sparkly dresses.

author: Jamie Lee Curtis
quote: If you just watch a teenager, you see a lot of uncertainty.

author: Alan Ladd
quote: Time scoots along pretty fast when you grow up.

author: James Allen
quote: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: When you practice gratefulness, there is a sense of respect toward others.

author: Algernon Charles Swinburne
quote: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.

author: Aristotle
quote: It is just that we should be grateful, not only to those with whose views we may agree, but also to those who have expressed more superficial views; for these also contributed something, by developing before us the powers of thought.

author: Stephen Colbert
quote: Thankfully, dreams can change. If we'd all stuck with our first dream, the world would be overrun with cowboys and princesses.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.

author: John Milton
quote: Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies, those transcendent moments of awe that change forever how we experience life and the world.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: I know that when I pray, something wonderful happens. Not just to the person or persons for whom I'm praying, but also something wonderful happens to me. I'm grateful that I'm heard.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: Be grateful for what you have and stop complaining - it bores everybody else, does you no good, and doesn't solve any problems.

author: Richard Carlson
quote: The trick is to be grateful when your mood is high and graceful when it is low.

author: Tom Felton
quote: Whatever life throws at me I'll take it and be grateful for it as well.

author: Alphonse Karr
quote: Some people are always grumbling because roses have thorns; I am thankful that thorns have roses.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Never take anything for granted.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: There's no happier person than a truly thankful, content person.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: Let us be grateful to the mirror for revealing to us our appearance only.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.

author: Eckhart Tolle
quote: I'm grateful for always this moment, the now, no matter what form it takes.

author: Kristin Armstrong
quote: I write about the power of trying, because I want to be okay with failing. I write about generosity because I battle selfishness. I write about joy because I know sorrow. I write about faith because I almost lost mine, and I know what it is to be broken and in need of redemption. I write about gratitude because I am thankful - for all of it.

author: Gertrude Stein
quote: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Success in creating AI would be the biggest event in human history. Unfortunately, it might also be the last, unless we learn how to avoid the risks.

author: Richard P. Feynman
quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for Nature cannot be fooled.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: The world is very different now. For man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms of human poverty, and all forms of human life.

author: Tim O'Reilly
quote: What new technology does is create new opportunities to do a job that customers want done.

author: James Surowiecki
quote: Technology is supposed to make our lives easier, allowing us to do things more quickly and efficiently. But too often it seems to make things harder, leaving us with fifty-button remote controls, digital cameras with hundreds of mysterious features and book-length manuals, and cars with dashboard systems worthy of the space shuttle.

author: Demetri Martin
quote: The digital camera is a great invention because it allows us to reminisce. Instantly.

author: Tim Berners-Lee
quote: The Web as I envisaged it, we have not seen it yet. The future is still so much bigger than the past.

author: Jonathan Sacks
quote: Technology gives us power, but it does not and cannot tell us how to use that power. Thanks to technology, we can instantly communicate across the world, but it still doesn't help us know what to say.

author: Fred Allen
quote: Television is a medium because anything well done is rare.

author: Clive James
quote: It is only when they go wrong that machines remind you how powerful they are.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: A friendship that like love is warm; A love like friendship, steady.

author: Fernando Pessoa
quote: Look, there's no metaphysics on earth like chocolates.

author: Jay Leno
quote: Today is Valentine's Day - or, as men like to call it, Extortion Day!

author: Rumi
quote: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.

author: John Keats
quote: You are always new, the last of your kisses was ever the sweetest.

author: Margaret Atwood
quote: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them: there ought to be as many for love.

author: Ethel Merman
quote: Everything's coming up roses - for me.

author: Clara Schumann
quote: I do not want horses or diamonds - I am happy in possessing you.

author: Nicholas Sparks
quote: Romance is thinking about your significant other, when you are supposed to be thinking about something else.

author: Robert Orben
quote: I got a Valentine's Day card from my girl. It said, 'Take my heart! Take my arms! Take my lips!' Which is just like her. Keeping the best part for herself.

author: Donatella Versace
quote: I like perfume and flowers.

author: Pope Francis
quote: Although the life of a person is in a land full of thorns and weeds, there is always a space in which the good seed can grow. You have to trust God.

author: Isaac Watts
quote: Learning to trust is one of life's most difficult tasks.

author: Horace
quote: Seize the day, and put the least possible trust in tomorrow.

author: Stanley Baldwin
quote: I would rather trust a woman's instinct than a man's reason.

author: Saint Teresa of Avila
quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.

author: Alan Cohen
quote: It takes a lot of courage to release the familiar and seemingly secure, to embrace the new. But there is no real security in what is no longer meaningful. There is more security in the adventurous and exciting, for in movement there is life, and in change there is power.

author: Erich Fromm
quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: The eagle has no fear of adversity. We need to be like the eagle and have a fearless spirit of a conqueror!

author: Don Miguel Ruiz
quote: Don't Make Assumptions. Find the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life.

author: E. F. Schumacher
quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger and more complex... It takes a touch of genius - and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: One man with courage is a majority.

author: George Ade
quote: If it were not for the presents, an elopement would be preferable.

author: Jessica Simpson
quote: I don't ever really feel that wearing my wedding ring is what determines me being married or not.

author: Anna Quindlen
quote: Women who marry early are often overly enamored of the kind of man who looks great in wedding pictures and passes the maid of honor his telephone number.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Erykah Badu
quote: Man, I don't want to have nothing to do with computers. I don't want the government in my business.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Design is the fundamental soul of a man-made creation that ends up expressing itself in successive outer layers of the product or service. The iMac is not just the color or translucence or the shape of the shell. The essence of the iMac is to be the finest possible consumer computer in which each element plays together.

author: Jean Rostand
quote: Think? Why think! We have computers to do that for us.

author: Seth Lloyd
quote: Computers are famous for being able to do complicated things starting from simple programs.

author: Bill McCollum
quote: We demand privacy, yet we glorify those that break into computers.

author: Walter F. Mondale
quote: What do we want our kids to do? Sweep up around Japanese computers?

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible decision can be made any longer without taking into account not only the world as it is, but the world as it will be.

author: Robert Anthony
quote: When you blame others, you give up your power to change.

author: Irene Peter
quote: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.

author: Jack Layton
quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Change alone is eternal, perpetual, immortal.

author: Georg C. Lichtenberg
quote: I cannot say whether things will get better if we change; what I can say is they must change if they are to get better.

author: Woodrow Wilson
quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.

author: Alexander Smith
quote: Christmas is the day that holds all time together.

author: Amy Grant
quote: Faith is salted and peppered through everything at Christmas. And I love at least one night by the Christmas tree to sing and feel the quiet holiness of that time that's set apart to celebrate love, friendship, and God's gift of the Christ child.

author: Bryce Courtenay
quote: People say I don't write books, I make Christmas presents.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!

author: Thomas S. Monson
quote: My brothers and sisters, true love is a reflection of the Savior's love. In December of each year we call it the Christmas spirit. You can hear it. You can see it. You can feel it.

author: Frances Wright
quote: Pets, like their owners, tend to expand a little over the Christmas period.

author: Richard Bach
quote: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: Luck? I don't know anything about luck. I've never banked on it and I'm afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: Hard work - and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.

author: Ginger Rogers
quote: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.

author: Gary Sinise
quote: Careers, like rockets, don't always take off on time. The trick is to always keep the engine running.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: Sometimes the truth hurts. And sometimes it feels real good.

author: Wallace Stevens
quote: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: A lie which is half a truth is ever the blackest of lies.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The words of truth are always paradoxical.

author: Albert Camus
quote: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.

author: Robert Kennedy
quote: Every society gets the kind of criminal it deserves. What is equally true is that every community gets the kind of law enforcement it insists on.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: All that is valuable in human society depends upon the opportunity for development accorded the individual.

author: Aristotle
quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's future. And we are all mortal.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: The most violent element in society is ignorance.

author: Alexander Hamilton
quote: I think the first duty of society is justice.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
quote: Anyway, no drug, not even alcohol, causes the fundamental ills of society. If we're looking for the source of our troubles, we shouldn't test people for drugs, we should test them for stupidity, ignorance, greed and love of power.

author: John Lennon
quote: Our society is run by insane people for insane objectives. I think we're being run by maniacs for maniacal ends and I think I'm liable to be put away as insane for expressing that. That's what's insane about it.

author: Eminem
quote: I say what I want to say and do what I want to do. There's no in between. People will either love you for it or hate you for it.

author: Karl Marx
quote: Society does not consist of individuals but expresses the sum of interrelations, the relations within which these individuals stand.

author: Denzel Washington
quote: I say luck is when an opportunity comes along and you're prepared for it.

author: Reba McEntire
quote: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.

author: Jimmy Dean
quote: You gotta try your luck at least once a day, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

author: Socrates
quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: Luck is believing you're lucky.

author: George William Russell
quote: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: Fond memory brings the light of other days around me.

author: Saint Patrick
quote: Christ beside me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ within me, Christ beneath me, Christ above me.

author: John Boyle O'Reilly
quote: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.

author: Keanu Reeves
quote: Grief changes shape, but it never ends.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
quote: Grief is the price we pay for love.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: Sorrow can be alleviated by good sleep, a bath and a glass of wine.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.

author: Confucius
quote: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish; Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.

author: Voltaire
quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: Any mind that is capable of real sorrow is capable of good.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: I am not interested in picking up crumbs of compassion thrown from the table of someone who considers himself my master. I want the full menu of rights.

author: Billy Graham
quote: No matter how prepared you think you are for the death of a loved one, it still comes as a shock, and it still hurts very deeply.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.

author: Marcel Proust
quote: Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Come away, O human child: To the waters and the wild with a fairy, hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.

author: Dirk Benedict
quote: Life has never been easy. Nor is it meant to be. It is a matter of being joyous in the face of sorrow.

author: Denis Waitley
quote: A smile is the light in your window that tells others that there is a caring, sharing person inside.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.

author: Douglas Horton
quote: Smile, it's free therapy.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.

author: Leigh Hunt
quote: Colors are the smiles of nature.

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.

author: Lily Tomlin
quote: I like a teacher who gives you something to take home to think about besides homework.

author: Ralph Nader
quote: Your best teacher is your last mistake.

author: Elisabeth Rohm
quote: You never stop learning. If you have a teacher, you never stop being a student.

author: Robert Frost
quote: There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: Teachers can change lives with just the right mix of chalk and challenges.

author: John Wooden
quote: I think the teaching profession contributes more to the future of our society than any other single profession.

author: Horace Mann
quote: A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on cold iron.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room.

author: Thurgood Marshall
quote: None of us got where we are solely by pulling ourselves up by our bootstraps. We got here because somebody - a parent, a teacher, an Ivy League crony or a few nuns - bent down and helped us pick up our boots.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

author: Louis Pasteur
quote: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world. Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.

author: Elon Musk
quote: Rockets are cool. There's no getting around that.

author: Wernher von Braun
quote: Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

author: Carl Jung
quote: We are born at a given moment, in a given place and, like vintage years of wine, we have the qualities of the year and of the season of which we are born. Astrology does not lay claim to anything more.

author: Brian Greene
quote: Science is a way of life. Science is a perspective. Science is the process that takes us from confusion to understanding in a manner that's precise, predictive and reliable - a transformation, for those lucky enough to experience it, that is empowering and emotional.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Buddha
quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.

author: Mattie Stepanek
quote: Unity is strength... when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.

author: Christopher Reeve
quote: A hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: Permanence, perseverance and persistence in spite of all obstacles, discouragements, and impossibilities: It is this, that in all things distinguishes the strong soul from the weak.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Kites rise highest against the wind - not with it.

author: Dita Von Teese
quote: Some days are just bad days, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that's just the way it is!

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.

author: Washington Irving
quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.

author: Richard Roeper
quote: Even though we're a week and a half away from Thanksgiving, it's beginning to look a lot like Christmas.

author: Kevin James
quote: Thanksgiving, man. Not a good day to be my pants.

author: Bobby Jindal
quote: On Thanksgiving I will stop to give thanks that my family is safe and healthy, especially because I realize that, following the tragedies of this year, it is all too real a possibility that they might not have been.

author: Willard Scott
quote: Thanksgiving just gets me all warm and tingly and all kinds of wonderful inside.

author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
quote: I give thanks to my Creator for this wonderful life where each of us has the opportunity to learn lessons we could not fully comprehend by any other means.

author: Bobby Moynihan
quote: My mom makes something called green pie, which I thought was a delicacy that many people only had at Thanksgiving, but it turns out it was just Jell-O with whipped cream on it. And it's delicious.

author: John Keats
quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.

author: Jeremy Taylor
quote: Love is friendship set on fire.

author: Richard Bach
quote: True love stories never have endings.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

author: Minna Antrim
quote: A beautiful woman delights the eye; a wise woman, the understanding; a pure one, the soul.

author: Sinclair Lewis
quote: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.

author: Luciano De Crescenzo
quote: We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.

author: Vince Lombardi
quote: Winners never quit and quitters never win.

author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
quote: You can't win unless you learn how to lose.

author: Babe Ruth
quote: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.

author: Bob Feller
quote: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.

author: Rodney Dangerfield
quote: I went to a fight the other night, and a hockey game broke out.

author: Bobby Unser
quote: Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Golf is a good walk spoiled.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records.

author: Satchel Paige
quote: Don't look back. Something might be gaining on you.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.

author: Booker T. Washington
quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.

author: Sophocles
quote: Success is dependent on effort.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: Man needs his difficulties because they are necessary to enjoy success.

author: John Wooden
quote: Success is peace of mind which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.

author: George S. Patton
quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.

author: John Ruskin
quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.

author: Jim Lovell
quote: There are people who make things happen, there are people who watch things happen, and there are people who wonder what happened. To be successful, you need to be a person who makes things happen.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: He has achieved success who has worked well, laughed often, and loved much.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.

author: David Frost
quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.

author: Mario Andretti
quote: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's determination and commitment to an unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.

author: Mike Ditka
quote: Success isn't measured by money or power or social rank. Success is measured by your discipline and inner peace.

author: William Penn
quote: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.

author: John Lennon
quote: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.

author: M. Scott Peck
quote: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.

author: Horace Mann
quote: Lost - yesterday, somewhere between sunrise and sunset, two golden hours, each set with sixty diamond minutes. No reward is offered, for they are gone forever.

author: Charles M. Schulz
quote: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It is already tomorrow in Australia.

author: John Wanamaker
quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.

author: Mary Kay Ash
quote: No matter how busy you are, you must take time to make the other person feel important.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of 60 minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.

author: Jean Racine
quote: There are no secrets that time does not reveal.

author: Delmore Schwartz
quote: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
quote: The present time has one advantage over every other - it is our own.

author: Barbara Bush
quote: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.

author: Corazon Aquino
quote: I just do whatever it is that I believe I should do, regardless of the risks to my life.

author: Franz Liszt
quote: Beware of missing chances; otherwise it may be altogether too late some day.

author: Henry James
quote: The right time is any time that one is still so lucky as to have.

author: Herodotus
quote: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.

author: John Paul Jones
quote: It seems to be a law of nature, inflexible and inexorable, that those who will not risk cannot win.

author: Charles Kettering
quote: Keep on going and the chances are you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I have never heard of anyone stumbling on something sitting down.

author: James A. Garfield
quote: A pound of pluck is worth a ton of luck.

author: Cat Cora
quote: Even when you have doubts, take that step. Take chances. Mistakes are never a failure - they can be turned into wisdom.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people's luck.

author: Waylon Jennings
quote: Don't ever try and be like anybody else and don't be afraid to take risks.

author: Margaret J. Wheatley
quote: Determination, energy, and courage appear spontaneously when we care deeply about something. We take risks that are unimaginable in any other context.
