author: Chuck Yeager
quote: You don't concentrate on risks. You concentrate on results. No risk is too great to prevent the necessary job from getting done.

author: Dave Thomas
quote: I think the harder you work, the more luck you have.

author: Dick Cavett
quote: If your parents never had children, chances are you won't either.

author: Werner Herzog
quote: I prefer to be alive, so I'm cautious about taking risks.

author: Mark Russell
quote: The scientific theory I like best is that the rings of Saturn are composed entirely of lost airline luggage.

author: Tom Hanks
quote: You cannot look up at the night sky on the Planet Earth and not wonder what it's like to be up there amongst the stars. And I always look up at the moon and see it as the single most romantic place within the cosmos.

author: William Blake
quote: If the Sun and Moon should ever doubt, they'd immediately go out.

author: Peter Diamandis
quote: Space is an inspirational concept that allows you to dream big.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: What is the use of a house if you haven't got a tolerable planet to put it on?

author: Mignon McLaughlin
quote: We all become great explorers during our first few days in a new city, or a new love affair.

author: Nikos Kazantzakis
quote: Every perfect traveler always creates the country where he travels.

author: William Hazlitt
quote: A wise traveler never despises his own country.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education; in the elder, a part of experience.

author: Dick Van Dyke
quote: Women will never be as successful as men because they have no wives to advise them.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
quote: Women are naturally secretive, and they like to do their own secreting.

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: I like intelligent women. When you go out, it shouldn't be a staring contest.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: Women need not always keep their mouths shut and their wombs open.

author: Yul Brynner
quote: Girls have an unfair advantage over men: if they can't get what they want by being smart, they can get it by being dumb.

author: Bill Maher
quote: Women cannot complain about men anymore until they start getting better taste in them.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Being the boss anywhere is lonely. Being a female boss in a world of mostly men is especially so.

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: Most women set out to try to change a man, and when they have changed him they do not like him.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Single women have a dreadful propensity for being poor. Which is one very strong argument in favor of matrimony.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.

author: Dave Barry
quote: To an adolescent, there is nothing in the world more embarrassing than a parent.

author: Nigella Lawson
quote: I was a quiet teenager, introverted, full of angst.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: Heredity is what sets the parents of a teenager wondering about each other.

author: John Knowles
quote: Teenagers today are more free to be themselves and to accept themselves.

author: Jim Bishop
quote: Nobody understands anyone 18, including those who are 18.

author: Enrique Iglesias
quote: I wouldn't change anything. I've made mistakes, but thanks to those mistakes, I've learned.

author: Jim Lovell
quote: Be thankful for problems. If they were less difficult, someone with less ability might have your job.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: Keep your eyes open to your mercies. The man who forgets to be thankful has fallen asleep in life.

author: Elizabeth I
quote: I do not so much rejoice that God hath made me to be a Queen, as to be a Queen over so thankful a people.

author: Srikumar Rao
quote: I believe that if you don't derive a deep sense of purpose from what you do, if you don't come radiantly alive several times a day, if you don't feel deeply grateful at the tremendous good fortune that has been bestowed on you, then you are wasting your life. And life is too short to waste.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Thanks to television, for the first time the young are seeing history made before it is censored by their elders.

author: Eric Hoffer
quote: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.

author: Suze Orman
quote: When you are grateful - when you can see what you have - you unlock blessings to flow in your life.

author: Jake Owen
quote: I was given such a great gift. It's a miracle that never stops amazing me and reminding me to give thanks, every day. Having a wife and daughter gives me a lot more purpose. I was much more selfish before, but now I think about what kind of role model I'll be. I just want to be a better man.

author: Saint Basil
quote: Does not the gratitude of the dog put to shame any man who is ungrateful to his benefactors?

author: William Bennett
quote: Sometimes we need to remind ourselves that thankfulness is indeed a virtue.

author: Rod Stewart
quote: Well, there's not a day goes by when I don't get up and say thank you to somebody.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: Gratitude is a duty which ought to be paid, but which none have a right to expect.

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough. Thank you for the rain. And for the chance to wake up in three hours and go fishing: I thank you for that now, because I won't feel so thankful then.

author: Freeman Dyson
quote: Technology is a gift of God. After the gift of life it is perhaps the greatest of God's gifts. It is the mother of civilizations, of arts and of sciences.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Men have become the tools of their tools.

author: Carrie Snow
quote: Technology... is a queer thing. It brings you great gifts with one hand, and it stabs you in the back with the other.

author: Scott Cook
quote: We're still in the first minutes of the first day of the Internet revolution.

author: Max Frisch
quote: Technology is the knack of so arranging the world that we don't have to experience it.

author: Jimmy Carter
quote: Globalization, as defined by rich people like us, is a very nice thing... you are talking about the Internet, you are talking about cell phones, you are talking about computers. This doesn't affect two-thirds of the people of the world.

author: George Lucas
quote: The technology keeps moving forward, which makes it easier for the artists to tell their stories and paint the pictures they want.

author: Linus Torvalds
quote: The Linux philosophy is 'Laugh in the face of danger'. Oops. Wrong One. 'Do it yourself'. Yes, that's it.

author: Alvin Toffler
quote: Our technological powers increase, but the side effects and potential hazards also escalate.

author: Dave Barry
quote: The Internet is the most important single development in the history of human communication since the invention of call waiting.

author: Esai Morales
quote: I love bringing roses to a woman when she least expects it.

author: Drew Barrymore
quote: I love romance. I'm a sucker for it. I love it so much. It's pathetic.

author: Susie Bright
quote: I'm like the kid in kindergarten; I really do send valentines to everyone.

author: Elizabeth Bowen
quote: When you love someone all your saved up wishes start coming out.

author: Ginnifer Goodwin
quote: I love Valentine's Day! I love it, I love it, I love it. I like having doors opened for me. My favorite romantic comedy is 'When Harry Met Sally.'

author: Chris Evans
quote: I think diamonds represent luxury, indulgence, and class. So any time you can incorporate a gift that is synonymous with all those attributes, you know the other person will love it. I would challenge someone to find something that better represents Valentine's Day more than diamonds!

author: Katya Zamolodchikova
quote: I love love. Every day of my life is Valentine's Day. When you're a pathological narcissist, you have to fall in love with yourself every day.

author: Amy Morin
quote: One of the major dangers of being alone in February is the tendency to dwell on past relationships. Whether you're daydreaming about that 'one that got away,' or you're recalling the fairy tale date you went on last Valentine's Day, romanticizing the past isn't helpful - nor accurate.

author: Jawed Karim
quote: That's one of those things about being a computer science major: Valentine's Day is just another day.

author: Dan Levy
quote: Valentine's Day is one of those tricky celebrations where you're damned if you do and damned if you don't. If you love it, you're buying into a holiday created to sell greeting cards, bad bouquets, and shoddy love-themed stuffed animals. And if you're opposed to it, you're considered lonely and single and have clearly never had a valentine.

author: Evangeline Lilly
quote: When I got old enough to date, I realized that Valentine's Day is just a commercial marketing scam to make men feel bad. So I let my boyfriends off the hook.

author: Solon
quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
quote: Trust should be the basis for all our moral training.

author: Shelley Long
quote: Not everyone can be trusted. I think we all have to be very selective about the people we trust.

author: Virgil
quote: Trust not too much to appearances.

author: Charles Kingsley
quote: A blessed thing it is for any man or woman to have a friend, one human soul whom we can trust utterly, who knows the best and worst of us, and who loves us in spite of all our faults.

author: Rollo May
quote: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice, it is conformity.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.

author: Norman Schwarzkopf
quote: True courage is being afraid, and going ahead and doing your job anyhow, that's what courage is.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.

author: Henri Matisse
quote: Creativity takes courage.

author: Ray Kurzweil
quote: Supercomputers will achieve one human brain capacity by 2010, and personal computers will do so by about 2020.

author: Issey Miyake
quote: Even when I work with computers, with high technology, I always try to put in the touch of the hand.

author: Stephen R. George
quote: I got up with my wife, I sat down at the computer when she went to work, and I didn't stop until she got home.

author: Laurence Sterne
quote: Respect for ourselves guides our morals, respect for others guides our manners.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.

author: Voltaire
quote: To the living we owe respect, but to the dead we owe only the truth.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I would rather live my life as if there is a God and die to find out there isn't, than live as if there isn't and to die to find out that there is.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: When the missionaries came to Africa they had the Bible and we had the land. They said 'Let us pray.' We closed our eyes. When we opened them we had the Bible and they had the land.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.

author: Jesus Christ
quote: So I say to you, Ask and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: When I do good I feel good, when I do bad I feel bad, and that's my religion.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: I prayed for twenty years but received no answer until I prayed with my legs.

author: Buddha
quote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: When someone shows you who they are, believe them the first time.

author: Bob Marley
quote: Truth is everybody is going to hurt you: you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.

author: Rollo May
quote: Care is a state in which something does matter; it is the source of human tenderness.

author: Walter Winchell
quote: Never above you. Never below you. Always beside you.

author: Richard Bach
quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.

author: Elon Musk
quote: I think it matters whether someone has a good heart.

author: Wayne Dyer
quote: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.

author: Jean de La Fontaine
quote: By the work one knows the workman.

author: Peter Abelard
quote: By doubting we are led to question, by questioning we arrive at the truth.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: Your problem is how you are going to spend this one odd and precious life you have been issued. Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over people and circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.

author: Rene Descartes
quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Love is never defeated, and I could add, the history of Ireland proves it.

author: Darrell Royal
quote: You've got to think lucky. If you fall into a mudhole, check your back pocket - you might have caught a fish.

author: Brendan Behan
quote: If it was raining soup, the Irish would go out with forks.

author: John Millington Synge
quote: There is no language like the Irish for soothing and quieting.

author: Joseph Brodsky
quote: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: Knowledge will give you power, but character respect.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.

author: William Gaddis
quote: Power doesn't corrupt people, people corrupt power.

author: William Blake
quote: Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.

author: Cristiano Ronaldo
quote: When you lose a person you love so much, surviving the loss is difficult.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Truly, it is in darkness that one finds the light, so when we are in sorrow, then this light is nearest of all to us.

author: Robert Southey
quote: The loss of a friend is like that of a limb; time may heal the anguish of the wound, but the loss cannot be repaired.

author: Lord Byron
quote: The dew of compassion is a tear.

author: Willie Nelson
quote: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

author: Matt Cameron
quote: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.

author: Martha Beck
quote: Every day brings new choices.

author: Kobe Bryant
quote: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.

author: Leah LaBelle
quote: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.

author: Plato
quote: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.

author: Lord Byron
quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.

author: Walter Scott
quote: Look back, and smile on perils past.

author: Yoko Ono
quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.

author: Tom Wilson
quote: A smile is happiness you'll find right under your nose.

author: Rashida Jones
quote: Smiling is definitely one of the best beauty remedies. If you have a good sense of humor and a good approach to life, that's beautiful.

author: William Hazlitt
quote: A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.

author: Serena Williams
quote: I'm really exciting. I smile a lot, I win a lot, and I'm really sexy.

author: Jimmy Buffett
quote: Wrinkles will only go where the smiles have been.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: They might not need me; but they might. I'll let my head be just in sight; a smile as small as mine might be precisely their necessity.

author: Aristotle
quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.

author: Temple Grandin
quote: I cannot emphasize enough the importance of a good teacher.

author: Gilbert Highet
quote: A good teacher is a determined person.

author: Dan Rather
quote: The dream begins with a teacher who believes in you, who tugs and pushes and leads you to the next plateau, sometimes poking you with a sharp stick called 'truth'.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Take away paradox from the thinker and you have a professor.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Those who know how to think need no teachers.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: I do not believe there is a problem in this country or the world today which could not be settled if approached through the teaching of the Sermon on the Mount.

author: Guy Kawasaki
quote: If you have to put someone on a pedestal, put teachers. They are society's heroes.

author: Thucydides
quote: History is Philosophy teaching by example.

author: Arthur M. Schlesinger
quote: Science and technology revolutionize our lives, but memory, tradition and myth frame our response.

author: Jeff Bezos
quote: The human brain is an incredible pattern-matching machine.

author: Will Harvey
quote: What is research but a blind date with knowledge?

author: Sally Ride
quote: Science is fun. Science is curiosity. We all have natural curiosity. Science is a process of investigating. It's posing questions and coming up with a method. It's delving in.

author: Adam Smith
quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: Geologists have a saying - rocks remember.

author: Plato
quote: Science is nothing but perception.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: The fewer the facts, the stronger the opinion.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Science is not only a disciple of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Science does not know its debt to imagination.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: Reason, observation, and experience; the holy trinity of science.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: If an elderly but distinguished scientist says that something is possible, he is almost certainly right; but if he says that it is impossible, he is very probably wrong.

author: Mary Kay Ash
quote: Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway.

author: Charles Spurgeon
quote: Anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strength.

author: Saint Francis de Sales
quote: Nothing is so strong as gentleness, nothing so gentle as real strength.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
quote: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.

author: Richie Sambora
quote: I've spent a lot of Thanksgivings on the road with my band, so anytime that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family in a traditional aspect, eating sweet potatoes and cranberries and stuffing and all the trappings of Thanksgiving and then get on a treadmill the next day extra long, I'm happy.

author: Ina Garten
quote: If you think about a Thanksgiving dinner, it's really like making a large chicken.

author: O. Henry
quote: There is one day that is ours. Thanksgiving Day is the one day that is purely American.

author: Todd Barry
quote: I love chicken. I would eat chicken fingers on Thanksgiving if it were socially acceptable.

author: Kin Hubbard
quote: A lot of Thanksgiving days have been ruined by not carving the turkey in the kitchen.

author: Douglas Conant
quote: My most memorable meal is every Thanksgiving. I love the food: the turkey and stuffing; the sweet potatoes and rice, which come from my mother's Southern heritage; the mashed potatoes, which come from my wife's Midwestern roots; the Campbell's green-bean casserole; and of course, pumpkin pie.

author: Michael Strahan
quote: That's one of the great things about Thanksgiving: Football's on!

author: Franz Grillparzer
quote: Drink and be thankful to the host! What seems insignificant when you have it, is important when you need it.

author: Lewis Black
quote: When people come to my act any time after Thanksgiving, I usually say, You shouldn't be here. You should be shopping. Our economy depends on you! You should be out there buying stuff.'

author: Katharine McPhee
quote: My fondest memories are generally the day after Thanksgiving. I get the total decorating Christmas itch.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.

author: Rupert Brooke
quote: Breathless, we flung us on a windy hill, Laughed in the sun, and kissed the lovely grass.

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: A tramp, a gentleman, a poet, a dreamer, a lonely fellow, always hopeful of romance and adventure.

author: William Blake
quote: I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.

author: Christopher Marlowe
quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: When you look at me, when you think of me, I am in paradise.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: The real lover is the man who can thrill you just by touching your head or smiling into your eyes - or just by staring into space.

author: Johnny Depp
quote: Am I a romantic? I've seen 'Wuthering Heights' ten times. I'm a romantic.

author: Dan Gable
quote: Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.

author: George Brett
quote: If a tie is like kissing your sister, losing is like kissing you grandmother with her teeth out.

author: Barry Switzer
quote: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.

author: Billie Jean King
quote: Champions keep playing until they get it right.

author: Mia Hamm
quote: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.

author: Wayne Gretzky
quote: A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be.

author: Dan Quayle
quote: Bobby Knight told me this: 'There is nothing that a good defense cannot beat a better offense.' In other words a good offense wins.

author: Earl Monroe
quote: Just be patient. Let the game come to you. Don't rush. Be quick, but don't hurry.

author: Heywood Broun
quote: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.

author: Hank Aaron
quote: My motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.

author: Michael Phelps
quote: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.

author: Godfrey Winn
quote: No man succeeds without a good woman behind him. Wife or mother, if it is both, he is twice blessed indeed.

author: Confucius
quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.

author: Orison Swett Marden
quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.

author: Julia Child
quote: Find something you're passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.

author: Theophrastus
quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.

author: Aeschylus
quote: Time brings all things to pass.

author: Francois Rabelais
quote: It is my feeling that Time ripens all things; with Time all things are revealed; Time is the father of truth.

author: John Dewey
quote: Time and memory are true artists; they remould reality nearer to the heart's desire.

author: Michael LeBoeuf
quote: Waste your money and you're only out of money, but waste your time and you've lost a part of your life.

author: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: It is strange that the years teach us patience; that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting.

author: Dion Boucicault
quote: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them.

author: Tillie Olsen
quote: The clock talked loud. I threw it away, it scared me what it talked.

author: Paul Harvey
quote: In times like these, it helps to recall that there have always been times like these.

author: Preity Zinta
quote: Luck always favours the brave. And you must remember that brave are the people who follow their heart; brave are the people who take chances in life. Which also means you have to say no sometimes. I believe the power of no is greater than yes.

author: Jack Youngblood
quote: Good luck is a residue of preparation.

author: Maxwell Maltz
quote: Often the difference between a successful man and a failure is not one's better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on his ideas, to take a calculated risk, and to act.

author: Anaxagoras
quote: Everything has a natural explanation. The moon is not a god, but a great rock, and the sun a hot rock.

author: Jack London
quote: I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.

author: Fred Hoyle
quote: Space isn't remote at all. It's only an hour's drive away if your car could go straight upwards.

author: Thomas Merton
quote: What can we gain by sailing to the moon if we are not able to cross the abyss that separates us from ourselves? This is the most important of all voyages of discovery, and without it, all the rest are not only useless, but disastrous.

author: Douglas Adams
quote: Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the drug store, but that's just peanuts to space.

author: Bette Davis
quote: Oh, don't let's ask for the moon. We've already got the stars.

author: Antony Garrett Lisi
quote: I think the universe is pure geometry - basically, a beautiful shape twisting around and dancing over space-time.

author: Paul Theroux
quote: Tourists don't know where they've been, travelers don't know where they're going.

author: Daphne du Maurier
quote: Women want love to be a novel, men a short story.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Women want mediocre men, and men are working to be as mediocre as possible.

author: Judith Light
quote: Women don't realize how powerful they are.

author: Alice Hoffman
quote: I think growing up is difficult and it's a process that I'm always interested in, with kids and adults, they are often on two different universes.

author: Olivia Wilde
quote: I was a handful growing up.

author: Miranda Otto
quote: I think you go through a period as a teenager of being quite cool and unaffected by things.

author: Danica McKellar
quote: I want to help middle-school girls stay interested in math and be good at it, and see it as friendly and accessible and not this scary thing. Everyone else in society tells them it's not for them. It's for nerdy white guys with pocket protectors.

author: Barry Gibb
quote: Everybody is a teenage idol.

author: Chris Evans
quote: For the youth, the indignation of most things will just surge as each birthday passes.

author: Gus Van Sant
quote: The area of teenage life is not necessarily rarefied; we've all gone through that period. It's not as rarefied as a western or a space adventure or a gangster film, but it has its own dynamic.

author: Woody Allen
quote: I am thankful for laughter, except when milk comes out of my nose.

author: Tim Tebow
quote: I'm just thankful for everything, all the blessings in my life, trying to stay that way. I think that's the best way to start your day and finish your day. It keeps everything in perspective.

author: Wietse Venema
quote: Defect-free software does not exist.

author: Pope Paul VI
quote: Technological society has succeeded in multiplying the opportunities for pleasure, but it has great difficulty in generating joy.

author: Robin S. Sharma
quote: Cell phones, mobile e-mail, and all the other cool and slick gadgets can cause massive losses in our creative output and overall productivity.

author: Lawrence Clark Powell
quote: We are the children of a technological age. We have found streamlined ways of doing much of our routine work. Printing is no longer the only way of reproducing books. Reading them, however, has not changed.

author: Elon Musk
quote: An asteroid or a supervolcano could certainly destroy us, but we also face risks the dinosaurs never saw: An engineered virus, nuclear war, inadvertent creation of a micro black hole, or some as-yet-unknown technology could spell the end of us.

author: Bill Gates
quote: Technology is just a tool. In terms of getting the kids working together and motivating them, the teacher is the most important.

author: Randeep Hooda
quote: Be it Valentine's Day, Father's Day or Mother's Day, I feel all days are reminders of some feelings. February 14 doesn't hold any special relevance for me.

author: Vince Vaughn
quote: Any guy hates Valentine's Day. Even if you're in love, you can't win on Valentine's Day. If you're married, you can't win on Valentine's Day. Valentine's Day is like the thing you want to avoid at all costs.

author: Alia Bhatt
quote: I don't find these technical things like flowers and chocolates romantic at all. I think Valentine's Day makes no sense.

author: Sam Yagan
quote: New Year's Eve to Valentine's Day is our peak season, and in many ways, Valentine's Day is our Christmas. Everybody in the world makes the same three New Year's resolutions: health, career and money, and love.

author: J. K. Rowling
quote: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain.

author: Harvey S. Firestone
quote: I believe fundamental honesty is the keystone of business.

author: Ryan Stiles
quote: Never trust sheep.

author: Finley Peter Dunne
quote: Trust everybody, but cut the cards.

author: Graham Greene
quote: It is impossible to go through life without trust: that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.

author: Billy Connolly
quote: Never trust a man, who when left alone with a tea cosey... Doesn't try it on.

author: Barbra Streisand
quote: You have got to discover you, what you do, and trust it.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.

author: Bryant H. McGill
quote: One of the most sincere forms of respect is actually listening to what another has to say.

author: Jackie Robinson
quote: I'm not concerned with your liking or disliking me... All I ask is that you respect me as a human being.

author: Clint Eastwood
quote: Respect your efforts, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt, that's real power.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.

author: Abraham Joshua Heschel
quote: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: We don't need to share the same opinions as others, but we need to be respectful.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Everyone should be respected as an individual, but no one idolized.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.

author: Martin Luther
quote: To be a Christian without prayer is no more possible than to be alive without breathing.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Within the covers of the Bible are the answers for all the problems men face.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: I like the religion that teaches liberty, equality and fraternity.

author: Moses
quote: See, I have set before you this day life and good, death and evil... I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse; therefore choose life.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.

author: Epictetus
quote: All religions must be tolerated... for every man must get to heaven in his own way.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: Science can purify religion from error and superstition. Religion can purify science from idolatry and false absolutes.

author: Anais Nin
quote: When we blindly adopt a religion, a political system, a literary dogma, we become automatons. We cease to grow.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.

author: John Burroughs
quote: The Kingdom of Heaven is not a place, but a state of mind.

author: Bryant H. McGill
quote: There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love does not claim possession, but gives freedom.

author: Thomas Merton
quote: The beginning of love is to let those we love be perfectly themselves, and not to twist them to fit our own image. Otherwise we love only the reflection of ourselves we find in them.

author: Lillian Hellman
quote: People change and forget to tell each other.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: The relationship between husband and wife should be one of closest friends.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: But let there be spaces in your togetherness and let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

author: Julia Roberts
quote: I believe that two people are connected at the heart, and it doesn't matter what you do, or who you are or where you live; there are no boundaries or barriers if two people are destined to be together.

author: Barbara De Angelis
quote: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.

author: Erich Fromm
quote: The danger of the past was that men became slaves. The danger of the future is that men may become robots.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Society exists only as a mental concept; in the real world there are only individuals.

author: Lily Tomlin
quote: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.

author: Orson Welles
quote: The enemy of society is middle class and the enemy of life is middle age.

author: Adam Smith
quote: No society can surely be flourishing and happy, of which the far greater part of the members are poor and miserable.

author: John W. Gardner
quote: The society which scorns excellence in plumbing as a humble activity and tolerates shoddiness in philosophy because it is an exalted activity will have neither good plumbing nor good philosophy: neither its pipes nor its theories will hold water.

author: James McGreevey
quote: I try to be grateful for the abundance of the blessings that I have, for the journey that I'm on and to relish each day as a gift.

author: Dave Barry
quote: Geographically, Ireland is a medium-sized rural island that is slowly but steadily being consumed by sheep.

author: Maureen O'Hara
quote: Above all else, deep in my soul, I'm a tough Irishwoman.

author: Colin Farrell
quote: Being Irish is very much a part of who I am. I take it everywhere with me.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Being Irish, he had an abiding sense of tragedy, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.

author: Victoria Smurfit
quote: If you're Irish, it doesn't matter where you go - you'll find family.

author: Kenneth Branagh
quote: Being Irish, I always had this love of words.

author: Anne Enright
quote: I was raised in a very old fashioned Ireland where women were reared to be lovely.

author: Brian Dennehy
quote: I come from an Irish Catholic family, and hell-raising is part of the DNA.

author: Lara Flynn Boyle
quote: That's what the holidays are for - for one person to tell the stories and another to dispute them. Isn't that the Irish way?

author: Shane Leslie
quote: Every St. Patrick's Day every Irishman goes out to find another Irishman to make a speech to.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing; to be able to dare!

author: Alice Walker
quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Only by joy and sorrow does a person know anything about themselves and their destiny. They learn what to do and what to avoid.

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
quote: Grief can't be shared. Everyone carries it alone. His own burden in his own way.

author: Pliny the Elder
quote: From the end spring new beginnings.

author: Homer
quote: A sympathetic friend can be quite as dear as a brother.

author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
quote: What is lovely never dies, But passes into other loveliness.

author: George Henry Lewes
quote: The only cure for grief is action.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Sorrow is a fruit. God does not make it grow on limbs too weak to bear it.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Almost all of our sorrows spring out of our relations with other people.

author: Xenophon
quote: Excess of grief for the dead is madness; for it is an injury to the living, and the dead know it not.

author: Corita Kent
quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.

author: Charles Henry Parkhurst
quote: Sympathy is two hearts tugging at one load.

author: Moliere
quote: If you suppress grief too much, it can well redouble.

author: Joni Mitchell
quote: Sorrow is so easy to express and yet so hard to tell.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.

author: Donna Karan
quote: Delete the negative; accentuate the positive!

author: Dalai Lama
quote: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.

author: Marla Gibbs
quote: I truly believe that everything that we do and everyone that we meet is put in our path for a purpose. There are no accidents; we're all teachers - if we're willing to pay attention to the lessons we learn, trust our positive instincts and not be afraid to take risks or wait for some miracle to come knocking at our door.

author: Joyce Brothers
quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: You are the sum total of everything you've ever seen, heard, eaten, smelled, been told, forgot - it's all there. Everything influences each of us, and because of that I try to make sure that my experiences are positive.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.

author: Demi Lovato
quote: No matter what you're going through, there's a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you'll find the positive side of things.

author: Henri Nouwen
quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.

author: Ralph Marston
quote: You've done it before and you can do it now. See the positive possibilities. Redirect the substantial energy of your frustration and turn it into positive, effective, unstoppable determination.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Inflation is as violent as a mugger, as frightening as an armed robber and as deadly as a hit man.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Suppose you were an idiot, and suppose you were a member of Congress; but I repeat myself.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: It is better to be violent, if there is violence in our hearts, than to put on the cloak of nonviolence to cover impotence.

author: Mao Zedong
quote: Politics is war without bloodshed while war is politics with bloodshed.

author: William Tecumseh Sherman
quote: If nominated, I will not run; if elected, I will not serve.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
quote: Politics have no relation to morals.

author: Jeanne Calment
quote: Always keep your smile. That's how I explain my long life.

author: Joseph Addison
quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.

author: Max Eastman
quote: A smile is the universal welcome.

author: Washington Irving
quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.

author: William R. Alger
quote: After every storm the sun will smile; for every problem there is a solution, and the soul's indefeasible duty is to be of good cheer.

author: Andy Rooney
quote: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.

author: George Eliot
quote: Wear a smile and have friends; wear a scowl and have wrinkles.

author: Anna Lee
quote: Remember even though the outside world might be raining, if you keep on smiling the sun will soon show its face and smile back at you.

author: Charles de Lint
quote: I want to touch the heart of the world and make it smile.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment.

author: Herman Melville
quote: A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities.

author: Shinichi Suzuki
quote: Children learn to smile from their parents.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Jesus wept; Voltaire smiled. From that divine tear and from that human smile is derived the grace of present civilization.

author: Lawrence G. Lovasik
quote: Nobody needs a smile so much as the one who has none to give. So get used to smiling heart-warming smiles, and you will spread sunshine in a sometimes dreary world.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Better by far you should forget and smile that you should remember and be sad.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.

author: Anatole France
quote: Until one has loved an animal a part of one's soul remains unawakened.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: The teacher is the one who gets the most out of the lessons, and the true teacher is the learner.

author: Andy Rooney
quote: Most of us end up with no more than five or six people who remember us. Teachers have thousands of people who remember them for the rest of their lives.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: It is by teaching that we teach ourselves, by relating that we observe, by affirming that we examine, by showing that we look, by writing that we think, by pumping that we draw water into the well.

author: Carter G. Woodson
quote: Those who have no record of what their forebears have accomplished lose the inspiration which comes from the teaching of biography and history.

author: Morihei Ueshiba
quote: Study how water flows in a valley stream, smoothly and freely between the rocks. Also learn from holy books and wise people. Everything - even mountains, rivers, plants and trees - should be your teacher.

author: Warren Buffett
quote: The smarter the journalists are, the better off society is. For to a degree, people read the press to inform themselves - and the better the teacher, the better the student body.

author: Max Planck
quote: A scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.

author: Jules Verne
quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Anthropology demands the open-mindedness with which one must look and listen, record in astonishment and wonder that which one would not have been able to guess.

author: Edwin Powell Hubble
quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.

author: Muriel Rukeyser
quote: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.

author: Bruce Feirstein
quote: The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success.

author: Unknown
quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.

author: Niels Bohr
quote: Your theory is crazy, but it's not crazy enough to be true.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: To me there has never been a higher source of earthly honor or distinction than that connected with advances in science.

author: John von Neumann
quote: Anyone who attempts to generate random numbers by deterministic means is, of course, living in a state of sin.

author: Jean Rostand
quote: Science has made us gods even before we are worthy of being men.

author: Mae Jemison
quote: We look at science as something very elite, which only a few people can learn. That's just not true. You just have to start early and give kids a foundation. Kids live up, or down, to expectations.

author: John Dewey
quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.

author: Lewis Thomas
quote: The cloning of humans is on most of the lists of things to worry about from Science, along with behaviour control, genetic engineering, transplanted heads, computer poetry and the unrestrained growth of plastic flowers.

author: Alan Perlis
quote: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.

author: Irving Langmuir
quote: The scientist is motivated primarily by curiosity and a desire for truth.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: Thousands have lived without love, not one without water.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.

author: Tecumseh
quote: A single twig breaks, but the bundle of twigs is strong.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: As we advance in life it becomes more and more difficult, but in fighting the difficulties the inmost strength of the heart is developed.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: The world is the great gymnasium where we come to make ourselves strong.

author: Walt Disney
quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.

author: Carl Jung
quote: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.

author: Arthur Koestler
quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.

author: Rumi
quote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.

author: Jean de La Fontaine
quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.

author: John Clayton
quote: Thanksgiving is a season that is very much in accord with the themes and teachings of Jesus Christ.

author: John Clayton
quote: Christians were instructed to serve others, and the thanksgiving was for the grace of God and the fact that God offered a way for man to return to a positive relationship with Him.

author: John Clayton
quote: Thanksgiving is a time when the world gets to see just how blessed and how workable the Christian system is. The emphasis is not on giving or buying, but on being thankful and expressing that appreciation to God and to one another.

author: Marilu Henner
quote: It is now common knowledge that the average American gains 7 pounds between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.

author: Tony Snow
quote: If you think Independence Day is America's defining holiday, think again. Thanksgiving deserves that title, hands-down.

author: Joseph Auslander
quote: Dear Lord; we beg but one boon more: Peace in the hearts of all men living, peace in the whole world this Thanksgiving.

author: Mark Shriver
quote: I miss both of my parents terribly every day, but especially as we approach Thanksgiving. We always came together as a family for that holiday, playing capture the flag and touch football and laughing a lot.

author: Regina Brett
quote: If no one shopped on Thanksgiving Day, the stores wouldn't open. End of story. I say we all take the pledge and stay home. Thanksgiving is a day to give thanks for what you have, not to save a few dollars to get more.

author: Algernon Charles Swinburne
quote: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.

author: Charles Spurgeon
quote: I think that is a better thing than thanksgiving: thanks-living. How is this to be done? By a general cheerfulness of manner, by an obedience to the command of Him by whose mercy we live, by a perpetual, constant delighting of ourselves in the Lord, and by a submission of our desires to His will.

author: LZ Granderson
quote: My son was born during my last semester in college. His due date was Thanksgiving, but he didn't show up until finals week. I brought my books to the hospital and didn't think anything of it. That is what a father is supposed to do.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: How far away the stars seem, and how far is our first kiss, and ah, how old my heart.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: I'm a romantic; a sentimental person thinks things will last, a romantic person hopes against hope that they won't.

author: John Gay
quote: We only part to meet again.

author: Ashton Kutcher
quote: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated, the willingness to look foolish, the courage to say, 'This is me, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but, more important, all that I am not.'

author: Stendhal
quote: If you don't love me, it does not matter, anyway I can love for both of us.

author: Mae West
quote: A man's kiss is his signature.

author: Carolyn Gold Heilbrun
quote: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Love is a portion of the soul itself, and it is of the same nature as the celestial breathing of the atmosphere of paradise.

author: Lord Byron
quote: There is no instinct like that of the heart.

author: Dale Earnhardt
quote: You win some, lose some, and wreck some.

author: Ernie Banks
quote: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.

author: Knute Rockne
quote: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than a hundred teaching it.

author: Eric Liddell
quote: God made me fast. And when I run, I feel His pleasure.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: I want to rip out his heart and feed it to Lennox Lewis. I want to kill people. I want to rip their stomachs out and eat their children.

author: Earl Warren
quote: I always turn to the sports pages first, which records people's accomplishments. The front page has nothing but man's failures.

author: George Orwell
quote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.

author: Reggie Jackson
quote: Fans don't boo nobodies.

author: Casey Stengel
quote: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.

author: Bob Hope
quote: If you watch a game, it's fun. If you play it, it's recreation. If you work at it, it's golf.

author: Mike Singletary
quote: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.

author: Jim Bouton
quote: You spend a good piece of your life gripping a baseball and in the end it turns out that it was the other way around all the time.

author: Gerald R. Ford
quote: I know I am getting better at golf because I am hitting fewer spectators.

author: Shaquille O'Neal
quote: I'm tired of hearing about money, money, money, money, money. I just want to play the game, drink Pepsi, wear Reebok.

author: Harry Vardon
quote: Don't play too much golf. Two rounds a day are plenty.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.

author: Woody Allen
quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

author: Shah Rukh Khan
quote: Success is not a good teacher, failure makes you humble.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.

author: Lydia M. Child
quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.

author: Bob Dylan
quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.

author: Maria Montessori
quote: The greatest sign of success for a teacher... is to be able to say, 'The children are now working as if I did not exist.'

author: Anthony J. D'Angelo
quote: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.

author: Henry Austin Dobson
quote: Time goes, you say? Ah, no! alas, time stays, we go.

author: Max Frisch
quote: Time does not change us. It just unfolds us.

author: Ben Hecht
quote: Time is a circus, always packing up and moving away.

author: Golda Meir
quote: I must govern the clock, not be governed by it.

author: Alan Lakein
quote: Time = Life, Therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Time has been transformed, and we have changed; it has advanced and set us in motion; it has unveiled its face, inspiring us with bewilderment and exhilaration.

author: Edward Young
quote: Procrastination is the thief of time.

author: Finley Peter Dunne
quote: The past always looks better than it was. It's only pleasant because it isn't here.

author: Roy Bean
quote: Time will pass and seasons will come and go.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Everything that has existed, lingers in the Eternity.

author: Charles Lamb
quote: Nothing puzzles me more than the time and space; and yet nothing troubles me less.

author: Ivan Turgenev
quote: Time sometimes flies like a bird, sometimes crawls like a snail; but a man is happiest when he does not even notice whether it passes swiftly or slowly.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: Now is the age of anxiety.

author: Ovid
quote: Time, the devourer of all things.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: Every business and every product has risks. You can't get around it.

author: Neil Simon
quote: If no one ever took risks, Michaelangelo would have painted the Sistine floor.

author: Cher
quote: I've always taken risks, and never worried what the world might really think of me.

author: Alan Shepard
quote: It's a very sobering feeling to be up in space and realize that one's safety factor was determined by the lowest bidder on a government contract.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: We are not going to be able to operate our Spaceship Earth successfully nor for much longer unless we see it as a whole spaceship and our fate as common. It has to be everybody or nobody.

author: Adlai Stevenson I
quote: We travel together, passengers on a little spaceship, dependent on its vulnerable reserves of air and soil, all committed, for our safety, to its security and peace. Preserved from annihilation only by the care, the work and the love we give our fragile craft.

author: Sojourner Truth
quote: Those are the same stars, and that is the same moon, that look down upon your brothers and sisters, and which they see as they look up to them, though they are ever so far away from us, and each other.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: For the wise man looks into space and he knows there is no limited dimensions.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.

author: Joseph Joubert
quote: Space is to place as eternity is to time.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: America has tossed its cap over the wall of space.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: How often I found where I should be going only by setting out for somewhere else.

author: Ella Maillart
quote: One travels to run away from routine, that dreadful routine that kills all imagination and all our capacity for enthusiasm.

author: Hilaire Belloc
quote: I have wandered all my life, and I have also traveled; the difference between the two being this, that we wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfillment.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: Just got back from a pleasure trip: I took my mother-in-law to the airport.

author: Ivanka Trump
quote: In both business and personal life, I've always found that travel inspires me more than anything else I do. Evidence of the languages, cultures, scenery, food, and design sensibilities that I discover all over the world can be found in every piece of my jewelry.

author: Susan Sontag
quote: Travel becomes a strategy for accumulating photographs.

author: Laurel Clark
quote: I've always enjoyed traveling and having experience with different cultures and different people. But it's also a wonderful thing to be able to benefit and enable research, not only in our country but around the world.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: Travelers never think that they are the foreigners.

author: William Blake
quote: Travelers repose and dream among my leaves.

author: Raymond Floyd
quote: If you travel first class, you think first class and you are more likely to play first class.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: One can find women who have never had one love affair, but it is rare indeed to find any who have had only one.

author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton
quote: A woman has two smiles that an angel might envy, the smile that accepts a lover before words are uttered, and the smile that lights on the first born babe, and assures it of a mother's love.

author: Alphonse Karr
quote: If men knew all that women think, they would be twenty times more audacious.

author: Claire Danes
quote: Growing up, I wanted desperately to please, to be a good girl.

author: Clyde Tombaugh
quote: Can you imagine young people nowadays making a study of trigonometry for the fun of it? Well I did.

author: Ben Lindsey
quote: Trouble is, kids feel they have to shock their elders and each generation grows up into something harder to shock.

author: Uma Thurman
quote: I spent the first fourteen years of my life convinced that my looks were hideous. Adolescence is painful for everyone, I know, but mine was plain weird.

author: Rob Lowe
quote: I liked being a teenager, but I would not go back for all the tea in China.

author: Louise J. Kaplan
quote: The toddler must say no in order to find out who she is. The adolescent says no to assert who she is not.

author: Jamie Lee Curtis
quote: Well, I could do it for a day, but I wouldn't want to be a teenager again. I really wouldn't.

author: John Walters
quote: We all have an interest in making sure teens grow up healthy and drug-free.

author: Andrew Shue
quote: The most important role models should and could be parents and teachers. But that said, once you're a teenager you've probably gotten as much of an example from your parents as you're going to.

author: Dave Barry
quote: Your modern teenager is not about to listen to advice from an old person, defined as a person who remembers when there was no Velcro.

author: Heather Locklear
quote: When I look in the mirror I see the girl I was when I was growing up, with braces, crooked teeth, a baby face and a skinny body.

author: Izaak Walton
quote: God has two dwellings; one in heaven, and the other in a meek and thankful heart.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: It is another's fault if he be ungrateful, but it is mine if I do not give. To find one thankful man, I will oblige a great many that are not so.

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quote: Technology is so much fun but we can drown in our technology. The fog of information can drive out knowledge.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The machine does not isolate man from the great problems of nature but plunges him more deeply into them.

author: John Perry Barlow
quote: Relying on the government to protect your privacy is like asking a peeping tom to install your window blinds.

author: William Gibson
quote: It's impossible to move, to live, to operate at any level without leaving traces, bits, seemingly meaningless fragments of personal information.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: If it keeps up, man will atrophy all his limbs but the push-button finger.

author: Edward R. Murrow
quote: The newest computer can merely compound, at speed, the oldest problem in the relations between human beings, and in the end the communicator will be confronted with the old problem, of what to say and how to say it.

author: Larry Wall
quote: Doing linear scans over an associative array is like trying to club someone to death with a loaded Uzi.

author: Grantland Rice
quote: Depend upon yourself. Make your judgement trustworthy by trusting it. You can develop good judgement as you do the muscles of your body - by judicious, daily exercise. To be known as a man of sound judgement will be much in your favor.

author: Eric Hoffer
quote: Someone who thinks the world is always cheating him is right. He is missing that wonderful feeling of trust in someone or something.

author: Cher
quote: I can trust my friends These people force me to examine myself, encourage me to grow.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: You can't trust water: Even a straight stick turns crooked in it.

author: Eartha Kitt
quote: I'm a dirt person. I trust the dirt. I don't trust diamonds and gold.

author: Natalie Goldberg
quote: Trust in what you love, continue to do it, and it will take you where you need to go.

author: Barbara Smith
quote: Trust is to human relationships what faith is to gospel living. It is the beginning place, the foundation upon which more can be built. Where trust is, love can flourish.

author: Tom Ridge
quote: Trust is a great force multiplier.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: There is no respect for others without humility in one's self.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.

author: Saint Teresa of Avila
quote: We can only learn to know ourselves and do what we can - namely, surrender our will and fulfill God's will in us.

author: Helen Keller
quote: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil. If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: We are punished by our sins, not for them.

author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
quote: One act of obedience is better than one hundred sermons.

author: Anais Nin
quote: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires.

author: John Lennon
quote: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.

author: Georges Bernanos
quote: The first sign of corruption in a society that is still alive is that the end justifies the means.

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: In much of society, research means to investigate something you do not know or understand.

author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
quote: The ultimate test of a moral society is the kind of world that it leaves to its children.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: Society cares for the individual only so far as he is profitable.

author: Billy Graham
quote: Our society strives to avoid any possibility of offending anyone - except God.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: All things are subject to interpretation whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth.

author: Margaret Thatcher
quote: Power is like being a lady... if you have to tell people you are, you aren't.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.

author: Paul P. Harris
quote: Personality has power to uplift, power to depress, power to curse, and power to bless.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will.

author: Alphonse de Lamartine
quote: Grief knits two hearts in closer bonds than happiness ever can; and common sufferings are far stronger links than common joys.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Pity may represent little more than the impersonal concern which prompts the mailing of a check, but true sympathy is the personal concern which demands the giving of one's soul.

author: Orison Swett Marden
quote: Our trials, our sorrows, and our grieves develop us.

author: Ivan Turgenev
quote: To desire and expect nothing for oneself and to have profound sympathy for others is genuine holiness.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
quote: It is in our faults and failings, not in our virtues, that we touch each other, and find sympathy. It is in our follies that we are one.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.

author: Nigella Lawson
quote: You don't go around grieving all the time, but the grief is still there and always will be.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: It is foolish to tear one's hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.

author: Ann Landers
quote: People who drink to drown their sorrow should be told that sorrow knows how to swim.

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion; it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.

author: Plutarch
quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.

author: Paul Valery
quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: When power leads man toward arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.

author: Don Miguel Ruiz
quote: Always Do Your Best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.

author: Daniel Kahneman
quote: It's a wonderful thing to be optimistic. It keeps you healthy and it keeps you resilient.

author: Christopher McCandless
quote: The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.

author: John Wooden
quote: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.

author: Colin Powell
quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.

author: Tony Dorsett
quote: To succeed, you need to find something to hold on to, something to motivate you, something to inspire you.

author: Roger Clemens
quote: I think anything is possible if you have the mindset and the will and desire to do it and put the time in.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: You're going to go through tough times - that's life. But I say, 'Nothing happens to you, it happens for you.' See the positive in negative events.

author: Pat Riley
quote: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges.

author: Saadi
quote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.

author: Jackie Kennedy
quote: If you bungle raising your children, I don't think whatever else you do matters very much.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: In politics stupidity is not a handicap.

author: Joseph Stalin
quote: It is enough that the people know there was an election. The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: If you put the federal government in charge of the Sahara Desert, in 5 years there'd be a shortage of sand.

author: John Quincy Adams
quote: Always vote for principle, though you may vote alone, and you may cherish the sweetest reflection that your vote is never lost.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: If you have always believed that everyone should play by the same rules and be judged by the same standards, that would have gotten you labeled a radical 60 years ago, a liberal 30 years ago and a racist today.

author: Aesop
quote: We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
quote: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy; that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.

author: Diogenes
quote: What I like to drink most is wine that belongs to others.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you.

author: Neil Gaiman
quote: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're doing something.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Be at war with your vices, at peace with your neighbors, and let every new year find you a better man.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: The object of a New Year is not that we should have a new year. It is that we should have a new soul and a new nose; new feet, a new backbone, new ears, and new eyes. Unless a particular man made New Year resolutions, he would make no resolutions. Unless a man starts afresh about things, he will certainly do nothing effective.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: And now we welcome the new year. Full of things that have never been.

author: Robert Frost
quote: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.

author: Rebecca Harding Davis
quote: The sun, the earth, love, friends, our very breath are parts of the banquet.

author: Pablo Neruda
quote: I want to do with you what spring does with cherry trees.

author: Lucy Larcom
quote: If the world's a veil of tears, Smile till rainbows span it.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: But God can only smile because only God can know what is coming next.

author: Donny Osmond
quote: I never smile unless I mean it.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
quote: The company of fools may first make us smile, but in the end we always feel melancholy.

author: Diane Lane
quote: I think that anybody that smiles automatically looks better.

author: Adriana Lima
quote: I was so embarrassed about mispronouncing words. I just knew how to smile.

author: Andre Maurois
quote: Smile, for everyone lacks self-confidence and more than any other one thing a smile reassures them.

author: Etta James
quote: When I look out at the people and they look at me and they're smiling, then I know that I'm loved. That is the time when I have no worries, no problems.

author: Thomas Gray
quote: Youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Laughter is day, and sobriety is night; a smile is the twilight that hovers gently between both, more bewitching than either.

author: Muriel Spark
quote: It is impossible to persuade a man who does not disagree, but smiles.

author: Goldie Hawn
quote: I have witnessed the softening of the hardest of hearts by a simple smile.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: If we ever forget that we are One Nation Under God, then we will be a nation gone under.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.

author: Josh Billings
quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.

author: George Eliot
quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions; they pass no criticisms.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: There are two means of refuge from the miseries of life: music and cats.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.
