author: Ogden Nash
quote: The trouble with a kitten is that eventually it becomes a cat.

author: Franklin P. Jones
quote: Scratch a dog and you'll find a permanent job.

author: Terry Pratchett
quote: In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this.

author: Roger Caras
quote: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I poured spot remover on my dog. Now he's gone.

author: William Hazlitt
quote: Prosperity is a great teacher; adversity a greater.

author: James Levine
quote: I was lucky that I met the right mentors and teachers at the right moment.

author: Mike Krzyzewski
quote: The thing I loved the most - and still love the most about teaching - is that you can connect with an individual or a group, and see that individual or group exceed their limits.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Everybody who is incapable of learning has taken to teaching.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.

author: Joe Manchin
quote: Every child should have a caring adult in their lives. And that's not always a biological parent or family member. It may be a friend or neighbor. Often times it is a teacher.

author: Woody Allen
quote: I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Let both sides seek to invoke the wonders of science instead of its terrors. Together let us explore the stars, conquer the deserts, eradicate disease, tap the ocean depths, and encourage the arts and commerce.

author: Henrik Ibsen
quote: It is inexcusable for scientists to torture animals; let them make their experiments on journalists and politicians.

author: Claude Bernard
quote: Art is I; science is we.

author: Jim Lovell
quote: From now on we live in a world where man has walked on the Moon. It's not a miracle; we just decided to go.

author: Rene Descartes
quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule, which served afterwards to solve other problems.

author: Nathan Deal
quote: Scientific advancement should aim to affirm and to improve human life.

author: George Henry Lewes
quote: Science is the systematic classification of experience.

author: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
quote: Science is a perception of the world around us. Science is a place where what you find in nature pleases you.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.

author: Horace Walpole
quote: In all science, error precedes the truth, and it is better it should go first than last.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: As long as we persevere and endure, we can get anything we want.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.

author: William Barclay
quote: Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory.

author: J. C. Watts
quote: It doesn't take a lot of strength to hang on. It takes a lot of strength to let go.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.

author: Saadi
quote: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.

author: Norman Cousins
quote: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.

author: Dorothy Thompson
quote: To have felt too much is to end in feeling nothing.

author: Rollo May
quote: Depression is the inability to construct a future.

author: Willie Nelson
quote: It doesn't hurt to feel sad from time to time.

author: Patrick Mahomes
quote: You can't have a good Thanksgiving meal without a little bit of ketchup on the side.

author: Queen Latifah
quote: I've been giving back since I was a teen, handing out turkeys at Thanksgiving and handing out toys at toys drives for Christmas. It's very important to give back as a youth. It's as simple as helping an old lady across the street or giving up your seat on the bus for someone who is pregnant.

author: Emily Wickersham
quote: I'm not the best in the kitchen, but if someone gives me something to do, I can do it. I'm a good teammate. Come Thanksgiving time, I kind of just do what my mom tells me to.

author: Coretta Scott King
quote: On Thanksgiving Night, 1942, when I was fifteen years old, white racists burned our house to the ground.

author: Peter Tosh
quote: Every year, I hear about Thanksgiving. Who do one give thanks to? ... And who is giving thanks? What are they giving thanks for? For lots of poverty that's on the earth and lots of war that is a-rumoring all over the earth? For lots of people who die daily and the crime that multiply?

author: Joan Rivers
quote: My mother loved entertaining, and I've followed suit, so we have big celebrations for New Year, Passover, Thanksgiving and birthdays.

author: Julia Child
quote: What a marvelous resource soup is for the thrifty cook - it solves the ham-bone and lamb-bone problems, the everlasting Thanksgiving turkey, the extra vegetables.

author: Joan Chen
quote: The romantic love we feel toward the opposite sex is probably one extra help from God to bring you together, but that's it. All the rest of it, the true love, is the test.

author: Katharine Lee Bates
quote: Love planted a rose, and the world turned sweet.

author: Paul Simon
quote: There's something about the sound of a train that's very romantic and nostalgic and hopeful.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: So the lover must struggle for words.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: When I give I give myself.

author: Stephen King
quote: French is the language that turns dirt into romance.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: The sound of a kiss is not so loud as that of a cannon, but its echo lasts a great deal longer.

author: Gertrude Stein
quote: Romance is everything.

author: Jean-Michel Basquiat
quote: Since I was seventeen I thought I might be a star. I'd think about all my heroes, Charlie Parker, Jimi Hendrix... I had a romantic feeling about how these people became famous.

author: Samuel Daniel
quote: Beauty, sweet love, is like the morning dew, Whose short refresh upon tender green, Cheers for a time, but till the sun doth show And straight is gone, as it had never been.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.

author: Warren Spahn
quote: Hitting is timing. Pitching is upsetting timing.

author: William James
quote: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they've got a second.

author: Herbert Hoover
quote: Fishing is much more than fish. It is the great occasion when we may return to the fine simplicity of our forefathers.

author: Rogers Hornsby
quote: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.

author: P. G. Wodehouse
quote: To find a man's true character, play golf with him.

author: Will Rogers
quote: I guess there is nothing that will get your mind off everything like golf. I have never been depressed enough to take up the game, but they say you get so sore at yourself you forget to hate your enemies.

author: Paul Coffey
quote: Nobody's a natural. You work hard to get good and then work to get better. It's hard to stay on top.

author: Billie Jean King
quote: A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.

author: Robert Kiyosaki
quote: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
quote: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.

author: Euripides
quote: Much effort, much prosperity.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.

author: Ross Perot
quote: Most people give up just when they're about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game one foot from a winning touchdown.

author: David Brinkley
quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.

author: Aeschylus
quote: Obedience is the mother of success and is wedded to safety.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: Anytime we step out boldly to make changes, we take a chance that we might fail. But the only way to get better is to try.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: People are lucky and unlucky not according to what they get absolutely, but according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
quote: If you knew that your life was merely a phase or short, short segment of your entire existence, how would you live? Knowing nothing 'real' was at risk, what would you do? You'd live a gigantic, bold, fun, dazzling life. You know you would. That's what the ghosts want us to do - all the exciting things they no longer can.

author: Mike Nichols
quote: The only safe thing is to take a chance.

author: Melinda Gates
quote: But we also believe in taking risks, because that's how you move things along.

author: Kevin Costner
quote: I haven't lived a perfect life. I have regrets. But that's from a lifetime of taking chances, making decisions, and trying not to be frozen. The only thing that I can do with my regrets is understand them.

author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
quote: There is no such thing as luck. It's a fancy name for being always at our duty, and so sure to be ready when good time comes.

author: Pierre Trudeau
quote: Luck, that's when preparation and opportunity meet.

author: John Glenn
quote: The most important thing we can do is inspire young minds and to advance the kind of science, math and technology education that will help youngsters take us to the next phase of space travel.

author: Johannes Kepler
quote: Planets move in ellipses with the Sun at one focus.

author: Nicolaus Copernicus
quote: In so many and such important ways, then, do the planets bear witness to the earth's mobility.

author: Jeff Bezos
quote: Great industries are never made from single companies. There is room in space for a lot of winners.

author: Elon Musk
quote: If we drive down the cost of transportation in space, we can do great things.

author: Dylan Taylor
quote: It takes a planet to explore the universe.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: When a place gets crowded enough to require ID's, social collapse is not far away. It is time to go elsewhere. The best thing about space travel is that it made it possible to go elsewhere.

author: John Milton
quote: The stars, that nature hung in heaven, and filled their lamps with everlasting oil, give due light to the misled and lonely traveller.

author: Rod Serling
quote: There is a fifth dimension, beyond that which is known to man. It is a dimension as vast as space and as timeless as infinity. It is the middle ground between light and shadow, between science and superstition.

author: Natalie Wood
quote: At night, when the sky is full of stars and the sea is still you get the wonderful sensation that you are floating in space.

author: Anatole France
quote: Only men who are not interested in women are interested in women's clothes. Men who like women never notice what they wear.

author: Bernard Williams
quote: Women have a favorite room, men a favorite chair.

author: John Barrymore
quote: The trouble with life is that there are so many beautiful women and so little time.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: Women's Lib? Oh, I'm afraid it doesn't interest me one bit. I've been so liberated it hurts.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Women wish to be loved without a why or a wherefore; not because they are pretty, or good, or well-bred, or graceful, or intelligent, but because they are themselves.

author: Marguerite Duras
quote: The house a woman creates is a Utopia. She can't help it - can't help trying to interest her nearest and dearest not in happiness itself but in the search for it.

author: Saint Teresa of Avila
quote: Those who give themselves to prayer should in a special manner have always a devotion to St. Joseph; for I know not how any man can think of the Queen of the angels, during the time that she suffered so much with the Infant Jesus, without giving thanks to St. Joseph for the services he rendered them then.

author: LL Cool J
quote: I am what I am, I'm doing very well in my life, and I'm thankful to God for that.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: Unseasonable kindness gets no thanks.

author: Jacques Maritain
quote: Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.

author: Elie Wiesel
quote: When a person doesn't have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity.

author: Jean Arp
quote: Soon silence will have passed into legend. Man has turned his back on silence. Day after day he invents machines and devices that increase noise and distract humanity from the essence of life, contemplation, meditation.

author: Alan Perlis
quote: In software systems it is often the early bird that makes the worm.

author: Georges Pompidou
quote: There are three roads to ruin; women, gambling and technicians. The most pleasant is with women, the quickest is with gambling, but the surest is with technicians.

author: Ralph Nader
quote: People are stunned to hear that one company has data files on 185 million Americans.

author: Al Boliska
quote: Do you realize if it weren't for Edison we'd be watching TV by candlelight?

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: This world of ours... must avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate, and be, instead, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect.

author: Mark Twain
quote: When people do not respect us we are sharply offended; yet in his private heart no man much respects himself.

author: Philip James Bailey
quote: Respect is what we owe; love, what we give.

author: Bono
quote: To be one, to be united is a great thing. But to respect the right to be different is maybe even greater.

author: Edward Gibbon
quote: I never make the mistake of arguing with people for whose opinions I have no respect.

author: Tecumseh
quote: Show respect to all people, but grovel to none.

author: Eli Whitney
quote: I have always believed that I should have had no difficulty in causing my rights to be respected.

author: Joan Didion
quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves - there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.

author: Hans Urs von Balthasar
quote: Even if a unity of faith is not possible, a unity of love is.

author: E. Stanley Jones
quote: Prayer is aligning ourselves with the purposes of God.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: Human beings must be known to be loved; but Divine beings must be loved to be known.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: If, then, you are looking for the way by which you should go, take Christ, because He Himself is the way.

author: Christopher Hitchens
quote: Religion is part of the human make-up. It's also part of our cultural and intellectual history. Religion was our first attempt at literature, the texts, our first attempt at cosmology, making sense of where we are in the universe, our first attempt at health care, believing in faith healing, our first attempt at philosophy.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: Let your religion be less of a theory and more of a love affair.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.

author: Alfred Russel Wallace
quote: I am thankful I can see much to admire in all religions.

author: Martin Heidegger
quote: Only a god can save us.

author: Washington Irving
quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: When a woman is talking to you, listen to what she says with her eyes.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: A person isn't who they are during the last conversation you had with them - they're who they've been throughout your whole relationship.

author: Mike Murdock
quote: Each relationship nurtures a strength or weakness within you.

author: Tom Hanks
quote: Truth is, I'll never know all there is to know about you just as you will never know all there is to know about me. Humans are by nature too complicated to be understood fully. So, we can choose either to approach our fellow human beings with suspicion or to approach them with an open mind, a dash of optimism and a great deal of candour.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love sought is good, but given unsought, is better.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: If civilization is to survive, we must cultivate the science of human relationships - the ability of all peoples, of all kinds, to live together, in the same world at peace.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
quote: Princes and governments are far more dangerous than other elements within society.

author: Daniel Webster
quote: The world is governed more by appearance than realities so that it is fully as necessary to seem to know something as to know it.

author: Bhumibol Adulyadej
quote: A good person can make another person good; it means that goodness will elicit goodness in the society; other persons will also be good.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: Society in every state is a blessing, but government, even in its best stage, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state an intolerable one.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: One can be instructed in society, one is inspired only in solitude.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Knowledge is power.

author: Peace Pilgrim
quote: If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.

author: Walter Annenberg
quote: The greatest power is not money power, but political power.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
quote: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Power is of two kinds. One is obtained by the fear of punishment and the other by acts of love. Power based on love is a thousand times more effective and permanent then the one derived from fear of punishment.

author: John Dalberg-Acton
quote: Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely.

author: Donald Cargill
quote: Farewell, dearest friend, never to see one another any more till at the right hand of Christ.

author: Quintus Ennius
quote: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning; for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.

author: Washington Irving
quote: The natural effect of sorrow over the dead is to refine and elevate the mind.

author: Ovid
quote: Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.

author: Anne Grant
quote: Grief is a normal and natural response to loss. It is originally an unlearned feeling process. Keeping grief inside increases your pain.

author: Henry Austin Dobson
quote: What ye have been ye still shall be, When we are dust the dust among, O yellow flowers!

author: Buddha
quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.

author: Audre Lorde
quote: Poetry is not only dream and vision; it is the skeleton architecture of our lives. It lays the foundations for a future of change, a bridge across our fears of what has never been before.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for the Creator, there is no poverty.

author: Rita Dove
quote: Poetry is language at its most distilled and most powerful.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything.

author: Jim Morrison
quote: If my poetry aims to achieve anything, it's to deliver people from the limited ways in which they see and feel.

author: David Carradine
quote: If you cannot be a poet, be the poem.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.

author: Allen Klein
quote: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.

author: George Allen, Sr.
quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.

author: Walt Disney
quote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.

author: William James
quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.

author: Richard M. DeVos
quote: Few things in the world are more powerful than a positive push. A smile. A world of optimism and hope. A 'you can do it' when things are tough.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.

author: Elon Musk
quote: Patience is a virtue, and I'm learning patience. It's a tough lesson.

author: Julius Caesar
quote: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

author: Robert H. Schuller
quote: Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.

author: John Quincy Adams
quote: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.

author: John Dryden
quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
quote: Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.

author: Sigmund Freud
quote: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father's protection.

author: Robert Fulghum
quote: Don't worry that children never listen to you; worry that they are always watching you.

author: Jane D. Hull
quote: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.

author: Plato
quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.

author: Billy Graham
quote: A child who is allowed to be disrespectful to his parents will not have true respect for anyone.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: You want a friend in Washington? Get a dog.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
quote: The Democrats are the party that says government will make you smarter, taller, richer, and remove the crabgrass on your lawn. The Republicans are the party that says government doesn't work and then they get elected and prove it.

author: Charles W. Pickering
quote: A healthy democracy requires a decent society; it requires that we are honorable, generous, tolerant and respectful.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Life without liberty is like a body without spirit.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: Politics is too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.

author: Newt Gingrich
quote: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: When bad men combine, the good must associate; else they will fall one by one, an unpitied sacrifice in a contemptible struggle.

author: Tom Peters
quote: Celebrate what you want to see more of.

author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
quote: Take a leap of faith and begin this wondrous new year by believing. Believe in yourself. And believe that there is a loving Source - a Sower of Dreams - just waiting to be asked to help you make your dreams come true.

author: Charles Kettering
quote: Every time you tear a leaf off a calendar, you present a new place for new ideas and progress.

author: Cavett Robert
quote: Character is the ability to carry out a good resolution long after the excitement of the moment has passed.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Sometimes too much to drink is barely enough.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.

author: Melody Beattie
quote: The new year stands before us, like a chapter in a book, waiting to be written. We can help write that story by setting goals.

author: Jonathan Edwards
quote: Resolution One: I will live for God. Resolution Two: If no one else does, I still will.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: I never worry about being driven to drink; I just worry about being driven home.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: A smile abroad is often a scowl at home.

author: Raymond Chandler
quote: She gave me a smile I could feel in my hip pocket.

author: Robert Smith
quote: I've always spent more time with a smile on my face than not, but the thing is, I don't write about it.

author: Malcolm de Chazal
quote: The flower in the vase smiles, but no longer laughs.

author: Bret Harte
quote: Never a lip is curved with pain that can't be kissed into smiles again.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.

author: Barack Obama
quote: We, the People, recognize that we have responsibilities as well as rights; that our destinies are bound together; that a freedom which only asks what's in it for me, a freedom without a commitment to others, a freedom without love or charity or duty or patriotism, is unworthy of our founding ideals, and those who died in their defense.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: Patriotism is when love of your own people comes first; nationalism, when hate for people other than your own comes first.

author: Edward Abbey
quote: A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.

author: Elmer Davis
quote: This nation will remain the land of the free only so long as it is the home of the brave.

author: George S. Patton
quote: Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.

author: Chris Kyle
quote: It was my duty to shoot the enemy, and I don't regret it. My regrets are for the people I couldn't save: Marines, soldiers, buddies. I'm not naive, and I don't romanticize war. The worst moments of my life have come as a SEAL. But I can stand before God with a clear conscience about doing my job.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
quote: The greatness of America lies not in being more enlightened than any other nation, but rather in her ability to repair her faults.

author: Voltaire
quote: It is lamentable, that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.

author: Bob Marley
quote: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.

author: Hans Christian Andersen
quote: Where words fail, music speaks.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.

author: Kinky Friedman
quote: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.

author: James Cromwell
quote: Pets are humanizing. They remind us we have an obligation and responsibility to preserve and nurture and care for all life.

author: Haile Selassie
quote: It is much easier to show compassion to animals. They are never wicked.

author: Andy Rooney
quote: The average dog is a nicer person than the average person.

author: Martin Buber
quote: An animal's eyes have the power to speak a great language.

author: James Herriot
quote: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.

author: Demetri Martin
quote: I love women, but I feel like you can't trust some of them. Some of them are liars, you know? Like I was in the park and I met this girl, she was cute and she had a dog. And I went up to her, we started talking. She told me her dog's name. Then I said, 'Does he bite?' She said, 'No.' And I said, 'Oh yeah? Then how does he eat?' Liar.

author: Jules Verne
quote: I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through.

author: Bernard Williams
quote: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.

author: Edith Wharton
quote: My little dog - a heartbeat at my feet.

author: Helen Keller
quote: What a blind person needs is not a teacher but another self.

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
quote: The true teacher defends his pupils against his own personal influence. He inspires self-trust. He guides their eyes from himself to the spirit that quickens him. He will have no disciples.

author: Philip Wylie
quote: One good teacher in a lifetime may sometimes change a delinquent into a solid citizen.

author: David Price
quote: The impending teacher shortage is the most critical education issue we will face in the next decade.

author: Minna Antrim
quote: Experience is a good teacher, but she sends in terrific bills.

author: Roger Moore
quote: Teach love, generosity, good manners and some of that will drift from the classroom to the home and who knows, the children will be educating the parents.

author: Edward Gibbon
quote: Every man who rises above the common level has received two educations: the first from his teachers; the second, more personal and important, from himself.

author: Doris Roberts
quote: Everybody's a teacher if you listen.

author: Jacques Yves Cousteau
quote: What is a scientist after all? It is a curious man looking through a keyhole, the keyhole of nature, trying to know what's going on.

author: Paul Valery
quote: The folly of mistaking a paradox for a discovery, a metaphor for a proof, a torrent of verbiage for a spring of capital truths, and oneself for an oracle, is inborn in us.

author: Konrad Lorenz
quote: It is a good morning exercise for a research scientist to discard a pet hypothesis every day before breakfast. It keeps him young.

author: Gaston Bachelard
quote: The characteristic of scientific progress is our knowing that we did not know.

author: E. Y. Harburg
quote: Leave the atom alone.

author: Stephen Jay Gould
quote: In science, 'fact' can only mean 'confirmed to such a degree that it would be perverse to withhold provisional assent.' I suppose that apples might start to rise tomorrow, but the possibility does not merit equal time in physics classrooms.

author: Russell Baker
quote: Inanimate objects can be classified scientifically into three major categories; those that don't work, those that break down and those that get lost.

author: Jean-Francois Lyotard
quote: Scientific knowledge is a kind of discourse.

author: Peter Marshall
quote: When we long for life without difficulties, remind us that oaks grow strong in contrary winds and diamonds are made under pressure.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: The soul that is within me no man can degrade.

author: Drew Barrymore
quote: Life is very interesting... in the end, some of your greatest pains, become your greatest strengths.

author: Audre Lorde
quote: If I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.

author: George Eliot
quote: There is no despair so absolute as that which comes with the first moments of our first great sorrow, when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and be healed, to have despaired and have recovered hope.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.

author: Mark Twain
quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.

author: Bill Blass
quote: Red is the ultimate cure for sadness.

author: Franz Schubert
quote: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.

author: Morrie Schwartz
quote: Dying is only one thing to be sad over... Living unhappily is something else.

author: John Madden
quote: Since 1981, I've spent every Thanksgiving Day broadcasting a game, and it is one of my favorite days. You can say, 'Woe is me, I never get to be part of the tradition,' or you can say, 'Heck, we've got our own tradition, and it's pretty good.'

author: John Clayton
quote: There is no racial or ethnic involvement in Thanksgiving, and people who may be very distant from the Christian system can see the beauty and the positive spirit that comes from the holiday.

author: James Patterson
quote: Always expect the unexpected. Right around Thanksgiving, when the new Alex Cross will be out. It's called Four Blind Mice and it's a pretty amazing story about several murders inside the military.

author: David Letterman
quote: It's so warm now, and Thanksgiving came so early - is it just me, or does it not really feel like Ramadan?

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Of all the music that reached farthest into heaven, it is the beating of a loving heart.

author: James Russell Lowell
quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.

author: Douglas Horton
quote: The more we are filled with thoughts of lust the less we find true romantic love.

author: Dorothy L. Sayers
quote: I love you - I am at rest with you - I have come home.

author: Fran Lebowitz
quote: Romantic love is mental illness. But it's a pleasurable one. It's a drug. It distorts reality, and that's the point of it. It would be impossible to fall in love with someone that you really saw.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: My heart is like a singing bird.

author: Billy Graham
quote: The word 'romance,' according to the dictionary, means excitement, adventure, and something extremely real. Romance should last a lifetime.

author: Bernard Williams
quote: If a June night could talk, it would probably boast it invented romance.

author: Tiger Woods
quote: Hockey is a sport for white men. Basketball is a sport for black men. Golf is a sport for white men dressed like black pimps.

author: Gordie Howe
quote: All hockey players are bilingual. They know English and profanity.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I see great things in baseball. It's our game - the American game.

author: John Madden
quote: The fewer rules a coach has, the fewer rules there are for players to break.

author: Sam Ewing
quote: Success has a simple formula: do your best, and people may like it.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.

author: William Feather
quote: Most of us regard good luck as our right, and bad luck as a betrayal of that right.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Luck marches with those who give their very best.

author: George Lucas
quote: Good luck has its storms.

author: Peter Diamandis
quote: If someone is always to blame, if every time something goes wrong someone has to be punished, people quickly stop taking risks. Without risks, there can't be breakthroughs.

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?

author: Michio Kaku
quote: One in 200 stars has habitable Earth-like planets surrounding it - in the galaxy, half a billion stars have Earth-like planets going around them - that's huge, half a billion. So when we look at the night sky, it makes sense that someone is looking back at us.

author: Erwin Schrodinger
quote: What we observe as material bodies and forces are nothing but shapes and variations in the structure of space.

author: E. B. White
quote: I see nothing in space as promising as the view from a Ferris wheel.

author: Richard Jefferies
quote: The heart looks into space to be away from earth.

author: Sally Ride
quote: When you're getting ready to launch into space, you're sitting on a big explosion waiting to happen.

author: Michael P. Anderson
quote: When you launch in a rocket, you're not really flying that rocket. You're just sort of hanging on.

author: Thomas Traherne
quote: You never enjoy the world aright, till the sea itself floweth in your veins, till you are clothed with the heavens and crowned with the stars.

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: After one look at this planet any visitor from outer space would say 'I want to see the manager.'

author: Larry Niven
quote: The dinosaurs became extinct because they didn't have a space program.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: Sometimes I think we're alone in the universe, and sometimes I think we're not. In either case the idea is quite staggering.

author: Dan Quayle
quote: For NASA, space is still a high priority.

author: Ron Paul
quote: Well, I don't think we should go to the moon. I think we maybe should send some politicians up there.

author: Chris Hadfield
quote: The world, when you look at it, it just can't be random. I mean, it's so different than the vast emptiness that is everything else, and even all the other planets we've seen, at least in our solar system, none of them even remotely resemble the precious life-giving nature of our own planet.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Telephone, n. An invention of the devil which abrogates some of the advantages of making a disagreeable person keep his distance.

author: Graham Greene
quote: Champagne, if you are seeking the truth, is better than a lie detector. It encourages a man to be expansive, even reckless, while lie detectors are only a challenge to tell lies successfully.

author: John Stuart Mill
quote: It is questionable if all the mechanical inventions yet made have lightened the day's toil of any human being.

author: John Cusack
quote: I force people to have coffee with me, just because I don't trust that a friendship can be maintained without any other senses besides a computer or cellphone screen.

author: Wernher von Braun
quote: For my confirmation, I didn't get a watch and my first pair of long pants, like most Lutheran boys. I got a telescope. My mother thought it would make the best gift.

author: William Lyon Phelps
quote: The final test of a gentleman is his respect for those who can be of no possible service to him.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: I have no right, by anything I do or say, to demean a human being in his own eyes. What matters is not what I think of him; it is what he thinks of himself. To undermine a man's self-respect is a sin.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: If once you forfeit the confidence of your fellow-citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.

author: Barry Bonds
quote: Everyone in society should be a role model, not only for their own self-respect, but for respect from others.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: We should all consider each other as human beings, and we should respect each other.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: Wonder is the basis of worship.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: Just as the soul fills the body, so God fills the world. Just as the soul bears the body, so God endures the world. Just as the soul sees but is not seen, so God sees but is not seen. Just as the soul feeds the body, so God gives food to the world.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: I'm a Muslim, but I think Jesus would have a drink with me. He would be cool. He would talk to me.

author: Unknown
quote: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.

author: Octavia E. Butler
quote: Religion is everywhere. There are no human societies without it, whether they acknowledge it as a religion or not.

author: Richard Burton
quote: The more I study religions the more I am convinced that man never worshipped anything but himself.

author: Paul Valery
quote: God made everything out of nothing, but the nothingness shows through.

author: Chuck Palahniuk
quote: Find joy in everything you choose to do. Every job, relationship, home... it's your responsibility to love it, or change it.

author: Keanu Reeves
quote: Falling in love and having a relationship are two different things.

author: Henry Winkler
quote: Assumptions are the termites of relationships.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: To catch a husband is an art; to hold him is a job.

author: Humphrey Bogart
quote: I was born when you kissed me. I died when you left me. I lived a few weeks while you loved me.

author: Katharine Hepburn
quote: Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then.

author: Robert Anthony
quote: The one who loves the least, controls the relationship.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: What love we've given, we'll have forever. What love we fail to give, will be lost for all eternity.

author: Sara Paretsky
quote: I'm lucky in having found the perfect partner to spend my life with.

author: Joyce Brothers
quote: Love comes when manipulation stops; when you think more about the other person than about his or her reactions to you. When you dare to reveal yourself fully. When you dare to be vulnerable.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: It isn't necessary to have relatives in Kansas City in order to be unhappy.

author: Hugh Mackay
quote: Nothing is perfect. Life is messy. Relationships are complex. Outcomes are uncertain. People are irrational.

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
quote: I want a man who's kind and understanding. Is that too much to ask of a millionaire?

author: Barbara Jordan
quote: Think what a better world it would be if we all, the whole world, had cookies and milk about three o'clock every afternoon and then lay down on our blankets for a nap.

author: C. Wright Mills
quote: Neither the life of an individual nor the history of a society can be understood without understanding both.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.

author: B. F. Skinner
quote: Society attacks early, when the individual is helpless.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: We are trying to construct a more inclusive society. We are going to make a country in which no one is left out.

author: Max Cannon
quote: People are going to behave however the social norms permit, and beyond that.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: I know of no safe depository of the ultimate powers of the society but the people themselves; and if we think them not enlightened enough to exercise their control with a wholesome discretion, the remedy is not to take it from them but to inform their discretion.

author: Margaret Thatcher
quote: There is no such thing as society: there are individual men and women, and there are families.

author: Sandra Day O'Connor
quote: Society as a whole benefits immeasurably from a climate in which all persons, regardless of race or gender, may have the opportunity to earn respect, responsibility, advancement and remuneration based on ability.

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: When a nation goes down, or a society perishes, one condition may always be found; they forgot where they came from. They lost sight of what had brought them along.

author: Karl A. Menninger
quote: What's done to children, they will do to society.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.

author: Pearl S. Buck
quote: Our society must make it right and possible for old people not to fear the young or be deserted by them, for the test of a civilization is the way that it cares for its helpless members.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: Silence is the ultimate weapon of power.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control; these three alone lead life to sovereign power.

author: Michel Foucault
quote: Power is not an institution, and not a structure; neither is it a certain strength we are endowed with; it is the name that one attributes to a complex strategical situation in a particular society.

author: Edward Abbey
quote: Power is always dangerous. Power attracts the worst and corrupts the best.

author: Frederick the Great
quote: A crown is merely a hat that lets the rain in.

author: Eric Hoffer
quote: The only way to predict the future is to have power to shape the future.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Force always attracts men of low morality.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: Most people can bear adversity; but if you wish to know what a man really is give him power.

author: Henry Kissinger
quote: Power is the great aphrodisiac.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: Experience hath shewn, that even under the best forms of government those entrusted with power have, in time, and by slow operations, perverted it into tyranny.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.

author: St. Jerome
quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.

author: Elon Musk
quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: If you're going through hell, keep going.

author: Arthur Ashe
quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

author: Confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

author: Samuel Beckett
quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.

author: Mark Twain
quote: If it's your job to eat a frog, it's best to do it first thing in the morning. And If it's your job to eat two frogs, it's best to eat the biggest one first.

author: William Blake
quote: Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Old friends pass away, new friends appear. It is just like the days. An old day passes, a new day arrives. The important thing is to make it meaningful: a meaningful friend - or a meaningful day.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long, you miss them.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The hardest thing to understand in the world is the income tax.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The lack of money is the root of all evil.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.

author: Bob Hope
quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: I prefer peace. But if trouble must come, let it come in my time, so that my children can live in peace.

author: George Orwell
quote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
quote: Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.

author: Saint Francis de Sales
quote: Never be in a hurry; do everything quietly and in a calm spirit. Do not lose your inner peace for anything whatsoever, even if your whole world seems upset.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: What is a poet? An unhappy person who conceals profound anguish in his heart but whose lips are so formed that as sighs and cries pass over them they sound like beautiful music.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.

author: Leonard Cohen
quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.

author: Novalis
quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.

author: Socrates
quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.

author: Bob Dylan
quote: I consider myself a poet first and a musician second. I live like a poet and I'll die like a poet.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.

author: Thomas Gray
quote: Poetry is thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.

author: Salvatore Quasimodo
quote: Poetry is the revelation of a feeling that the poet believes to be interior and personal which the reader recognizes as his own.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: The moment of change is the only poem.

author: Paul Dirac
quote: In science one tries to tell people, in such a way as to be understood by everyone, something that no one ever knew before. But in poetry, it's the exact opposite.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
quote: People deal too much with the negative, with what is wrong. Why not try and see positive things, to just touch those things and make them bloom?

author: Harvey Mackay
quote: When you wake up every day, you have two choices. You can either be positive or negative; an optimist or a pessimist. I choose to be an optimist. It's all a matter of perspective.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.

author: Bennett Cerf
quote: The person who can bring the spirit of laughter into a room is indeed blessed.

author: Robert H. Schuller
quote: It takes but one positive thought when given a chance to survive and thrive to overpower an entire army of negative thoughts.

author: Ethel Waters
quote: Today or any day that phone may ring and bring good news.

author: Willard Scott
quote: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all; and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.

author: Ted Nugent
quote: I surround myself with positive, productive people of good will and decency.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
quote: The learner always begins by finding fault, but the scholar sees the positive merit in everything.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.

author: George Savile
quote: A man who is a master of patience is master of everything else.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.

author: Helen Keller
quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.

author: Heraclitus
quote: Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.

author: Edith Sitwell
quote: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.

author: Helen Hayes
quote: Childhood is a short season.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Mothers all want their sons to grow up to be president, but they don't want them to become politicians in the process.

author: Peter Ustinov
quote: Parents are the bones on which children cut their teeth.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: Every word, facial expression, gesture, or action on the part of a parent gives the child some message about self-worth. It is sad that so many parents don't realize what messages they are sending.

author: Franklin P. Jones
quote: You can learn many things from children. How much patience you have, for instance.

author: James E. Faust
quote: To be a good father and mother requires that the parents defer many of their own needs and desires in favor of the needs of their children. As a consequence of this sacrifice, conscientious parents develop a nobility of character and learn to put into practice the selfless truths taught by the Savior Himself.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Always kiss your children goodnight, even if they're already asleep.

author: Frank A. Clark
quote: A baby is born with a need to be loved - and never outgrows it.

author: Mitt Romney
quote: My mom and dad gave their kids the greatest gift of all - the gift of unconditional love. They cared deeply about who we would be, and much less about what we would do.

author: Ben Stein
quote: Screaming at children over their grades, especially to the point of the child's tears, is child abuse, pure and simple. It's not funny and it's not good parenting. It is a crushing, scarring, disastrous experience for the child. It isn't the least bit funny.

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: Nothing you do for children is ever wasted. They seem not to notice us, hovering, averting our eyes, and they seldom offer thanks, but what we do for them is never wasted.

author: Noam Chomsky
quote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.

author: Ernest Benn
quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.

author: Will Rogers
quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.

author: Bernard Baruch
quote: Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing.

author: Cal Thomas
quote: One of the reasons people hate politics is that truth is rarely a politician's objective. Election and power are.

author: Aristotle
quote: Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
quote: At a dinner party one should eat wisely but not too well, and talk well but not too wisely.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Come, gentlemen, I hope we shall drink down all unkindness.

author: Aeschylus
quote: What is there more kindly than the feeling between host and guest?

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: Dinner was made for eating, not for talking.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right.

author: Natalie Portman
quote: Going to a party, for me, is as much a learning experience as, you know, sitting in a lecture.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: Good parties create a temporary youthfulness.

author: Hal Borland
quote: Year's end is neither an end nor a beginning but a going on, with all the wisdom that experience can instill in us.

author: Tucker Carlson
quote: I have no way of knowing how people really feel, but the vast majority of those I meet couldn't be nicer. Every once in a while someone barks at me. My New Year's resolution is not to bark back.

author: Walter Scott
quote: Each age has deemed the new-born year the fittest time for festal cheer.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
quote: If you are young and you drink a great deal it will spoil your health, slow your mind, make you fat - in other words, turn you into an adult.

author: Robert Fulghum
quote: If you want an interesting party sometime, combine cocktails and a fresh box of crayons for everyone.

author: Anthony J. D'Angelo
quote: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.

author: Aristotle
quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.

author: Lord Byron
quote: There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more.

author: Frederick Douglass
quote: It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.

author: Theodore Roethke
quote: Over every mountain there is a path, although it may not be seen from the valley.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.

author: Hans Christian Andersen
quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.

author: John Ruskin
quote: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.

author: Mark Twain
quote: In the Spring, I have counted 136 different kinds of weather inside of 24 hours.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.

author: Thomas S. Monson
quote: Courage, not compromise, brings the smile of God's approval.

author: Kin Hubbard
quote: If you haven't seen your wife smile at a traffic cop, you haven't seen her smile her prettiest.

author: Samuel Pepys
quote: As happy a man as any in the world, for the whole world seems to smile upon me!

author: Robert Powell
quote: I have found that a smile and a stick will carry you through all right, and in ninety-nine cases out of a hundred it is the smile that does the trick.

author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
quote: To smile at the jest which plants a thorn in another's breast is to become a principal in the mischief.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
quote: And the smile that is worth the praises of earth is the smile that shines through tears.

author: John Ray
quote: Beauty is power; a smile is its sword.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.

author: Earl Warren
quote: The most tragic paradox of our time is to be found in the failure of nation-states to recognize the imperatives of internationalism.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: Patriotism is the willingness to kill and be killed for trivial reasons.

author: Howard Zinn
quote: Dissent is the highest form of patriotism.

author: Pauline Hanson
quote: To survive in peace and harmony, united and strong, we must have one people, one nation, one flag.

author: Plato
quote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.

author: Billy Joel
quote: I think music in itself is healing. It's an explosive expression of humanity. It's something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we're from, everyone loves music.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.

author: Dick Clark
quote: Music is the soundtrack of your life.

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: Music doesn't lie. If there is something to be changed in this world, then it can only happen through music.

author: Marilyn Manson
quote: Music is the strongest form of magic.

author: Jane Goodall
quote: You cannot share your life with a dog, as I had done in Bournemouth, or a cat, and not know perfectly well that animals have personalities and minds and feelings.

author: Bill Dana
quote: I had been told that the training procedure with cats was difficult. It's not. Mine had me trained in two days.

author: Ann Landers
quote: Don't accept your dog's admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: The smallest feline is a masterpiece.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: No one appreciates the very special genius of your conversation as the dog does.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Dogs are better than human beings because they know but do not tell.

author: Rita Rudner
quote: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: The clever cat eats cheese and breathes down rat holes with baited breath.

author: Unknown
quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.

author: Quentin Tarantino
quote: Dogs got personality. Personality goes a long way.

author: Alfred North Whitehead
quote: If a dog jumps into your lap, it is because he is fond of you; but if a cat does the same thing, it is because your lap is warmer.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
quote: Never wear anything that panics the cat.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: Teaching is the only major occupation of man for which we have not yet developed tools that make an average person capable of competence and performance. In teaching we rely on the 'naturals', the ones who somehow know how to teach.

author: Bruce Barton
quote: The five steps in teaching an employee new skills are preparation, explanation, showing, observation and supervision.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: The strong man is the one who is able to intercept at will the communication between the senses and the mind.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Only one who devotes himself to a cause with his whole strength and soul can be a true master. For this reason mastery demands all of a person.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Only the weak are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong.

author: Max Lerner
quote: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: One who gains strength by overcoming obstacles possesses the only strength which can overcome adversity.

author: LL Cool J
quote: When adversity strikes, that's when you have to be the most calm. Take a step back, stay strong, stay grounded and press on.

author: William Blake
quote: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?

author: Steven Tyler
quote: Every life has a measure of sorrow, and sometimes this is what awakens us.

author: Taraji P. Henson
quote: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves, but it's there if you look deep.

author: Jackie Kennedy
quote: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.

author: Hannah Arendt
quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: If my world were to cave in tomorrow, I would look back on all the pleasures, excitements and worthwhilenesses I have been lucky enough to have had. Not the sadness, not my miscarriages or my father leaving home, but the joy of everything else. It will have been enough.

author: Sophocles
quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.

author: William Cowper
quote: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.

author: Golda Meir
quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart, don't know how to laugh either.

author: Ivo Andric
quote: Sadness is also a kind of defence.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast.

author: William Congreve
quote: Beauty is the lover's gift.

author: Pearl S. Buck
quote: Love alone could waken love.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: Romance is tempestuous. Love is calm.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
quote: In short I will part with anything for you but you.

author: Frida Kahlo
quote: I love you more than my own skin.

author: Glenn Beck
quote: Remember, beneath every cynic there lies a romantic, and probably an injured one.

author: Bette Davis
quote: Wave after wave of love flooded the stage and washed over me, the beginning of the one great durable romance of my life.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have lost at all.

author: Charles Kingsley
quote: Some say that the age of chivalry is past, that the spirit of romance is dead. The age of chivalry is never past, so long as there is a wrong left unredressed on earth.

author: Harry Connick, Jr.
quote: It is really rare to find someone you really, really love and that you want to spend your life with and all that stuff that goes along with being married. I am one of those lucky people. And I think she feels that way too. So the romantic stuff is easy because you want them to be happy.

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: Kiss me and you will see how important I am.

author: Carl Lewis
quote: Life is about timing.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The game of golf would lose a great deal if croquet mallets and billiard cues were allowed on the putting green.

author: Phil Jackson
quote: Approach the game with no preset agendas and you'll probably come away surprised at your overall efforts.

author: Bobby Knight
quote: You don't play against opponents, you play against the game of basketball.

author: Ben Hogan
quote: The only thing a golfer needs is more daylight.

author: Wilt Chamberlain
quote: Nobody roots for Goliath.

author: Ted Williams
quote: Baseball is the only field of endeavor where a man can succeed three times out of ten and be considered a good performer.

author: Robert Griffin III
quote: Football is football and talent is talent. But the mindset of your team makes all the difference.

author: Tom Clancy
quote: In battle, you forgive a man anything except an unwillingness to take risks. Sometimes you have to put it on the line.

author: Roy H. Williams
quote: According to String Theory, what appears to be empty space is actually a tumultuous ocean of strings vibrating at the precise frequencies that create the 4 dimensions you and I call height, width, depth and time.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Being brilliant is no great feat if you respect nothing.

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: There exist only three beings worthy of respect: the priest, the soldier, the poet. To know, to kill, to create.

author: Brendan Behan
quote: It's not that the Irish are cynical. It's rather that they have a wonderful lack of respect for everything and everybody.

author: Chris Christie
quote: And the greatest lesson that mom ever taught me though was this one. She told me there would be times in your life when you have to choose between being loved and being respected. Now she said to always pick being respected.

author: Elton John
quote: I'm not everybody's cup of tea. But sometimes criticism can be hurtful. Be respectful. I'm a good piano player, I can sing well, I write good songs. If you don't like it, fair enough. But give me a break.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: I have a respect for manners as such, they are a way of dealing with people you don't agree with or like.

author: Tupac Shakur
quote: I think I'm a natural-born leader. I know how to bow down to authority if it's authority that I respect.

author: Robert Casey
quote: Our moral, religious, and political traditions are united in their respect for the dignity of human life.

author: Camille Paglia
quote: Anti-religious sneers are a hallmark of perpetual adolescents.

author: Oswald Chambers
quote: We have to pray with our eyes on God, not on the difficulties.

author: Dwight L. Moody
quote: There are many of us that are willing to do great things for the Lord, but few of us are willing to do little things.

author: Saint Ignatius
quote: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Toleration is the best religion.

author: Frederick the Great
quote: Religion is the idol of the mob; it adores everything it does not understand.

author: William Blake
quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.

author: Franz Werfel
quote: Religion is the everlasting dialogue between humanity and God. Art is its soliloquy.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: We are always on the anvil; by trials God is shaping us for higher things.

author: Athanasius
quote: The Son of God became man so that we might become God.

author: John Morley
quote: Where it is a duty to worship the sun it is pretty sure to be a crime to examine the laws of heat.

author: Homer
quote: Yet, taught by time, my heart has learned to glow for other's good, and melt at other's woe.

author: Anthony J. D'Angelo
quote: Treasure your relationships, not your possessions.

author: Bill Vaughan
quote: Suburbia is where the developer bulldozes out the trees, then names the streets after them.

author: Angela Davis
quote: We have to talk about liberating minds as well as liberating society.

author: Friedrich August von Hayek
quote: If we wish to preserve a free society, it is essential that we recognize that the desirability of a particular object is not sufficient justification for the use of coercion.

author: Morihei Ueshiba
quote: Economy is the basis of society. When the economy is stable, society develops. The ideal economy combines the spiritual and the material, and the best commodities to trade in are sincerity and love.

author: George Washington
quote: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.

author: Epicurus
quote: It is folly for a man to pray to the gods for that which he has the power to obtain by himself.

author: Booker T. Washington
quote: Character is power.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Power has only one duty - to secure the social welfare of the People.

author: Sojourner Truth
quote: Truth is powerful and it prevails.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.

author: Walt Disney
quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.

author: Ralph Marston
quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.

author: Ken Venturi
quote: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

author: Aristotle
quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

author: George S. Patton
quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

author: Philip Sidney
quote: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.

author: Ezra Pound
quote: Either move or be moved.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

author: J. B. Priestley
quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day, a fresh try, one more start, with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Do not say, 'It is morning,' and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.

author: Dean Martin
quote: I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good as they're going to feel all day.

author: Bernard Williams
quote: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.

author: Larry King
quote: I remind myself every morning: Nothing I say this day will teach me anything. So if I'm going to learn, I must do it by listening.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Each day is a little life: every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death.

author: Prince
quote: Every day I feel is a blessing from God. And I consider it a new beginning. Yeah, everything is beautiful.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: I wake up every morning at nine and grab for the morning paper. Then I look at the obituary page. If my name is not on it, I get up.

author: Lindsay Lohan
quote: Everyone has highs and lows that they have to learn from, but every morning I start off with a good head on my shoulders, saying to myself, 'It's going to be a good day!'.

author: Abu Bakr
quote: It is a matter of shame that in the morning the birds should be awake earlier than you.

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Each morning when I awake, I experience again a supreme pleasure - that of being Salvador Dali.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: In a real dark night of the soul, it is always three o'clock in the morning, day after day.

author: Heraclitus
quote: The sun is new each day.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: There's no such thing as a free lunch.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: A penny saved is a penny earned.

author: John Wooden
quote: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.

author: Thomas Tusser
quote: A fool and his money are soon parted.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.

author: Francis of Assisi
quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.

author: Muhammad Ali
