quote: What inspires you, what excites you when you wake up in the morning?

author: Robert Orben
quote: Every morning I get up and look through the Forbes list of the richest people in America. If I'm not there, I go to work.

author: James Russell Lowell
quote: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do that day, which must be done, whether you like it or not.

author: Bram Stoker
quote: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.

author: Robert Duvall
quote: I love the smell of juice boxes in the morning.

author: Henry Miller
quote: I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: My pride fell with my fortunes.

author: Kin Hubbard
quote: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.

author: Marlon Brando
quote: Never confuse the size of your paycheck with the size of your talent.

author: Woody Allen
quote: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.

author: John Dewey
quote: No man's credit is as good as his money.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Money often costs too much.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Let us not be satisfied with just giving money. Money is not enough, money can be got, but they need your hearts to love them. So, spread your love everywhere you go.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: There is a gigantic difference between earning a great deal of money and being rich.

author: Christopher Marlowe
quote: Money can't buy love, but it improves your bargaining position.

author: Groucho Marx
quote: Alimony is like buying hay for a dead horse.

author: Josh Billings
quote: Money will buy a pretty good dog, but it won't buy the wag of his tail.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: The purpose of all wars, is peace.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.

author: William E. Gladstone
quote: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.

author: Helen Keller
quote: I do not want the peace which passeth understanding, I want the understanding which bringeth peace.

author: William Hazlitt
quote: Those who are at war with others are not at peace with themselves.

author: Thomas a Kempis
quote: First keep peace with yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous.

author: Benazir Bhutto
quote: Democracy is necessary to peace and to undermining the forces of terrorism.

author: James E. Faust
quote: We are bombarded on all sides by a vast number of messages we don't want or need. More information is generated in a single day than we can absorb in a lifetime. To fully enjoy life, all of us must find our own breathing space and peace of mind.

author: Robert Burton
quote: A quiet mind cureth all.

author: Tacitus
quote: A bad peace is even worse than war.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: I can promise you that women working together - linked, informed and educated - can bring peace and prosperity to this forsaken planet.

author: Alanis Morissette
quote: Peace of mind for five minutes, that's what I crave.

author: Potter Stewart
quote: Ethics is knowing the difference between what you have a right to do and what is right to do.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: More law, less justice.

author: Thomas Hobbes
quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.

author: Voltaire
quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.

author: Will Rogers
quote: Make crime pay. Become a lawyer.

author: William E. Gladstone
quote: Justice delayed is justice denied.

author: Honore de Balzac
quote: Laws are spider webs through which the big flies pass and the little ones get caught.

author: Julius Caesar
quote: If you must break the law, do it to seize power: in all other cases observe it.

author: Confucius
quote: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.

author: Kofi Annan
quote: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.

author: Plato
quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.

author: Voltaire
quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.

author: Bob Marley
quote: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.

author: Aristotle
quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.

author: George S. Patton
quote: If everyone is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.

author: Voltaire
quote: Common sense is not so common.

author: Ann Landers
quote: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

author: Aristotle
quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.

author: Rumi
quote: We are born of love; Love is our mother.

author: Ferdinand Foch
quote: The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Where there is love there is life.

author: Alphonse de Lamartine
quote: There is a woman at the beginning of all great things.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: Once the realization is accepted that even between the closest human beings infinite distances continue, a wonderful living side by side can grow, if they succeed in loving the distance between them which makes it possible for each to see the other whole against the sky.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them.

author: Cesare Pavese
quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.

author: Elon Musk
quote: Life is too short for long-term grudges.

author: Eminem
quote: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: William Morris
quote: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.

author: Eric Butterworth
quote: Don't go through life, grow through life.

author: John Lennon
quote: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.

author: Sai Baba
quote: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.

author: Henry Ford
quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.

author: Colin Powell
quote: Leadership is solving problems. The day soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you have stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help or concluded you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.

author: Chris Hadfield
quote: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: People who enjoy meetings should not be in charge of anything.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: A genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus but a molder of consensus.

author: George W. Bush
quote: Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.

author: Max Lucado
quote: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: I learned long ago, never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty, and besides, the pig likes it.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: Research is creating new knowledge.

author: Thomas Huxley
quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: There is no end to education. It is not that you read a book, pass an examination, and finish with education. The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.

author: Bill Gates
quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.

author: Michelle Obama
quote: We learned about honesty and integrity - that the truth matters... that you don't take shortcuts or play by your own set of rules... and success doesn't count unless you earn it fair and square.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.

author: Nick Lampson
quote: There is nothing nobler than risking your life for your country.

author: John M. McHugh
quote: As America celebrates Memorial Day, we pay tribute to those who have given their lives in our nation's wars.

author: Paul Tsongas
quote: America is hope. It is compassion. It is excellence. It is valor.

author: Eric Burdon
quote: On Memorial Day, I don't want to only remember the combatants. There were also those who came out of the trenches as writers and poets, who started preaching peace, men and women who have made this world a kinder place to live.

author: Bob Riley
quote: I have long believed that sacrifice is the pinnacle of patriotism.

author: Zebulon Pike
quote: May Heaven be propitious, and smile on the cause of my country.

author: Will Carleton
quote: Over all our happy country - over all our Nation spread, Is a band of noble heroes - is our Army of the Dead.

author: Christopher Gadsden
quote: What I can do for my country, I am willing to do.

author: Robert Charles Winthrop
quote: There are no points of the compass on the chart of true patriotism.

author: Alexander Smith
quote: I would rather be remembered by a song than by a victory.

author: Robert Reich
quote: True patriotism isn't cheap. It's about taking on a fair share of the burden of keeping America going.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.

author: Anton Chekhov
quote: Medicine is my lawful wife and literature my mistress; when I get tired of one, I spend the night with the other.

author: Edwin Way Teale
quote: For the mind disturbed, the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: A physician is not angry at the intemperance of a mad patient, nor does he take it ill to be railed at by a man in fever. Just so should a wise man treat all mankind, as a physician does his patient, and look upon them only as sick and extravagant.

author: Plato
quote: They certainly give very strange names to diseases.

author: Dizzy Dean
quote: The doctors x-rayed my head and found nothing.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.

author: Earl Wilson
quote: You may not be able to read a doctor's handwriting and prescription, but you'll notice his bills are neatly typewritten.

author: Ovid
quote: Time is generally the best doctor.

author: Peter Shaffer
quote: Passion, you see, can be destroyed by a doctor. It cannot be created.

author: Walter Matthau
quote: My doctor gave me six months to live, but when I couldn't pay the bill he gave me six months more.

author: Swami Sivananda
quote: Thinking of disease constantly will intensify it. Feel always 'I am healthily in body and mind'.

author: Mary Baker Eddy
quote: Disease is an experience of a so-called mortal mind. It is fear made manifest on the body.

author: Norman Cousins
quote: The human body experiences a powerful gravitational pull in the direction of hope. That is why the patient's hopes are the physician's secret weapon. They are the hidden ingredients in any prescription.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Marriage is neither heaven nor hell, it is simply purgatory.

author: James Dobson
quote: Don't marry the person you think you can live with; marry only the individual you think you can't live without.

author: Martin Luther
quote: Let the wife make the husband glad to come home, and let him make her sorry to see him leave.

author: St. Jerome
quote: Marriage is good for those who are afraid to sleep alone at night.

author: Andre Maurois
quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Keep your eyes wide open before marriage, half shut afterwards.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.

author: John Lyly
quote: Marriages are made in heaven and consummated on Earth.

author: Barbara Johnson
quote: Patience is the ability to idle your motor when you feel like stripping your gears.

author: Simone Weil
quote: Humility is attentive patience.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: Endurance is patience concentrated.

author: Lyman Abbott
quote: Patience is passion tamed.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Patience is necessary, and one cannot reap immediately where one has sown.

author: Holbrook Jackson
quote: Patience has its limits, take it too far and it's cowardice.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: How poor are they that have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees?

author: Mary Pierce
quote: Sometimes things aren't clear right away. That's where you need to be patient and persevere and see where things lead.

author: Guy Kawasaki
quote: Patience is the art of concealing your impatience.

author: Jesse Jackson
quote: I am not a perfect servant. I am a public servant doing my best against the odds. As I develop and serve, be patient. God is not finished with me yet.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: Abused patience turns to fury.

author: Swami Sivananda
quote: There is something good in all seeming failures. You are not to see that now. Time will reveal it. Be patient.

author: Randy Johnson
quote: Work hard. And have patience. Because no matter who you are, you're going to get hurt in your career and you have to be patient to get through the injuries.

author: William Golding
quote: He who rides the sea of the Nile must have sails woven of patience.

author: Christiaan Barnard
quote: Suffering isn't ennobling, recovery is.

author: Anne Roiphe
quote: Grief is in two parts. The first is loss. The second is the remaking of life.

author: Helen Rowland
quote: A man never knows how to say goodbye; a woman never knows when to say it.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: The moving finger writes, and having written moves on. Nor all thy piety nor all thy wit, can cancel half a line of it.

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.

author: Yoko Ono
quote: Healing yourself is connected with healing others.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Don't brood. Get on with living and loving. You don't have forever.

author: Tori Amos
quote: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: Never despair, but if you do, work on in despair.

author: Jennifer Aniston
quote: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.

author: Lord Byron
quote: The heart will break, but broken live on.

author: Erich Fromm
quote: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and, in a sense, tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side, yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother, and to become fully independent.

author: Carly Fiorina
quote: My mother taught me about the power of inspiration and courage, and she did it with a strength and a passion that I wish could be bottled.

author: Chris Brown
quote: My mother taught me to treat a lady respectfully.

author: Meryl Streep
quote: Motherhood has a very humanizing effect. Everything gets reduced to essentials.

author: Camille Paglia
quote: Every man must define his identity against his mother. If he does not, he just falls back into her and is swallowed up.

author: Adam Sandler
quote: I sing seriously to my mom on the phone. To put her to sleep, I have to sing 'Maria' from West Side Story. When I hear her snoring, I hang up.

author: Annette Funicello
quote: Of all the roles I've played, none has been as fulfilling as being a mother.

author: Ellen DeGeneres
quote: I ask people why they have deer heads on their walls. They always say because it's such a beautiful animal. There you go. I think my mother is attractive, but I have photographs of her.

author: Paul P. Harris
quote: Motherhood is at its best when the tender chords of sympathy have been touched.

author: Helen Hunt Jackson
quote: Motherhood is priced Of God, at price no man may dare To lessen or misunderstand.

author: Dorothy Fields
quote: The man in our society is the breadwinner; the woman has enough to do as the homemaker, wife and mother.

author: David Geffen
quote: I am truly my mother's son.

author: Kenny G
quote: That's my ideal day, time with my boys.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.

author: Francesca Annis
quote: Having children with someone is the real bond.

author: Roy L. Smith
quote: We are apt to forget that children watch examples better than they listen to preaching.

author: Muriel Spark
quote: Parents learn a lot from their children about coping with life.

author: Red Skelton
quote: Any kid will run any errand for you, if you ask at bedtime.

author: Samuel Goldwyn
quote: Give me a couple of years, and I'll make that actress an overnight success.

author: Joseph L. Mankiewicz
quote: The difference between life and the movies is that a script has to make sense, and life doesn't.

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: A film is a petrified fountain of thought.

author: Annette Bening
quote: Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.

author: Francois Truffaut
quote: Film lovers are sick people.

author: Yahoo Serious
quote: Movies are a complicated collision of literature, theatre, music and all the visual arts.

author: Steven Spielberg
quote: The most amazing thing for me is that every single person who sees a movie, not necessarily one of my movies, brings a whole set of unique experiences. Now, through careful manipulation and good storytelling, you can get everybody to clap at the same time, to hopefully laugh at the same time, and to be afraid at the same time.

author: Ezra Pound
quote: When two men in business always agree, one of them is unnecessary.

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: Those men get along best with women who can get along best without them.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: Men do not quit playing because they grow old; they grow old because they quit playing.

author: William Ellery Channing
quote: Every man is a volume if you know how to read him.

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
quote: By nature, men love newfangledness.

author: Edmund Waller
quote: Stronger by weakness, wiser men become.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: A bachelor is a guy who never made the same mistake once.

author: Democritus
quote: Do not trust all men, but trust men of worth; the former course is silly, the latter a mark of prudence.

author: Lawrence Durrell
quote: Like all young men I set out to be a genius, but mercifully laughter intervened.

author: Max Lerner
quote: Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts.

author: Daniel Webster
quote: Justice, sir, is the great interest of man on earth. It is the ligament which holds civilized beings and civilized nations together.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: 'Healing,' Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'

author: Rose Kennedy
quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?

author: Robert Delaunay
quote: Light in Nature creates the movement of colors.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: One of the most tragic things I know about human nature is that all of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.

author: John Updike
quote: Rain is grace; rain is the sky descending to the earth; without rain, there would be no life.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.

author: Mattie Stepanek
quote: Sunset is still my favorite color, and rainbow is second.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.

author: Richard Bach
quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world the master calls a butterfly.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit.

author: Sinclair Lewis
quote: Intellectually I know that America is no better than any other country; emotionally I know she is better than every other country.

author: George Jean Nathan
quote: Patriotism is often an arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles.

author: Lech Walesa
quote: The sole and basic source of our strength is the solidarity of workers, peasants and the intelligentsia, the solidarity of the nation, the solidarity of people who seek to live in dignity, truth, and in harmony with their conscience.

author: Marquis de Lafayette
quote: I gave my heart to the Americans and thought of nothing else but raising my banner and adding my colors to theirs.

author: Joe Barton
quote: Our flag honors those who have fought to protect it, and is a reminder of the sacrifice of our nation's founders and heroes. As the ultimate icon of America's storied history, the Stars and Stripes represents the very best of this nation.

author: Chiang Kai-shek
quote: Patriotism demands of us sustained sacrifice.

author: Robert Walpole
quote: Gentlemen have talked a great deal of patriotism. A venerable word, when duly practiced.

author: George McGovern
quote: The highest patriotism is not a blind acceptance of official policy, but a love of one's country deep enough to call her to a higher plain.

author: Bill Maher
quote: To me a real patriot is like a real friend. Who's your real friend? It's the person who tells you the truth. That's who my real friends are. So, you know, I think as far as our country goes, we need more people who will do that.

author: Virgil Thomson
quote: I look at you and I write down what I hear.

author: Missy Elliott
quote: Music should be your escape.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: Music is nothing else but wild sounds civilized into time and tune.

author: Duke Ellington
quote: The wise musicians are those who play what they can master.

author: John Lennon
quote: Music is everybody's possession. It's only publishers who think that people own it.

author: Ludwig van Beethoven
quote: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.

author: E. W. Howe
quote: When people hear good music, it makes them homesick for something they never had, and never will have.

author: Dizzy Gillespie
quote: I don't care much about music. What I like is sounds.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: No good opera plot can be sensible, for people do not sing when they are feeling sensible.

author: Stevie Nicks
quote: It was my 16th birthday - my mom and dad gave me my Goya classical guitar that day. I sat down, wrote this song, and I just knew that that was the only thing I could ever really do - write songs and sing them to people.

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: All good music resembles something. Good music stirs by its mysterious resemblance to the objects and feelings which motivated it.

author: Euripides
quote: Nothing has more strength than dire necessity.

author: John Locke
quote: Fortitude is the guard and support of the other virtues.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Never complain and never explain.

author: Pope John XXIII
quote: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.

author: Epictetus
quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.

author: William Blake
quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

author: Helen Rowland
quote: You will never win if you never begin.

author: William Feather
quote: Early morning cheerfulness can be extremely obnoxious.

author: Liam Neeson
quote: Some mornings you wake up and think, gee I look handsome today. Other days I think, what am I doing in the movies? I wanna go back to Ireland and drive a forklift.

author: Usain Bolt
quote: Manners is the key thing. Say, for instance, when you're growing up, you're walking down the street, you've got to tell everybody good morning. Everybody. You can't pass one person.

author: Madeleine Albright
quote: Most of the time I spend when I get up in the morning is trying to figure out what is going to happen.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: We sleep, but the loom of life never stops, and the pattern which was weaving when the sun went down is weaving when it comes up in the morning.

author: George Foreman
quote: I get up in the morning looking for an adventure.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.

author: Bruce Willis
quote: I wake up laughing. Yes, I wake up in the morning and there I am just laughing my head off.

author: Jim Davis
quote: Good morning is a contradiction of terms.

author: Sophocles
quote: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.

author: John Ruskin
quote: A little thought and a little kindness are often worth more than a great deal of money.

author: B. C. Forbes
quote: Real riches are the riches possessed inside.

author: Robert Collier
quote: All riches have their origin in mind. Wealth is in ideas - not money.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.

author: H. L. Hunt
quote: Money is just a way of keeping score.

author: John Maynard Keynes
quote: The importance of money flows from it being a link between the present and the future.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: I've got all the money I'll ever need, if I die by four o'clock.

author: Richard Armour
quote: That money talks, I'll not deny, I heard it once: It said, 'Goodbye'.

author: Doyle Brunson
quote: A man with money is no match against a man on a mission.

author: Ayrton Senna
quote: Money is a strange business. People who haven't got it aim it strongly. People who have are full of troubles.

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Liking money like I like it, is nothing less than mysticism. Money is a glory.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Where large sums of money are concerned, it is advisable to trust nobody.

author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
quote: You can find peace amidst the storms that threaten you.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: If they want peace, nations should avoid the pin-pricks that precede cannon shots.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: People always make war when they say they love peace.

author: Corazon Aquino
quote: As I came to power peacefully, so shall I keep it.

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: I am at peace with God. My conflict is with Man.

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
quote: Peace is not a relationship of nations. It is a condition of mind brought about by a serenity of soul. Peace is not merely the absence of war. It is also a state of mind. Lasting peace can come only to peaceful people.

author: Henry Miller
quote: If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having.

author: Richard Pryor
quote: There was a time in my life when I thought I had everything - millions of dollars, mansions, cars, nice clothes, beautiful women, and every other materialistic thing you can imagine. Now I struggle for peace.

author: Godfrey Reggio
quote: I think it's naive to pray for world peace if we're not going to change the form in which we live.

author: Helen Keller
quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.

author: Jimmy Dean
quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I busted a mirror and got seven years bad luck, but my lawyer thinks he can get me five.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Punishment is justice for the unjust.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
quote: If we desire respect for the law, we must first make the law respectable.

author: Otto von Bismarck
quote: Laws are like sausages, it is better not to see them being made.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: The best way to get a bad law repealed is to enforce it strictly.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: If the machine of government is of such a nature that it requires you to be the agent of injustice to another, then, I say, break the law.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Only one thing is impossible for God: To find any sense in any copyright law on the planet.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.

author: Marcus Garvey
quote: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.

author: Socrates
quote: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.

author: Abu Bakr
quote: Without knowledge action is useless and knowledge without action is futile.

author: Nicolaus Copernicus
quote: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.

author: Charles Spurgeon
quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.

author: Unknown
quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: Consider your origins: you were not made to live as brutes, but to follow virtue and knowledge.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.

author: Michelangelo
quote: I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set him free.

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: A day without laughter is a day wasted.

author: Steven Wright
quote: Everywhere is within walking distance if you have the time.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Humor is mankind's greatest blessing.

author: e. e. cummings
quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.

author: Stephen Covey
quote: Every human has four endowments - self awareness, conscience, independent will and creative imagination. These give us the ultimate human freedom... The power to choose, to respond, to change.

author: Susan B. Anthony
quote: Independence is happiness.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: Jealousy contains more of self-love than of love.

author: Gary Allan
quote: You can be the moon and still be jealous of the stars.

author: Heidi Klum
quote: I think it's important to get your surroundings as well as yourself into a positive state - meaning surround yourself with positive people, not the kind who are negative and jealous of everything you do.

author: B. C. Forbes
quote: Jealousy... is a mental cancer.

author: Henry Ford
quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.

author: Socrates
quote: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.

author: Plutarch
quote: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.

author: Roy H. Williams
quote: A smart man makes a mistake, learns from it, and never makes that mistake again. But a wise man finds a smart man and learns from him how to avoid the mistake altogether.

author: James Madison
quote: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: I'm not the smartest fellow in the world, but I can sure pick smart colleagues.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder.

author: Unknown
quote: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive.

author: Thornton Wilder
quote: Love is an energy which exists of itself. It is its own value.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.

author: Sarah Bernhardt
quote: Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.

author: David Viscott
quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.

author: William Feather
quote: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.

author: Jackie Robinson
quote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.

author: Charles Darwin
quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.

author: Sholom Aleichem
quote: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.

author: E. M. Forster
quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Ships that pass in the night, and speak each other in passing, only a signal shown, and a distant voice in the darkness; So on the ocean of life, we pass and speak one another, only a look and a voice, then darkness again and a silence.

author: Havelock Ellis
quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.

author: Bob Marley
quote: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?

author: George Washington Carver
quote: Where there is no vision, there is no hope.

author: Roy E. Disney
quote: When your values are clear to you, making decisions becomes easier.

author: Bill Bradley
quote: Leadership is unlocking people's potential to become better.

author: J. P. Morgan
quote: Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you'll be able to see farther.

author: Marco Rubio
quote: Leadership can not be measured in a poll or even in the result of an election. It can only be truly seen with the benefit of time. From the perspective of 20 years, not 20 days.

author: Henry Kissinger
quote: The task of the leader is to get his people from where they are to where they have not been.

author: Sam Walton
quote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.

author: Carl W. Buehner
quote: They may forget what you said - but they will never forget how you made them feel.

author: Confucius
quote: He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.

author: Euripides
quote: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
quote: In youth we learn; in age we understand.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: God lets everything happen for a reason. It's all a learning process, and you have to go from one level to another.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: A single conversation across the table with a wise man is better than ten years mere study of books.

author: Michelangelo
quote: I am still learning.

author: Richard Branson
quote: You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.

author: Louisa May Alcott
quote: I am not afraid of storms for I am learning how to sail my ship.

author: Fred Astaire
quote: The hardest job kids face today is learning good manners without seeing any.

author: Herbert Croly
quote: The average American is nothing if not patriotic.

author: Alexander Henry
quote: On what rests the hope of the republic? One country, one language, one flag!

author: Michael Ignatieff
quote: There's intense national feeling in America that could be called patriotism.

author: Jim Ramstad
quote: The heroes of Flight 93 won the first battle in the War on Terror, and they should never be forgotten.

author: Frank Knox
quote: Patriotism was a living fire of unquestioned belief and purpose.

author: Doc Hastings
quote: In remembering those who lost their lives in the London attacks and the September 11th attacks we continue our commitment to fighting for freedom, democracy and justice.

author: Edward Everett Hale
quote: In the name of Hypocrites, doctors have invented the most exquisite form of torture ever known to man: survival.

author: Michael Landon
quote: You can die of the cure before you die of the illness.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.

author: Samuel Hahnemann
quote: The physician's highest calling, his only calling, is to make sick people healthy - to heal, as it is termed.

author: Rita Rudner
quote: I was going to have cosmetic surgery until I noticed that the doctor's office was full of portraits by Picasso.

author: Ivan Illich
quote: Modern medicine is a negation of health. It isn't organized to serve human health, but only itself, as an institution. It makes more people sick than it heals.

author: Ben Carson
quote: We should be concerned not only about the health of individual patients, but also the health of our entire society.

author: Booth Tarkington
quote: An ideal wife is any woman who has an ideal husband.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.

author: Joyce Brothers
quote: Marriage is not just spiritual communion, it is also remembering to take out the trash.

author: John Florio
quote: A good husband makes a good wife.

author: Rita Rudner
quote: I love being married. It's so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.

author: Michel de Montaigne
quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.

author: Sacha Guitry
quote: When a man steals your wife, there is no better revenge than to let him keep her.

author: James Russell Lowell
quote: Endurance is the crowning quality, And patience all the passion of great hearts.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
quote: Patience is the support of weakness; impatience the ruin of strength.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Patience, n. A minor form of dispair, disguised as a virtue.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: I'm patient.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort, a little more patience would have achieved success.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: To bear with patience wrongs done to oneself is a mark of perfection, but to bear with patience wrongs done to someone else is a mark of imperfection and even of actual sin.

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: I tell you the past is a bucket of ashes, so live not in your yesterdays, no just for tomorrow, but in the here and now. Keep moving and forget the post mortems; and remember, no one can get the jump on the future.

author: Demi Lovato
quote: Recovery is something that you have to work on every single day and it's something that it doesn't get a day off.

author: Mattie Stepanek
quote: We all have life storms, and when we get the rough times and we recover from them, we should celebrate that we got through it. No matter how bad it may seem, there's always something beautiful that you can find.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
quote: Love is like the measles; we all have to go through it.

author: Michael W. Smith
quote: Transformation in the world happens when people are healed and start investing in other people.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: The willow which bends to the tempest, often escapes better than the oak which resists it; and so in great calamities, it sometimes happens that light and frivolous spirits recover their elasticity and presence of mind sooner than those of a loftier character.

author: Tyler Perry
quote: Everyone can relate to love, hurt, pain, learning how to forgive, needing to get over, needing the power of God in their life.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: My life is about ups and downs, great joys and great losses.

author: Ann Landers
quote: Expect trouble as an inevitable part of life and repeat to yourself, the most comforting words of all; this, too, shall pass.

author: Billy Graham
quote: Tears shed for self are tears of weakness, but tears shed for others are a sign of strength.

author: Danica Patrick
quote: Take those chances and you can achieve greatness, whereas if you go conservative, you'll never know. I truly believe what doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Even if you fail, learning and moving on is sometimes the best thing.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: Feeling sorry for ourselves is the most useless waste of energy on the planet. It does absolutely no good. We can't let our circumstances or what others do or don't do control us. We can decide to be happy regardless.

author: Horace
quote: It is the false shame of fools to try to conceal wounds that have not healed.

author: Ann Romney
quote: It's the moms of this nation - single, married, widowed - who really hold this country together. We're the mothers, we're the wives, we're the grandmothers, we're the big sisters, we're the little sisters, we're the daughters. You know it's true, don't you? You're the ones who always have to do a little more.

author: Rose Kennedy
quote: What greater aspiration and challenge are there for a mother than the hope of raising a great son or daughter?

author: Arianna Huffington
quote: The fastest way to break the cycle of perfectionism and become a fearless mother is to give up the idea of doing it perfectly - indeed to embrace uncertainty and imperfection.

author: Claudette Colbert
quote: Why do grandparents and grandchildren get along so well? The mother.

author: Benjamin Spock
quote: There are only two things a child will share willingly; communicable diseases and its mother's age.

author: Candice Bergen
quote: I guess I was a mom so late in life, my daughter was the greatest thing since sliced bread.

author: Jane Elliot
quote: I loved raising my kids. I loved the process, the dirt of it, the tears of it, the frustration of it, Christmas, Easter, birthdays, growth charts, pediatrician appointments. I loved all of it.

author: Rebecca West
quote: Motherhood is the strangest thing, it can be like being one's own Trojan horse.

author: Jim Morrison
quote: Film spectators are quiet vampires.

author: Sydney Pollack
quote: Every single art form is involved in film, in a way.

author: Bette Davis
quote: I don't take the movies seriously, and anyone who does is in for a headache.

author: George Lucas
quote: The secret to film is that it's an illusion.

author: Mel Brooks
quote: A cinema villain essentially needs a moustache so he can twiddle with it gleefully as he cooks up his next nasty plan.

author: Will Rogers
quote: I'm not a real movie star. I've still got the same wife I started out with twenty-eight years ago.

author: Mary Schmich
quote: You can map your life through your favorite movies, and no two people's maps will be the same.

author: Jeff Bridges
quote: Movies are like magic tricks.

author: Louise Brooks
quote: The great art of films does not consist of descriptive movement of face and body but in the movements of thought and soul transmitted in a kind of intense isolation.

author: Mary Pickford
quote: Make them laugh, make them cry, and hack to laughter. What do people go to the theatre for? An emotional exercise. I am a servant of the people. I have never forgotten that.

author: Wim Wenders
quote: Movies are something people see all over the world because there is a certain need for it.

author: Kin Hubbard
quote: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.

author: Cyril Connolly
quote: The true index of a man's character is the health of his wife.

author: Laurence Sterne
quote: Men tire themselves in pursuit of rest.

author: Emil Zatopek
quote: It's at the borders of pain and suffering that the men are separated from the boys.

author: Keith Miller
quote: No gentleman ever discusses any relationship with a lady.

author: Jerry Seinfeld
quote: Men don't care what's on TV. They only care what else is on TV.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Men are more easily governed through their vices than through their virtues.

author: Clarence Darrow
quote: I am an agnostic; I do not pretend to know what many ignorant men are sure of.

author: Bette Davis
quote: Men become much more attractive when they start looking older. But it doesn't do much for women, though we do have an advantage: make-up.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.

author: Mary Webb
quote: Nature's music is never over; her silences are pauses, not conclusions.

author: Diogenes
quote: The sun, too, shines into cesspools and is not polluted.

author: Russell Baker
quote: Ah, summer, what power you have to make us suffer and like it.

author: Diane Ackerman
quote: Nothing is more memorable than a smell. One scent can be unexpected, momentary and fleeting, yet conjure up a childhood summer beside a lake in the mountains.

author: Jean Ingelow
quote: The moon looks upon many night flowers; the night flowers see but one moon.

author: Moliere
quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.

author: George Santayana
quote: To me, it seems a dreadful indignity to have a soul controlled by geography.

author: Bill Vaughan
quote: A real patriot is the fellow who gets a parking ticket and rejoices that the system works.

author: Tecumseh
quote: Let us form one body, one heart, and defend to the last warrior our country, our homes, our liberty, and the graves of our fathers.

author: Barbara Ehrenreich
quote: No matter that patriotism is too often the refuge of scoundrels. Dissent, rebellion, and all-around hell-raising remain the true duty of patriots.

author: James Joyce
quote: A nation is the same people living in the same place.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: 'My country, right or wrong' is a thing no patriot would ever think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying 'My mother, drunk or sober.'

author: Dick Dale
quote: Every song is like a painting.

author: Billy Wilder
quote: He has Van Gogh's ear for music.

author: Les Baxter
quote: Any good music must be an innovation.

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: Music is my religion.

author: Ray Charles
quote: I was born with music inside me. Music was one of my parts. Like my ribs, my kidneys, my liver, my heart. Like my blood. It was a force already within me when I arrived on the scene. It was a necessity for me - like food or water.

author: Joni Mitchell
quote: I see music as fluid architecture.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.

author: Wayne Dyer
quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.

author: Kyle Chandler
quote: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.

author: Joan of Arc
quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.

author: Wilbur Wright
quote: We could hardly wait to get up in the morning.

author: Marsha Sinetar
quote: Burning desire to be or do something gives us staying power - a reason to get up every morning or to pick ourselves up and start in again after a disappointment.

author: Joyce Brothers
quote: Credit buying is much like being drunk. The buzz happens immediately and gives you a lift... The hangover comes the day after.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.

author: Joe Moore
quote: A simple fact that is hard to learn is that the time to save money is when you have some.

author: Maria Schell
quote: Peace is when time doesn't matter as it passes by.

author: Mikhail Gorbachev
quote: What we need is Star Peace and not Star Wars.

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old bray of my heart. I am. I am. I am.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
quote: Peace hath higher tests of manhood, than battle ever knew.

author: Lech Walesa
quote: I most sincerely wish that the world in which we live be free from the threat of a nuclear holocaust and from the ruinous arms race. It is my cherished desire that peace be not separated from freedom which is the right of every nation. This I desire and for this I pray.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: Let there be work, bread, water and salt for all.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.

author: Francis of Assisi
quote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

author: Vince Lombardi
quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.

author: Kevyn Aucoin
quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!

author: Louis XIV
quote: It is legal because I wish it.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: Collecting more taxes than is absolutely necessary is legalized robbery.

author: Plato
quote: Justice in the life and conduct of the State is possible only as first it resides in the hearts and souls of the citizens.

author: William Gaddis
quote: Justice? You get justice in the next world, in this world you have the law.

author: Addison Mizner
quote: Ignorance of the law excuses no man from practicing it.

author: Charles Lamb
quote: He is no lawyer who cannot take two sides.

author: William Godwin
quote: Justice is the sum of all moral duty.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law; and those who have most to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Love begins by taking care of the closest ones - the ones at home.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: The ache for home lives in all of us, the safe place where we can go as we are and not be questioned.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: Where we love is home - home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.

author: Confucius
quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.

author: William Morris
quote: Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful.

author: Billy Graham
quote: My home is in Heaven. I'm just traveling through this world.

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.

author: Suze Orman
quote: Owning a home is a keystone of wealth - both financial affluence and emotional security.

author: Confucius
quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality.

author: John Naisbitt
quote: We are drowning in information but starved for knowledge.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.

author: Marilyn vos Savant
quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.

author: Warren Buffett
quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.

author: John Archibald Wheeler
quote: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.

author: Richard Cecil
quote: The first step towards knowledge is to know that we are ignorant.

author: Tom Clancy
quote: The control of information is something the elite always does, particularly in a despotic form of government. Information, knowledge, is power. If you can control information, you can control people.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.

author: Billy Graham
quote: When wealth is lost, nothing is lost; when health is lost, something is lost; when character is lost, all is lost.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: If you can imagine it, you can achieve it. If you can dream it, you can become it.

author: Mark Twain
quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.

author: Robin Williams
quote: You're only given a little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.

author: Joseph Joubert
quote: Imagination is the eye of the soul.

author: George Orwell
quote: If you want a vision of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face - forever.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: A man may imagine things that are false, but he can only understand things that are true, for if the things be false, the apprehension of them is not understanding.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: The man who has no imagination has no wings.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Everything you can imagine is real.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Imagination rules the world.

author: Will Rogers
quote: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: From there to here, and here to there, funny things are everywhere.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: If I had no sense of humor, I would long ago have committed suicide.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.

author: Aristotle
quote: The secret to humor is surprise.

author: Victor Borge
quote: Laughter is the closest distance between two people.

author: E. B. White
quote: Analyzing humor is like dissecting a frog. Few people are interested and the frog dies of it.

author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
quote: My mother told me to be a lady. And for her, that meant be your own person, be independent.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Unlike a drop of water which loses its identity when it joins the ocean, man does not lose his being in the society in which he lives. Man's life is independent. He is born not for the development of the society alone, but for the development of his self.

author: Malcolm Forbes
quote: Diversity: the art of thinking independently together.

author: Thomas J. Watson
quote: Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the danger of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of 'crackpot' than the stigma of conformity.

author: Caroline Kennedy
quote: The bedrock of our democracy is the rule of law and that means we have to have an independent judiciary, judges who can make decisions independent of the political winds that are blowing.

author: Diane von Furstenberg
quote: I wanted to be an independent woman, a woman who could pay for her bills, a woman who could run her own life - and I became that woman.

author: Brigham Young
quote: True independence and freedom can only exist in doing what's right.

author: Voltaire
quote: Injustice in the end produces independence.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: There is no dignity quite so impressive, and no one independence quite so important, as living within your means.

author: James Baldwin
quote: It is very nearly impossible... to become an educated person in a country so distrustful of the independent mind.

author: William F. Buckley, Jr.
quote: There is an inverse relationship between reliance on the state and self-reliance.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
quote: Those who won our independence... valued liberty as an end and as a means. They believed liberty to be the secret of happiness and courage to be the secret of liberty.

author: Oliver Stone
quote: Never underestimate the power of jealousy and the power of envy to destroy. Never underestimate that.

author: Lope de Vega
quote: There is no greater glory than love, nor any greater punishment than jealousy.

author: William Penn
quote: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.

author: Mary Schmich
quote: Don't waste time on jealousy. Sometimes you're ahead, sometimes you're behind.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: He that is jealous is not in love.

author: Aristotle
quote: Jealousy is both reasonable and belongs to reasonable men, while envy is base and belongs to the base, for the one makes himself get good things by jealousy, while the other does not allow his neighbour to have them through envy.

author: George Washington
quote: It will be found an unjust and unwise jealousy to deprive a man of his natural liberty upon the supposition he may abuse it.

author: Max Frisch
quote: Jealousy is the fear of comparison.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.

author: Dolly Parton
quote: I'm not offended by all the dumb blonde jokes because I know I'm not dumb... and I also know that I'm not blonde.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: An intelligent man is sometimes forced to be drunk to spend time with his fools.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: When a true genius appears, you can know him by this sign: that all the dunces are in a confederacy against him.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
quote: My mind rebels at stagnation. Give me problems, give me work, give me the most abstruse cryptogram, or the most intricate analysis, and I am in my own proper atmosphere. But I abhor the dull routine of existence. I crave for mental exaltation.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: To expect the unexpected shows a thoroughly modern intellect.

author: Roger Ebert
quote: Your intellect may be confused, but your emotions will never lie to you.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.

author: John Lennon
quote: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.

author: Franklin P. Jones
quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.

author: Honore de Balzac
quote: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.

author: Torquato Tasso
quote: True love cannot be found where it does not exist, nor can it be denied where it does.

author: May Sarton
quote: There is only one real deprivation... and that is not to be able to give one's gifts to those one loves most.

author: Joyce Brothers
quote: The best proof of love is trust.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.

author: Muriel Spark
quote: It is impossible to repent of love. The sin of love does not exist.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.

author: Amelia Barr
quote: The fate of love is that it always seems too little or too much.

author: George Washington Carver
quote: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.

author: Peter De Vries
quote: Life is a zoo in a jungle.

author: William Wallace
quote: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

author: Robert Byrne
quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.

author: Walter Hagen
quote: You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.

author: Socrates
quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles; but today it means getting along with people.

author: Ray Kroc
quote: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat.

author: Tom Peters
quote: If a window of opportunity appears, don't pull down the shade.

author: John D. Rockefeller
quote: Good leadership consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.

author: Margaret Fuller
quote: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.

author: Confucius
quote: The cautious seldom err.

author: Tony Blair
quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.

author: Bernard Baruch
quote: Millions saw the apple fall, but Newton was the one who asked why.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: In fair weather prepare for foul.

author: James Cash Penney
quote: Honor bespeaks worth. Confidence begets trust. Service brings satisfaction. Cooperation proves the quality of leadership.

author: Andrew Carnegie
quote: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit for doing it.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: We now accept the fact that learning is a lifelong process of keeping abreast of change. And the most pressing task is to teach people how to learn.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote: Research is formalized curiosity. It is poking and prying with a purpose.

author: Will Rogers
quote: A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.

author: Angelina Jolie
quote: Without pain, there would be no suffering, without suffering we would never learn from our mistakes. To make it right, pain and suffering is the key to all windows, without it, there is no way of life.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: The first problem for all of us, men and women, is not to learn, but to unlearn.

author: Eric Hoffer
quote: In times of change learners inherit the earth; while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.

author: Carl Friedrich Gauss
quote: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.

author: Denis Diderot
quote: The best doctor is the one you run to and can't find.

author: Nicolas Cage
quote: I was always shocked when I went to the doctor's office and they did my X-ray and didn't find that I had eight more ribs than I should have or that my blood was the color green.

author: Martin H. Fischer
quote: In the sick room, ten cents' worth of human understanding equals ten dollars' worth of medical science.

author: Thomas Sydenham
quote: The art of medicine was to be properly learned only from its practice and its exercise.

author: Oliver Cromwell
quote: Nature can do more than physicians.

author: Dianne Feinstein
quote: Today we have a health insurance industry where the first and foremost goal is to maximize profits for shareholders and CEOs, not to cover patients who have fallen ill or to compensate doctors and hospitals for their services. It is an industry that is increasingly concentrated and where Americans are paying more to receive less.

author: Cass Canfield
quote: Some people think that doctors and nurses can put scrambled eggs back in the shell.

author: Jay London
quote: I went to the doctor and he said I had acute appendicitis, and I said compared to who?

author: Mae West
quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution.

author: Billy Connolly
quote: Marriage is a wonderful invention: then again, so is a bicycle repair kit.

author: Sophia Bush
quote: Marriage is not about age; it's about finding the right person.

author: Homer
quote: There is nothing nobler or more admirable than when two people who see eye to eye keep house as man and wife, confounding their enemies and delighting their friends.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: When you make the sacrifice in marriage, you're sacrificing not to each other but to unity in a relationship.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: Fortune knocks but once, but misfortune has much more patience.

author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield
quote: Patience is the most necessary quality for business, many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.

author: Thomas Hardy
quote: Patience, that blending of moral courage with physical timidity.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Who ever is out of patience is out of possession of their soul.

author: Maxwell Maltz
quote: Man maintains his balance, poise, and sense of security only as he is moving forward.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.

author: Arnold Bennett
quote: Mother is far too clever to understand anything she does not like.

author: E. W. Howe
quote: If there were no schools to take the children away from home part of the time, the insane asylums would be filled with mothers.

author: Mike Krzyzewski
quote: Throughout my life, my mom has been the person that I've always looked up to.

author: Jane Fonda
quote: A mother who is obsessing about being thin and dieting and exercising is not going to be a very good mother.

author: Al Lewis
quote: What motivated me? My mother. My mother was an immigrant woman, a peasant woman, struggled all her life, worked in the garment center.

author: Kate Hudson
quote: I auditioned on my own. I tried to make a mark for myself without anybody's help, not even Mom's.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: I have a love interest in every one of my films: a gun.

author: Woody Allen
quote: If my films make one more person miserable, I'll feel I have done my job.

author: Oliver Stone
quote: I do believe that movies are subject to a million interpretations.

author: John Lasseter
quote: If you're sitting in your minivan, playing your computer animated films for your children in the back seat, is it the animation that's entertaining you as you drive and listen? No, it's the storytelling. That's why we put so much importance on story. No amount of great animation will save a bad story.

author: Orson Welles
quote: A film is never really good unless the camera is an eye in the head of a poet.

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: I never enjoyed working in a film.

author: Roland Emmerich
quote: Nobody makes movies bad on purpose.

author: Tim Roth
quote: You read a script and its based on 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Pulp Fiction', and it goes right in the bin.

author: Billy Wilder
quote: Shoot a few scenes out of focus. I want to win the foreign film award.

author: Terri Windling
quote: Filmmaking can be a fine art.

author: Alfred Hitchcock
quote: Always make the audience suffer as much as possible.

author: Hilaire Belloc
quote: All men have an instinct for conflict: at least, all healthy men.

author: Chief Joseph
quote: All men were made by the Great Spirit Chief. They are all brothers.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
quote: In life we shall find many men that are great, and some that are good, but very few men that are both great and good.

author: Rita Mae Brown
quote: If the world were a logical place, men would ride side saddle.

author: Heinrich Heine
quote: Human misery is too great for men to do without faith.

author: Anthony Burgess
quote: Women thrive on novelty and are easy meat for the commerce of fashion. Men prefer old pipes and torn jackets.

author: George Weinberg
quote: Men are actually the weaker sex.

author: John Lubbock
quote: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.

author: Elizabeth Appell
quote: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.

author: Gerard De Nerval
quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.

author: Pauline Kael
quote: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.

author: William Shatner
quote: If saving money is wrong, I don't want to be right!

author: Robin Williams
quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

author: Hosea Ballou
quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.

author: Johannes Brahms
quote: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'

author: William Shakespeare
quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.

author: Alexander the Great
quote: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.

author: George Herbert
quote: A lean compromise is better than a fat lawsuit.

author: Christopher Darden
quote: The events of the day inspired me to become a lawyer.

author: George Washington
quote: Laws made by common consent must not be trampled on by individuals.

author: Gilbert Parker
quote: Nothing is so unproductive as the law. It is expensive whether you win or lose.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: Compromise is the best and cheapest lawyer.

author: Lenny Bruce
quote: In the Halls of Justice the only justice is in the halls.

author: Anita Hill
quote: One of the things I was taught in law school is that I'd never be able to think the same again - that being a lawyer is something that's part of who I am as an individual now.

author: Lydia M. Child
quote: An effort made for the happiness of others lifts above ourselves.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

author: Martha Washington
quote: I am determined to be cheerful and happy in whatever situation I may find myself. For I have learned that the greater part of our misery or unhappiness is determined not by our circumstance but by our disposition.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

author: Denis Waitley
quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
