quote: The truth is that since childhood I had cultivated an existential independence. It came from perceiving the adults around me as unreliable, and without it I felt I wouldn't have survived. I cared deeply for everyone in my family, but in the end I depended on myself.

author: Ludovico Ariosto
quote: From heresy, frenzy and jealousy, good Lord deliver me.

author: Havelock Ellis
quote: Jealousy, that dragon which slays love under the pretence of keeping it alive.

author: Mary Baker Eddy
quote: Jealousy is the grave of affection.

author: Elizabeth Bowen
quote: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.

author: Washington Irving
quote: There is never jealousy where there is not strong regard.

author: Ruth Rendell
quote: The knives of jealousy are honed on details.

author: Summer Altice
quote: People are taken aback by a confident, pretty girl who knows what she wants in life and isn't going to let anyone get in her way. And you know what it's all about? Jealousy.

author: Baltasar Gracian
quote: The envious die not once, but as oft as the envied win applause.

author: Francoise Sagan
quote: To jealousy, nothing is more frightful than laughter.

author: Thucydides
quote: Ignorance is bold and knowledge reserved.

author: Michel de Montaigne
quote: It is good to rub and polish our brain against that of others.

author: Scott Adams
quote: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
quote: The greatest scholars are not usually the wisest people.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.

author: Susan Sontag
quote: Intelligence is really a kind of taste: taste in ideas.

author: Henry Van Dyke
quote: Genius is talent set on fire by courage.

author: Herodotus
quote: To think well and to consent to obey someone giving good advice are the same thing.

author: Julius Charles Hare
quote: Be what you are. This is the first step toward becoming better than you are.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: A woman uses her intelligence to find reasons to support her intuition.

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: Genius might be the ability to say a profound thing in a simple way.

author: Jim Morrison
quote: Friends can help each other. A true friend is someone who lets you have total freedom to be yourself - and especially to feel. Or, not feel. Whatever you happen to be feeling at the moment is fine with them. That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is.

author: Peter Ustinov
quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.

author: Voltaire
quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: To say 'I love you' one must first be able to say the 'I.'

author: Barbara Sher
quote: The amount of good luck coming your way depends on your willingness to act.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: Example is leadership.

author: Duke Ellington
quote: My attitude is never to be satisfied, never enough, never.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: I never learned from a man who agreed with me.

author: e. e. cummings
quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn't pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.

author: Natalie Portman
quote: I don't love studying. I hate studying. I like learning. Learning is beautiful.

author: Lou Holtz
quote: I never learn anything talking. I only learn things when I ask questions.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Every immigrant who comes here should be required within five years to learn English or leave the country.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: I am a woman in process. I'm just trying like everybody else. I try to take every conflict, every experience, and learn from it. Life is never dull.

author: Phaedrus
quote: The mind ought sometimes to be diverted that it may return to better thinking.

author: Martin Lawrence
quote: I'm most proud of the blessings that God has bestowed upon me, in my life. He's given me the vision to truly see that you can fall down, but you can still get back up. Hopefully I'll learn from my mistakes and have the opportunity to strengthen and improve the next thing I do.

author: Miyamoto Musashi
quote: Study strategy over the years and achieve the spirit of the warrior. Today is victory over yourself of yesterday; tomorrow is your victory over lesser men.

author: Eddie Cantor
quote: Marriage is an attempt to solve problems together which you didn't even have when you were on your own.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Bachelors have consciences, married men have wives.

author: Woody Allen
quote: Basically my wife was immature. I'd be at home in the bath and she'd come in and sink my boats.

author: Matt Damon
quote: My wife is my soul mate. I can't imagine being without her.

author: Sam Levenson
quote: If you want to know how your girl will treat you after marriage, just listen to her talking to her little brother.

author: Katharine Hepburn
quote: If you want to sacrifice the admiration of many men for the criticism of one, go ahead, get married.

author: Red Skelton
quote: All men make mistakes, but married men find out about them sooner.

author: Rodney Dangerfield
quote: It's tough to stay married. My wife kisses the dog on the lips, yet she won't drink from my glass.

author: Bear Bryant
quote: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

author: Daniel Goleman
quote: I would say that IQ is the strongest predictor of which field you can get into and hold a job in, whether you can be an accountant, lawyer or nurse, for example.

author: John Irving
quote: You can't learn everything you need to know legally.

author: Samuel Alito
quote: I have been committed to carrying out my duties... in accordance with both the letter and spirit of all applicable rules of ethics and canons of conduct.

author: John Harington
quote: From your confessor, lawyer and physician, hide not your case on no condition.

author: Oliver North
quote: I'm trusting in the Lord and a good lawyer.

author: Herbert Spencer
quote: A jury is composed of twelve men of average ignorance.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: In law, nothing is certain but the expense.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: Justice is itself the great standing policy of civil society; and any eminent departure from it, under any circumstances, lies under the suspicion of being no policy at all.

author: Alexandre Dumas
quote: Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.

author: Ashley Montagu
quote: The moments of happiness we enjoy take us by surprise. It is not that we seize them, but that they seize us.

author: John Barrymore
quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Happiness is the absence of the striving for happiness.

author: Lord Byron
quote: All who joy would win must share it. Happiness was born a Twin.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Love is trembling happiness.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.

author: Plato
quote: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself; to be conquered by yourself is of all things most shameful and vile.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.

author: Socrates
quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.

author: Mencius
quote: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.

author: Chanakya
quote: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.

author: Publilius Syrus
quote: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other's eyes for an instant?

author: Moliere
quote: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.

author: Sigmund Freud
quote: The great question that has never been answered, and which I have not yet been able to answer, despite my thirty years of research into the feminine soul, is 'What does a woman want?'

author: Montesquieu
quote: To become truly great, one has to stand with people, not above them.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength; and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.

author: Thomas S. Monson
quote: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.

author: Robert Kennedy
quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.

author: Pope John XXIII
quote: See everything, overlook a great deal, correct a little.

author: Jesse Jackson
quote: At the end of the day, we must go forward with hope and not backward by fear and division.

author: Aristotle Onassis
quote: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.

author: Edward Kennedy
quote: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.

author: Charlotte Bronte
quote: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: Extreme hopes are born from extreme misery.

author: Harvey Milk
quote: Hope will never be silent.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.

author: Chester W. Nimitz
quote: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.

author: Orison Swett Marden
quote: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something better tomorrow.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.

author: Lewis B. Smedes
quote: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Children begin by loving their parents; after a time they judge them; rarely, if ever, do they forgive them.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: To err is human; to forgive, divine.

author: Steve Martin
quote: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.

author: Jim Carrey
quote: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.

author: Milton Berle
quote: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.

author: Jules Renard
quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.

author: Mort Sahl
quote: My life needs editing.

author: George Carlin
quote: Weather forecast for tonight: dark.

author: Kurt Cobain
quote: It's okay to eat fish because they don't have any feelings.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: There is no sincerer love than the love of food.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Part of the secret of a success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.

author: Paul Prudhomme
quote: You don't need a silver fork to eat good food.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: We are fast approaching the stage of the ultimate inversion: the stage where the government is free to do anything it pleases, while the citizens may act only by permission; which is the stage of the darkest periods of human history, the stage of rule by brute force.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: Let us never forget that government is ourselves and not an alien power over us. The ultimate rulers of our democracy are not a President and senators and congressmen and government officials, but the voters of this country.

author: Pratibha Patil
quote: Corruption is the enemy of development, and of good governance. It must be got rid of. Both the government and the people at large must come together to achieve this national objective.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: The government is us; we are the government, you and I.

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
quote: It was once said that the moral test of government is how that government treats those who are in the dawn of life, the children; those who are in the twilight of life, the elderly; and those who are in the shadows of life, the sick, the needy and the handicapped.

author: James Madison
quote: If men were angels, no government would be necessary.

author: Confucius
quote: An oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Governing a great nation is like cooking a small fish - too much handling will spoil it.

author: William Ellery Channing
quote: The home is the chief school of human virtues.

author: Alexander Chase
quote: A man's home is his wife's castle.

author: Joan Rivers
quote: I told my mother-in-law that my house was her house, and she said, 'Get the hell off my property.'

author: Isaac Watts
quote: I would not change my blest estate for all the world calls good or great.

author: David Suzuki
quote: The human brain now holds the key to our future. We have to recall the image of the planet from outer space: a single entity in which air, water, and continents are interconnected. That is our home.

author: Henry Drummond
quote: Strength of character may be learned at work, but beauty of character is learned at home.

author: Jill Scott
quote: To be a queen of a household is a powerful thing.

author: Phyllis Diller
quote: Always be nice to your children because they are the ones who will choose your rest home.

author: Henry Ford
quote: It is well enough that people of the nation do not understand our banking and monetary system, for if they did, I believe there would be a revolution before tomorrow morning.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.

author: Walter Winchell
quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.

author: Voltaire
quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Freedom makes a huge requirement of every human being. With freedom comes responsibility. For the person who is unwilling to grow up, the person who does not want to carry his own weight, this is a frightening prospect.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.

author: George Orwell
quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.

author: George W. Bush
quote: Freedom itself was attacked this morning by a faceless coward, and freedom will be defended.

author: Samuel Adams
quote: It does not take a majority to prevail... but rather an irate, tireless minority, keen on setting brushfires of freedom in the minds of men.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor; it must be demanded by the oppressed.

author: Moshe Dayan
quote: Freedom is the oxygen of the soul.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: If you want total security, go to prison. There you're fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking... is freedom.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.

author: Voltaire
quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.

author: Charles Spurgeon
quote: A good character is the best tombstone. Those who loved you and were helped by you will remember you when forget-me-nots have withered. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.

author: Tom Clancy
quote: The good old days are now.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: The more we come out and do good to others, the more our hearts will be purified, and God will be in them.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: I'm convinced of this: Good done anywhere is good done everywhere. For a change, start by speaking to people rather than walking by them like they're stones that don't matter. As long as you're breathing, it's never too late to do some good.

author: Anne Frank
quote: Despite everything, I believe that people are really good at heart.

author: Bernard Meltzer
quote: A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.

author: Friedrich Schiller
quote: Nothing leads to good that is not natural.

author: Booker T. Washington
quote: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.

author: Henry Ford
quote: I believe God is managing affairs and that He doesn't need any advice from me. With God in charge, I believe everything will work out for the best in the end. So what is there to worry about.

author: Edwin Louis Cole
quote: God never ends anything on a negative; God always ends on a positive.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: What God intended for you goes far beyond anything you can imagine.

author: Anne Frank
quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quiet, alone with the heavens, nature and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be.

author: Epictetus
quote: God has entrusted me with myself.

author: Marcus Garvey
quote: God and Nature first made us what we are, and then out of our own created genius we make ourselves what we want to be. Follow always that great law. Let the sky and God be our limit and Eternity our measurement.

author: Lawrence Welk
quote: Never trust anyone completely but God. Love people, but put your full trust only in God.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: While I know myself as a creation of God, I am also obligated to realize and remember that everyone else and everything else are also God's creation.

author: Paul Dirac
quote: God used beautiful mathematics in creating the world.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: God is a verb, not a noun.

author: Jimmy Dean
quote: God is bigger than people think.

author: Alfred Adler
quote: God who is eternally complete, who directs the stars, who is the master of fates, who elevates man from his lowliness to Himself, who speaks from the cosmos to every single human soul, is the most brilliant manifestation of the goal of perfection.

author: Bob Marley
quote: I don't stand for the black man's side, I don' t stand for the white man's side. I stand for God's side.

author: Bill Watterson
quote: If your knees aren't green by the end of the day, you ought to seriously re-examine your life.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: No occupation is so delightful to me as the culture of the earth, and no culture comparable to that of the garden.

author: Douglas Wilson
quote: Use plants to bring life.

author: Douglas Adams
quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: The best place to find God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.

author: Liberty Hyde Bailey
quote: A garden requires patient labor and attention. Plants do not grow merely to satisfy ambitions or to fulfill good intentions. They thrive because someone expended effort on them.

author: Voltaire
quote: We must cultivate our own garden. When man was put in the garden of Eden he was put there so that he should work, which proves that man was not born to rest.

author: George Eliot
quote: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses we must plant more trees.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.

author: Sigmund Freud
quote: Flowers are restful to look at. They have neither emotions nor conflicts.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: This man used to go to school with his dog. Then they were separated. His dog graduated!

author: Alexa Von Tobel
quote: For many, graduation marks the end of formal student life - the end of long spring breaks and of thinking that a 10 A.M. class is far too early.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money.

author: Gil Scott-Heron
quote: You know what has made me the happiest I've ever been? Seeing my son and daughter graduate from college. More than wanting them to be educated, I wanted them to be nice people. To see that they have become both is just a wonderful thing.

author: Bobby Heenan
quote: North Dakota State. What do you have to do there to graduate? Milk a cow with your left hand?

author: James Stewart
quote: I was going to be an architect. I graduated with a degree in architecture and I had a scholarship to go back to Princeton and get my Masters in architecture. I'd done theatricals in college, but I'd done them because it was fun.

author: Jim Jarmusch
quote: I didn't get my degree at NYU; I got it later, they gave me an honourary one.

author: Lena Dunham
quote: When I graduated college I had a series of just humiliating jobs that I couldn't believe I was at.

author: Conan O'Brien
quote: Earlier today, Arnold Schwarzenegger criticized the California school system, calling it disastrous. Arnold says California's schools are so bad that its graduates are willing to vote for me.

author: Irvine Welsh
quote: I think young writers should get other degrees first, social sciences, arts degrees or even business degrees. What you learn is research skills, a necessity because a lot of writing is about trying to find information.

author: Tony Hillerman
quote: The essays in The Great Taos Bank Robbery were my project to win a Master of Arts degree in English when I quit being a newspaper editor and went back to college.

author: William Jennings Bryan
quote: Destiny is no matter of chance. It is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.

author: Niels Bohr
quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially if it's about the future.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: The future starts today, not tomorrow.

author: Ralph Abernathy
quote: I don't know what the future may hold, but I know who holds the future.

author: Confucius
quote: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: If we open a quarrel between past and present, we shall find that we have lost the future.

author: Sitting Bull
quote: Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: Life is divided into three terms - that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present, to live better in the future.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.

author: Joan of Arc
quote: Get up tomorrow early in the morning, and earlier than you did today, and do the best that you can. Always stay near me, for tomorrow I will have much to do and more than I ever had, and tomorrow blood will leave my body above the breast.

author: George S. Patton
quote: Americans love to fight. All real Americans love the sting of battle.

author: E. M. Forster
quote: History develops, art stands still.

author: Johnny Depp
quote: France, and the whole of Europe have a great culture and an amazing history. Most important thing though is that people there know how to live! In America they've forgotten all about it. I'm afraid that the American culture is a disaster.

author: Sally Ride
quote: I did not come to NASA to make history.

author: Evita Peron
quote: Time is my greatest enemy.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
quote: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.

author: Joe Baca
quote: Pearl Harbor caused our Nation to wholeheartedly commit to winning World War II, changing the course of our Nation's history and the world's future.

author: Edward R. Murrow
quote: Difficulty is the excuse history never accepts.

author: Simone Weil
quote: Evil being the root of mystery, pain is the root of knowledge.

author: Robert Staughton Lynd
quote: Knowledge is power only if man knows what facts not to bother with.

author: Og Mandino
quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.

author: Fred Rogers
quote: Knowing that we can be loved exactly as we are gives us all the best opportunity for growing into the healthiest of people.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Use your health, even to the point of wearing it out. That is what it is for. Spend all you have before you die; do not outlive yourself.

author: Philip Sidney
quote: The ingredients of health and long life, are great temperance, open air, easy labor, and little care.

author: Denzel Washington
quote: I made a commitment to completely cut out drinking and anything that might hamper me from getting my mind and body together. And the floodgates of goodness have opened upon me - spiritually and financially.

author: Robin Wright
quote: If you're happy, if you're feeling good, then nothing else matters.

author: Phil McGraw
quote: It's better to be healthy alone than sick with someone else.

author: Martha Graham
quote: The body is a sacred garment.

author: Frank Capra
quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.

author: Anatole France
quote: To imagine is everything, to know is nothing at all.

author: Henry Miller
quote: Imagination is the voice of daring. If there is anything Godlike about God it is that. He dared to imagine everything.

author: Marc Chagall
quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
quote: Imagination grows by exercise, and contrary to common belief, is more powerful in the mature than in the young.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The lunatic, the lover, and the poet, are of imagination all compact.

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: Humor is perhaps a sense of intellectual perspective: an awareness that some things are really important, others not; and that the two kinds are most oddly jumbled in everyday affairs.

author: Woody Allen
quote: I think being funny is not anyone's first choice.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: I'm not funny. What I am is brave.

author: Charles Churchill
quote: A joke's a very serious thing.

author: Leo Rosten
quote: Humor is the affectionate communication of insight.

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
quote: Humor is one of the best ingredients of survival.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Humor is the first of the gifts to perish in a foreign tongue.

author: Jacob Riis
quote: The more I live, the more I think that humor is the saving sense.

author: Thomas Wentworth Higginson
quote: Great men are rarely isolated mountain peaks; they are the summits of ranges.

author: Don Rickles
quote: You can't study comedy; it's within you. It's a personality. My humor is an attitude.

author: Edward Albee
quote: I have a fine sense of the ridiculous, but no sense of humor.

author: Mary Kay Blakely
quote: Our humor turns our anger into a fine art.

author: Frank A. Clark
quote: I think the next best thing to solving a problem is finding some humor in it.

author: Debbie Gibson
quote: I've learned to have a sense of humor about myself. Lord knows everyone else does!

author: John Hancock
quote: The important consequences to the American States from this Declaration of Independence, considered as the ground and foundation of a future government, naturally suggest the propriety of proclaiming it in such a manner as that the people may be universally informed of it.

author: Jackie Robinson
quote: I guess you'd call me an independent, since I've never identified myself with one party or another in politics. I always decide my vote by taking as careful a look as I can at the actual candidates and issues themselves, no matter what the party label.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
quote: It is not wealth one asks for, but just enough to preserve one's dignity, to work unhampered, to be generous, frank and independent.

author: Peter Jennings
quote: There's no such thing as an independent person.

author: Theodor W. Adorno
quote: The good man is he who rules himself as he does his own property: his autonomous being is modelled on material power.

author: Mahalia Jackson
quote: It is easy to be independent when you've got money. But to be independent when you haven't got a thing, that's the Lord's test.

author: Ingrid Bergman
quote: I have grown up alone. I've taken care of myself. I worked, earned money and was independent at 18.

author: Davy Crockett
quote: Throughout the day no time for memorandums now. Go ahead! Liberty and independence forever.

author: Aaron Carter
quote: Love shouldn't be about jealousy or anything like that. It should be about commitment and being able to trust that person. If you can't have that from the get-go, there's a problem.

author: William Shenstone
quote: Jealousy is the fear or apprehension of superiority: envy our uneasiness under it.

author: Gene Tierney
quote: Jealousy is, I think, the worst of all faults because it makes a victim of both parties.

author: George Eliot
quote: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.

author: Jude Law
quote: There's no regret. You can't regret. I mean, I've felt regret but I've also refused to allow regret to sow a seed and live in me because I don't believe it. You feel it, it's like guilt, it's like jealousy, it's like all those horrible things. You've just got to snip them and get them out, because they're no good.

author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
quote: The lovesick, the betrayed, and the jealous all smell alike.

author: Arthur Golden
quote: Passion can quickly slip to jealousy, or even hatred.

author: Aphra Behn
quote: Nothing is more capable of troubling our reason, and consuming our health, than secret notions of jealousy in solitude.

author: Joseph P. Kennedy
quote: More men die of jealousy than of cancer.

author: Van Wyck Brooks
quote: Magnanimous people have no vanity, they have no jealousy, and they feed on the true and the solid wherever they find it. And, what is more, they find it everywhere.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: These little grey cells. It is up to them.

author: Deepak Chopra
quote: To think is to practice brain chemistry.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I must have a prodigious quantity of mind; it takes me as much as a week sometimes to make it up.

author: Lewis Carroll
quote: It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards.

author: Jesse Jackson
quote: Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.

author: David Joseph Schwartz
quote: How we think shows through in how we act. Attitudes are mirrors of the mind. They reflect thinking.

author: Golda Meir
quote: A leader who doesn't hesitate before he sends his nation into battle is not fit to be a leader.

author: James Freeman Clarke
quote: Strong convictions precede great actions.

author: Carine Roitfeld
quote: You discover yourself through the research of your work.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?

author: Ann Landers
quote: Sensual pleasures have the fleeting brilliance of a comet; a happy marriage has the tranquillity of a lovely sunset.

author: Johnny Carson
quote: Married men live longer than single men. But married men are a lot more willing to die.

author: Cher
quote: Husbands are like fires - they go out when they're left unattended.

author: Josh Billings
quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky, but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.

author: George Jessel
quote: Marriage is a mistake every man should make.

author: Catherine Zeta-Jones
quote: For marriage to be a success, every woman and every man should have her and his own bathroom. The end.

author: Yoko Ono
quote: Marriage is a gamble, let's be honest.

author: Stephen Leacock
quote: Many a man in love with a dimple makes the mistake of marrying the whole girl.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: The only journey is the one within.

author: Swami Sivananda
quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

author: Edith Wharton
quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.

author: Tony Robbins
quote: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.

author: Octavia E. Butler
quote: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.

author: Ben Okri
quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.

author: Carol Burnett
quote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: I am the inferior of any man whose rights I trample under foot.

author: Alice Walker
quote: Don't wait around for other people to be happy for you. Any happiness you get you've got to make yourself.

author: Lawrence G. Lovasik
quote: Try to make at least one person happy every day. If you cannot do a kind deed, speak a kind word. If you cannot speak a kind word, think a kind thought. Count up, if you can, the treasure of happiness that you would dispense in a week, in a year, in a lifetime!

author: David Lee Roth
quote: Money can't buy you happiness, but it can buy you a yacht big enough to pull up right alongside it.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?

author: Florence Scovel Shinn
quote: Every great work, every big accomplishment, has been brought into manifestation through holding to the vision, and often just before the big achievement, comes apparent failure and discouragement.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: To have great poets, there must be great audiences.

author: Joe Paterno
quote: Believe deep down in your heart that you're destined to do great things.

author: Tom Hopkins
quote: You are your greatest asset. Put your time, effort and money into training, grooming, and encouraging your greatest asset.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.

author: Elie Wiesel
quote: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.

author: David Ben-Gurion
quote: Anyone who doesn't believe in miracles is not a realist.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Lord save us all from old age and broken health and a hope tree that has lost the faculty of putting out blossoms.

author: Thomas Hardy
quote: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.

author: Tertullian
quote: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.

author: Rick Warren
quote: What gives me the most hope every day is God's grace; knowing that his grace is going to give me the strength for whatever I face, knowing that nothing is a surprise to God.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.

author: Martin Luther
quote: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: Hope is the last thing a person does before they are defeated.

author: Jim DeMint
quote: One of the greatest titles in the world is parent, and one of the biggest blessings in the world is to have parents to call mom and dad.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.

author: Thomas Szasz
quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: It's one of the greatest gifts you can give yourself, to forgive. Forgive everybody.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.

author: Josh Billings
quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.

author: Tyler Perry
quote: It's not an easy journey, to get to a place where you forgive people. But it is such a powerful place, because it frees you.

author: Emo Philips
quote: When I was a kid I used to pray every night for a new bicycle. Then I realised that the Lord doesn't work that way so I stole one and asked Him to forgive me.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.

author: Steven Wright
quote: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I'm afraid of widths.

author: Joseph Addison
quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.

author: Denis Waitley
quote: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: Walking is the best possible exercise. Habituate yourself to walk very far.

author: Mitch Hedberg
quote: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know.

author: Douglas Adams
quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Yield to temptation. It may not pass your way again.

author: Steven Wright
quote: What's another word for Thesaurus?

author: Mae West
quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.

author: George Eliot
quote: He was like a cock who thought the sun had risen to hear him crow.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.

author: Bill Murray
quote: I always want to say to people who want to be rich and famous: 'try being rich first'. See if that doesn't cover most of it. There's not much downside to being rich, other than paying taxes and having your relatives ask you for money. But when you become famous, you end up with a 24-hour job.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.

author: Al Pacino
quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you. You're in a conversation and everybody's agreeing with what you're saying - even if you say something totally crazy. You need people who can tell you what you don't want to hear.

author: Niccolo Machiavelli
quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.

author: Buddha
quote: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them.

author: Richard Bach
quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.

author: Michael J. Fox
quote: Family is not an important thing. It's everything.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself. They came through you but not from you and though they are with you yet they belong not to you.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: Once, during Prohibition, I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: You can tell alot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jellybeans.

author: Ina Garten
quote: Instead of going out to dinner, buy good food. Cooking at home shows such affection. In a bad economy, it's more important to make yourself feel good.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: You better cut the pizza in four pieces because I'm not hungry enough to eat six.

author: Cesar Chavez
quote: If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their heart.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: So long as you have food in your mouth, you have solved all questions for the time being.

author: James Beard
quote: Food is our common ground, a universal experience.

author: Moliere
quote: One should eat to live, not live to eat.

author: Doug Larson
quote: Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables smelled as good as bacon.

author: Ludwig van Beethoven
quote: Only the pure in heart can make a good soup.

author: James Russell Lowell
quote: Democracy gives every man the right to be his own oppressor.

author: William F. Buckley, Jr.
quote: I'd rather entrust the government of the United States to the first 400 people listed in the Boston telephone directory than to the faculty of Harvard University.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.

author: Alexander Hamilton
quote: It's not tyranny we desire; it's a just, limited, federal government.

author: Vladimir Lenin
quote: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them in parliament.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: In the absence of justice, what is sovereignty but organized robbery?

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: The best government is that which teaches us to govern ourselves.

author: Chris Rock
quote: You don't pay taxes - they take taxes.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: I am sometimes a fox and sometimes a lion. The whole secret of government lies in knowing when to be the one or the other.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
quote: Under capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it's just the opposite.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: Inflation is taxation without legislation.

author: John Maynard Keynes
quote: The avoidance of taxes is the only intellectual pursuit that still carries any reward.

author: John D. Rockefeller
quote: The way to make money is to buy when blood is running in the streets.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Friedrich August von Hayek
quote: The curious task of economics is to demonstrate to men how little they really know about what they imagine they can design.

author: John Locke
quote: Our incomes are like our shoes; if too small, they gall and pinch us; but if too large, they cause us to stumble and to trip.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: True friends stab you in the front.

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.

author: Ulysses S. Grant
quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.

author: Herodotus
quote: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.

author: Anais Nin
quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.

author: Henry Ford
quote: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.

author: Euripides
quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.

author: Chanakya
quote: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.

author: George Washington
quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.

author: Nikos Kazantzakis
quote: I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.

author: Karl Marx
quote: Necessity is blind until it becomes conscious. Freedom is the consciousness of necessity.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: The boisterous sea of liberty is never without a wave.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Freedom lies in being bold.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: The chief enemy of creativity is 'good' sense.

author: Emma Bunton
quote: Be sweet, be good, and honest always.

author: Eli Pariser
quote: To be a good citizen, it's important to be able to put yourself in other people's shoes and see the big picture. If everything you see is rooted in your own identity, that becomes difficult or impossible.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: There are three ingredients in the good life: learning, earning and yearning.

author: Cavett Robert
quote: If you don't think every day is a good day, just try missing one.

author: Lefty Gomez
quote: I'd rather be lucky than good.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: I sometimes think that God in creating man somewhat overestimated his ability.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: I just want to do God's will. And he's allowed me to go to the mountain. And I've looked over, and I've seen the promised land! I may not get there with you, but I want you to know tonight that we as a people will get to the promised land.

author: John Lennon
quote: I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.

author: Gertrude Jekyll
quote: A garden is a grand teacher. It teaches patience and careful watchfulness; it teaches industry and thrift; above all it teaches entire trust.

author: Martin Heidegger
quote: To dwell is to garden.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have never been discovered.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: And forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.

author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
quote: Won't you come into the garden? I would like my roses to see you.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly.

author: Ramakrishna
quote: When the flower blooms, the bees come uninvited.

author: May Sarton
quote: Everything that slows us down and forces patience, everything that sets us back into the slow circles of nature, is a help. Gardening is an instrument of grace.

author: Doug Larson
quote: A weed is a plant that has mastered every survival skill except for learning how to grow in rows.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed, it is the purest of human pleasures.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
quote: For a man to attain to an eminent degree in learning costs him time, watching, hunger, nakedness, dizziness in the head, weakness in the stomach, and other inconveniences.

author: Ruth Ann Minner
quote: Our promise to our children should be this: if you do well in school, we will pay for you to obtain a college degree.

author: G. M. Trevelyan
quote: One half who graduate from college never read another book.

author: Alexis Herman
quote: Really, the potential for, first of all, any college graduate today is enormously good. These are good times for anyone with a college degree today, particularly African Americans. With a college degree today, you really breach the unemployment rate.

author: Jimmy Carter
quote: In this outward and physical ceremony we attest once again to the inner and spiritual strength of our Nation. As my high school teacher, Miss Julia Coleman, used to say: 'We must adjust to changing times and still hold to unchanging principles.'

author: Alan Watts
quote: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.

author: Bob Marley
quote: In this bright future you can't forget your past.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The distinction between the past, present and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: You can never plan the future by the past.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Only you can control your future.

author: Jack Welch
quote: Control your own destiny or someone else will.

author: Warren Bennis
quote: The factory of the future will have only two employees, a man and a dog. The man will be there to feed the dog. The dog will be there to keep the man from touching the equipment.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: Our human compassion binds us the one to the other - not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
quote: Neither a wise man nor a brave man lies down on the tracks of history to wait for the train of the future to run over him.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: The future influences the present just as much as the past.

author: Neil Armstrong
quote: Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon. July 1969 AD. We came in peace for all mankind.

author: Konrad Adenauer
quote: History is the sum total of things that could have been avoided.

author: Henry Adams
quote: Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.

author: William James
quote: The world we see that seems so insane is the result of a belief system that is not working. To perceive the world differently, we must be willing to change our belief system, let the past slip away, expand our sense of now, and dissolve the fear in our minds.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
quote: Most of the things worth doing in the world had been declared impossible before they were done.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: Why should we honour those that die upon the field of battle? A man may show as reckless a courage in entering into the abyss of himself.

author: H. L. Mencken
quote: Legend: A lie that has attained the dignity of age.

author: Douglas MacArthur
quote: They died hard, those savage men - like wounded wolves at bay. They were filthy, and they were lousy, and they stunk. And I loved them.

author: John W. Gardner
quote: History never looks like history when you are living through it.

author: Gro Harlem Brundtland
quote: Investing in health will produce enormous benefits.

author: Chanakya
quote: As long as your body is healthy and under control and death is distant, try to save your soul; when death is immanent what can you do?

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: The wish for healing has always been half of health.

author: Courtney Thorne-Smith
quote: You know, true love really matters, friends really matter, family really matters. Being responsible and disciplined and healthy really matters.

author: Jackie Mason
quote: It's no longer a question of staying healthy. It's a question of finding a sickness you like.

author: Mary Baker Eddy
quote: Health is not a condition of matter, but of Mind.

author: David Suzuki
quote: The medical literature tells us that the most effective ways to reduce the risk of heart disease, cancer, stroke, diabetes, Alzheimer's, and many more problems are through healthy diet and exercise. Our bodies have evolved to move, yet we now use the energy in oil instead of muscles to do our work.

author: Ann Bancroft
quote: I do not think about being beautiful. What I devote most of my time to is being healthy.

author: Ivan Illich
quote: Healthy people are those who live in healthy homes on a healthy diet; in an environment equally fit for birth, growth work, healing, and dying... Healthy people need no bureaucratic interference to mate, give birth, share the human condition and die.

author: Tom Harkin
quote: America's health care system is in crisis precisely because we systematically neglect wellness and prevention.

author: James Taylor
quote: I find it a lot healthier for me to be someplace where I can go outside in my bare feet.

author: Steve Yzerman
quote: I'm exhausted trying to stay healthy.

author: Mike Huckabee
quote: The health care system is really designed to reward you for being unhealthy. If you are a healthy person and work hard to be healthy, there are no benefits.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.

author: Orison Swett Marden
quote: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: The most unpardonable sin in society is independence of thought.

author: Corliss Lamont
quote: True freedom is the capacity for acting according to one's true character, to be altogether one's self, to be self-determined and not subject to outside coercion.

author: Walter Annenberg
quote: I cannot compromise or inhibit my independence.

author: Susan B. Anthony
quote: I think the girl who is able to earn her own living and pay her own way should be as happy as anybody on earth. The sense of independence and security is very sweet.

author: William J. H. Boetcker
quote: You cannot build character and courage by destroying men's initiative and independence.

author: Sandra Day O'Connor
quote: It matters enormously to a successful democratic society like ours that we have three branches of government, each with some independence and some control over the other two. That's set out in the Constitution.

author: Malcolm Turnbull
quote: The most effective check and balance on government has been an independent press which maintains its credibility by ensuring that its criticism is balanced and based on fact - based indeed on solid journalistic work.

author: Emil Cioran
quote: Jealousy - that jumble of secret worship and ostensible aversion.

author: Marilyn Manson
quote: I am drawn to women who are independent and creative, which is problematic because it's a struggle, a competition of careers. There's jealousy.

author: Helen Rowland
quote: Jealousy is the tie that binds, and binds, and binds.

author: Marie de France
quote: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!

author: Milla Jovovich
quote: I'm not really easy to live with! There needs to be unlimited patience and unconditional love. Men I've known before loved my independent spirit and were proud of my success, to the point that they'd become jealous of the time I devote to my career.

author: Clyde Tombaugh
quote: That's the way I got along in life. I don't ever remember being particularly jealous of anybody, because I figured if I can't do it myself, I don't deserve to get it.

author: Harriet Ann Jacobs
quote: I would rather drudge out my life on a cotton plantation, till the grave opened to give me rest, than to live with an unprincipled master and a jealous mistress.

author: Herodotus
quote: But I like not these great success of yours; for I know how jealous are the gods.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Jealous, adj. Unduly concerned about the preservation of that which can be lost only if not worth keeping.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.

author: Jeff Foxworthy
quote: I have never been jealous. Not even when my dad finished fifth grade a year before I did.

author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol
quote: Jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire.

author: Lena Horne
quote: Always be smarter than the people who hire you.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.

author: Nido Qubein
quote: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.

author: Ella Fitzgerald
quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.

author: Sharon Begley
quote: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.

author: William Feather
quote: Plenty of people miss their share of happiness, not because they never found it, but because they didn't stop to enjoy it.

author: Julia Roberts
quote: You know it's love when all you want is that person to be happy, even if you're not part of their happiness.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.

author: John C. Maxwell
quote: The greatest mistake we make is living in constant fear that we will make one.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: To be really great in little things, to be truly noble and heroic in the insipid details of everyday life, is a virtue so rare as to be worthy of canonization.

author: Henry Rollins
quote: You need a little bit of insanity to do great things.

author: William Blake
quote: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.

author: Robert Hughes
quote: The greater the artist, the greater the doubt. Perfect confidence is granted to the less talented as a consolation prize.

author: Pierre Corneille
quote: The greater the effort, the greater the glory.

author: Demosthenes
quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.

author: Jim Henson
quote: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!

author: Jim Valvano
quote: My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.

author: Euripides
quote: To a father growing old nothing is dearer than a daughter.

author: Wade Boggs
quote: Anyone can be a father, but it takes someone special to be a dad, and that's why I call you dad, because you are so special to me. You taught me the game and you taught me how to play it right.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: My father always used to say that when you die, if you've got five real friends, then you've had a great life.

author: Frank Abagnale
quote: A real man loves his wife, and places his family as the most important thing in life. Nothing has brought me more peace and content in life than simply being a good husband and father.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: My father used to say that it's never too late to do anything you wanted to do. And he said, 'You never know what you can accomplish until you try.'

author: George Herbert
quote: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.

author: Marianne Williamson
quote: Forgiveness is not always easy. At times, it feels more painful than the wound we suffered, to forgive the one that inflicted it. And yet, there is no peace without forgiveness.

author: Scott Adams
quote: Nothing inspires forgiveness quite like revenge.

author: Bernard Meltzer
quote: When you forgive, you in no way change the past - but you sure do change the future.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee, and I'll forgive Thy great big joke on me.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself; for every man has need to be forgiven.

author: William Blake
quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.

author: Joyce Meyer
quote: Forgiveness is not a feeling - it's a decision we make because we want to do what's right before God. It's a quality decision that won't be easy and it may take time to get through the process, depending on the severity of the offense.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.

author: Jessica Lange
quote: Acceptance and tolerance and forgiveness, those are life-altering lessons.

author: Indira Gandhi
quote: Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: All major religious traditions carry basically the same message, that is love, compassion and forgiveness the important thing is they should be part of our daily lives.

author: Gene Tunney
quote: To enjoy the glow of good health, you must exercise.

author: Morihei Ueshiba
quote: The purpose of training is to tighten up the slack, toughen the body, and polish the spirit.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
quote: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I have never taken any exercise, except sleeping and resting, and I never intend to take any.

author: Wilhelm von Humboldt
quote: True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united.

author: Marquis de Sade
quote: Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.

author: Lee Haney
quote: Exercise to stimulate, not to annihilate. The world wasn't formed in a day, and neither were we. Set small goals and build upon them.

author: Paula Abdul
quote: Find fitness with fun dancing. It is fun and makes you forget about the dreaded exercise.

author: Michael Phelps
quote: Swimming is normal for me. I'm relaxed. I'm comfortable, and I know my surroundings. It's my home.

author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: Bodybuilding is much like any other sport. To be successful, you must dedicate yourself 100% to your training, diet and mental approach.

author: Hippocrates
quote: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.

author: Casey Stengel
quote: All right everyone, line up alphabetically according to your height.

author: Henry Kissinger
quote: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.

author: Ron White
quote: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.

author: Robin Williams
quote: If women ran the world we wouldn't have wars, just intense negotiations every 28 days.

author: Jerry Seinfeld
quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.

author: Lana Turner
quote: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.

author: George Burns
quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
quote: Macho does not prove mucho.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not: the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Far better is it to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure... than to rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy nor suffer much, because they live in a gray twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.

author: Michael Jordan
quote: I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.

author: B. F. Skinner
quote: A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.

author: Bill Gates
quote: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.

author: Heraclitus
quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
quote: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.

author: Lord Byron
quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.

author: Ray Charles
quote: I never wanted to be famous. I only wanted to be great.

author: Fred Allen
quote: A celebrity is a person who works hard all of their life to become well known, and then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.

author: William Penn
quote: Avoid popularity; it has many snares, and no real benefit.

author: Andy Warhol
quote: Don't pay any attention to what they write about you. Just measure it in inches.

author: Justin Timberlake
quote: The worst thing about being famous is the invasion of your privacy.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.

author: Thomas Hardy
quote: Fear is the mother of foresight.

author: Salvador Dali
quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just; that his justice cannot sleep forever.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
quote: Fear keeps us focused on the past or worried about the future. If we can acknowledge our fear, we can realize that right now we are okay. Right now, today, we are still alive, and our bodies are working marvelously. Our eyes can still see the beautiful sky. Our ears can still hear the voices of our loved ones.

author: Plato
quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: Feelings of worth can flourish only in an atmosphere where individual differences are appreciated, mistakes are tolerated, communication is open, and rules are flexible - the kind of atmosphere that is found in a nurturing family.

author: Alex Haley
quote: In every conceivable manner, the family is link to our past, bridge to our future.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: If a country is to be corruption free and become a nation of beautiful minds, I strongly feel there are three key societal members who can make a difference. They are the father, the mother and the teacher.

author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
quote: My family is my strength and my weakness.

author: David Ogden Stiers
quote: Family means no one gets left behind or forgotten.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: For there is no friend like a sister in calm or stormy weather; To cheer one on the tedious way, to fetch one if one goes astray, to lift one if one totters down, to strengthen whilst one stands.

author: Princess Diana
quote: Family is the most important thing in the world.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.

author: Euripides
quote: When a man's stomach is full it makes no difference whether he is rich or poor.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Eating is so intimate. It's very sensual. When you invite someone to sit at your table and you want to cook for them, you're inviting a person into your life.

author: Mitch Hedberg
quote: A waffle is like a pancake with a syrup trap.

author: Hippocrates
quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.

author: Aesop
quote: A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety.

author: John Cleese
quote: If God did not intend for us to eat animals, then why did he make them out of meat?

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: Wine is bottled poetry.

author: Homaro Cantu
quote: Most of us have fond memories of food from our childhood. Whether it was our mom's homemade lasagna or a memorable chocolate birthday cake, food has a way of transporting us back to the past.

author: Louise Fresco
quote: Food, in the end, in our own tradition, is something holy. It's not about nutrients and calories. It's about sharing. It's about honesty. It's about identity.

author: Dorothy Day
quote: Food for the body is not enough. There must be food for the soul.

author: Kevin James
quote: There's no better feeling in the world than a warm pizza box on your lap.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.

author: Lewis Grizzard
quote: It's difficult to think anything but pleasant thoughts while eating a homegrown tomato.

author: Cal Thomas
quote: In a free society, government reflects the soul of its people. If people want change at the top, they will have to live in different ways. Our major social problems are not the cause of our decadence. They are a reflection of it.

author: Woodrow Wilson
quote: The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands of the bosses and their employers, the special interests. An invisible empire has been set up above the forms of democracy.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
quote: Our government... teaches the whole people by its example. If the government becomes the lawbreaker, it breeds contempt for law; it invites every man to become a law unto himself; it invites anarchy.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Government's first duty is to protect the people, not run their lives.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.

author: Tom Stoppard
quote: It's not the voting that's democracy; it's the counting.

author: Larry Flynt
quote: Majority rule only works if you're also considering individual rights. Because you can't have five wolves and one sheep voting on what to have for supper.

author: Paul Harvey
quote: If 'pro' is the opposite of 'con' what is the opposite of 'progress'?

author: Kathleen Sebelius
quote: The essence of good government is trust.

author: Henry Clay
quote: Government is a trust, and the officers of the government are trustees. And both the trust and the trustees are created for the benefit of the people.

author: Will Rogers
quote: Don't gamble; take all your savings and buy some good stock and hold it till it goes up, then sell it. If it don't go up, don't buy it.

author: Andrew Carnegie
quote: The way to become rich is to put all your eggs in one basket and then watch that basket.

author: Margaret Thatcher
quote: You and I come by road or rail, but economists travel on infrastructure.

author: William Feather
quote: One of the funny things about the stock market is that every time one person buys, another sells, and both think they are astute.

author: Dave Ramsey
quote: I believe that through knowledge and discipline, financial peace is possible for all of us.

author: Alan Greenspan
quote: In the absence of the gold standard, there is no way to protect savings from confiscation through inflation. There is no safe store of value.

author: Bernard Baruch
quote: I made my money by selling too soon.

author: Adam Smith
quote: All money is a matter of belief.

author: E. F. Schumacher
quote: Infinite growth of material consumption in a finite world is an impossibility.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: If all the economists were laid end to end, they'd never reach a conclusion.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.

author: Jim Morrison
quote: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.

author: Aristotle
quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.

author: Leo Buscaglia
quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.

author: Henri Nouwen
quote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.

author: Bill Watterson
quote: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.

author: Baltasar Gracian
quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.

author: Elie Wiesel
quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.

author: Plutarch
quote: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.

author: Thomas Sowell
quote: What is ominous is the ease with which some people go from saying that they don't like something to saying that the government should forbid it. When you go down that road, don't expect freedom to survive very long.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves; and under the rule of a just God, cannot long retain it.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
