quote: True individual freedom cannot exist without economic security and independence. People who are hungry and out of a job are the stuff of which dictatorships are made.

author: Friedrich August von Hayek
quote: 'Emergencies' have always been the pretext on which the safeguards of individual liberty have been eroded.

author: Mark Twain
quote: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.

author: Frank Herbert
quote: Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty.

author: Euripides
quote: The good and the wise lead quiet lives.

author: Edward R. Murrow
quote: We cannot make good news out of bad practice.

author: Rollo May
quote: Life comes from physical survival; but the good life comes from what we care about.

author: Louis L'Amour
quote: A good beginning makes a good end.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Learn to... be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.

author: Desi Arnaz
quote: Good things do not come easy. The road is lined with pitfalls.

author: Thornton Wilder
quote: I know that every good and excellent thing in the world stands moment by moment on the razor-edge of danger and must be fought for.

author: Oliver Cromwell
quote: He who stops being better stops being good.

author: Brooks Atkinson
quote: In every age 'the good old days' were a myth. No one ever thought they were good at the time. For every age has consisted of crises that seemed intolerable to the people who lived through them.

author: Charles Evans Hughes
quote: A man has to live with himself, and he should see to it that he always has good company.

author: Laurence Olivier
quote: Have a very good reason for everything you do.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: The word 'good' has many meanings. For example, if a man were to shoot his grandmother at a range of five hundred yards, I should call him a good shot, but not necessarily a good man.

author: Joseph Prince
quote: Laughter is God's blessing.

author: Aaron Neville
quote: Every morning I wake up and thank God.

author: David Brainerd
quote: We should always look upon ourselves as God's servants, placed in God's world, to do his work; and accordingly labour faithfully for him; not with a design to grow rich and great, but to glorify God, and do all the good we possibly can.

author: Mary Manin Morrissey
quote: Start living now. Stop saving the good china for that special occasion. Stop withholding your love until that special person materializes. Every day you are alive is a special occasion. Every minute, every breath, is a gift from God.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Remember that children, marriages, and flower gardens reflect the kind of care they get.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I want it said of me by those who knew me best, that I always plucked a thistle and planted a flower where I thought a flower would grow.

author: Georges Bernanos
quote: Little things seem nothing, but they give peace, like those meadow flowers which individually seem odorless but all together perfume the air.

author: Alice Sebold
quote: I like gardening - it's a place where I find myself when I need to lose myself.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: Love is the flower of life, and blossoms unexpectedly and without law, and must be plucked where it is found, and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: From plants that wake when others sleep, from timid jasmine buds that keep their odour to themselves all day, but when the sunlight dies away let the delicious secret out to every breeze that roams about.

author: B. C. Forbes
quote: It is only the farmer who faithfully plants seeds in the Spring, who reaps a harvest in the Autumn.

author: Dogen
quote: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.

author: Luis Barragan
quote: A garden must combine the poetic and the mysterious with a feeling of serenity and joy.

author: Daniel Webster
quote: Let us not forget that the cultivation of the earth is the most important labor of man. When tillage begins, other arts will follow. The farmers, therefore, are the founders of civilization.

author: William Kent
quote: All gardening is landscape painting.

author: Sara Paretsky
quote: I went to college at the University of Kansas, where I got a degree in political science.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: I accidentally forgot to graduate from college.

author: Dana Snyder
quote: I graduated from the University of Whatever.

author: Fiona Apple
quote: I got all my work done to graduate in two months and then they were like, I'm sorry, you have to take driver's ed. I just kind of went, Oh, forget it.

author: Donna Rice
quote: After graduating in the summer of 1980, I knew I wanted my life to count.

author: Al McGuire
quote: Remember, half the doctors in this country graduated in the bottom half of their class.

author: Douglas Wilson
quote: Yeah, I spent about 20 years in a dorm room. It took me a while to graduate.

author: Rita Levi-Montalcini
quote: At 20, I realized that I could not possibly adjust to a feminine role as conceived by my father and asked him permission to engage in a professional career. In eight months I filled my gaps in Latin, Greek and mathematics, graduated from high school, and entered medical school in Turin.

author: Richard King
quote: I'm not impressed by someone's degree... I'm impressed by them making movies.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: The future ain't what it used to be.

author: Jeff Bezos
quote: What we need to do is always lean into the future; when the world changes around you and when it changes against you - what used to be a tail wind is now a head wind - you have to lean into that and figure out what to do because complaining isn't a strategy.

author: Marcel Pagnol
quote: The reason people find it so hard to be happy is that they always see the past better than it was, the present worse than it is, and the future less resolved than it will be.

author: Charles Kettering
quote: My interest is in the future because I am going to spend the rest of my life there.

author: Jon Bon Jovi
quote: Map out your future - but do it in pencil. The road ahead is as long as you make it. Make it worth the trip.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: Look not mournfully into the past, it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present, it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
quote: If future generations are to remember us more with gratitude than sorrow, we must achieve more than just the miracles of technology. We must also leave them a glimpse of the world as it was created, not just as it looked when we got through with it.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: The past, the present and the future are really one: they are today.

author: James Baldwin
quote: There is never time in the future in which we will work out our salvation. The challenge is in the moment; the time is always now.

author: George Carlin
quote: There's no present. There's only the immediate future and the recent past.

author: Patrick Henry
quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: Without forgiveness, there's no future.

author: Henry Miller
quote: Every man has his own destiny: the only imperative is to follow it, to accept it, no matter where it leads him.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
quote: When the past no longer illuminates the future, the spirit walks in darkness.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.

author: Andrew Carnegie
quote: Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.

author: M. Scott Peck
quote: The whole course of human history may depend on a change of heart in one solitary and even humble individual - for it is in the solitary mind and soul of the individual that the battle between good and evil is waged and ultimately won or lost.

author: Edward Gibbon
quote: History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies, and misfortunes of mankind.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: So that the record of history is absolutely crystal clear. That there is no alternative way, so far discovered, of improving the lot of the ordinary people that can hold a candle to the productive activities that are unleashed by a free enterprise system.

author: Ted Koppel
quote: History is a tool used by politicians to justify their intentions.

author: A. Whitney Brown
quote: The past actually happened but history is only what someone wrote down.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: God cannot alter the past, though historians can.

author: Marge Piercy
quote: Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.

author: Grover Cleveland
quote: A truly American sentiment recognizes the dignity of labor and the fact that honor lies in honest toil.

author: Colin Powell
quote: 90 percent of my time is spent on 10 percent of the world.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: I have tried to lift France out of the mud. But she will return to her errors and vomitings. I cannot prevent the French from being French.

author: Nikita Khrushchev
quote: The more bombers, the less room for doves of peace.

author: Mark Van Doren
quote: Bring ideas in and entertain them royally, for one of them may be the king.

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quote: The courage to imagine the otherwise is our greatest resource, adding color and suspense to all our life.

author: Quincy Jones
quote: Imagine what a harmonious world it could be if every single person, both young and old shared a little of what he is good at doing.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: There is a boundary to men's passions when they act from feelings; but none when they are under the influence of imagination.

author: Charlie Chaplin
quote: The saddest thing I can imagine is to get used to luxury.

author: Ben Okri
quote: When you can imagine you begin to create and when you begin to create you realize that you can create a world that you prefer to live in, rather than a world that you're suffering in.

author: Anne Sullivan
quote: We imagine that we want to escape our selfish and commonplace existence, but we cling desperately to our chains.

author: Deborah Tannen
quote: Communication is a continual balancing act, juggling the conflicting needs for intimacy and independence. To survive in the world, we have to act in concert with others, but to survive as ourselves, rather than simply as cogs in a wheel, we have to act alone.

author: Marianne Moore
quote: Impatience is the mark of independence, not of bondage.

author: Mitch Daniels
quote: All great enterprises have a pearl of faith at their core, and this must be ours: that Americans are still a people born to liberty. That they retain the capacity for self-government. That, addressed as free-born, autonomous men and women of God-given dignity, they will rise yet again to drive back a mortal enemy.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.

author: Walter Savage Landor
quote: We are no longer happy so soon as we wish to be happier.

author: William E. Gladstone
quote: Be happy with what you have and are, be generous with both, and you won't have to hunt for happiness.

author: Carl Sandburg
quote: The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring.

author: Oscar Levant
quote: Happiness isn't something you experience; it's something you remember.

author: Norman Cousins
quote: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: If it were not for hopes, the heart would break.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.

author: Arthur Ashe
quote: I have tried to keep on with my striving because this is the only hope I have of ever achieving anything worthwhile and lasting.

author: Epictetus
quote: Be careful to leave your sons well instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.

author: Anne Frank
quote: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.

author: Marcus Garvey
quote: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.

author: Unknown
quote: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.

author: Anne Sexton
quote: It doesn't matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was.

author: T. D. Jakes
quote: I want to congratulate all the men out there who are working diligently to be good fathers whether they are stepfathers, or biological fathers or just spiritual fathers.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: Son, brother, father, lover, friend. There is room in the heart for all the affections, as there is room in heaven for all the stars.

author: John Wooden
quote: The most important thing in the world is family and love.

author: Amber Heard
quote: I was raised by my father; I was daddy's girl.

author: Billy Graham
quote: Man has two great spiritual needs. One is for forgiveness. The other is for goodness.

author: Grace Hopper
quote: It is often easier to ask for forgiveness than to ask for permission.

author: Mahavira
quote: Anger begets more anger, and forgiveness and love lead to more forgiveness and love.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.

author: Robert Downey, Jr.
quote: The lesson is that you can still make mistakes and be forgiven.

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: Thank you, God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough.

author: Martin Luther
quote: Forgiveness is God's command.

author: Jewel
quote: Forgiveness is the needle that knows how to mend.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character.

author: Aristotle
quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.

author: Plato
quote: Democracy... is a charming form of government, full of variety and disorder; and dispensing a sort of equality to equals and unequals alike.

author: Sonia Sotomayor
quote: Until we get equality in education, we won't have an equal society.

author: J. K. Rowling
quote: If you want to see the true measure of a man, watch how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.

author: Florence Griffith Joyner
quote: A muscle is like a car. If you want it to run well early in the morning, you have to warm it up.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
quote: A feeble body weakens the mind.

author: Samantha Stosur
quote: Flexibility is crucial to my fitness. Incorporating a good warm-up and cool-down into every session decreases my chances of injury. I use both dynamic and static stretching in my training. I've starting doing a few yoga sessions which incorporates muscle strength and flexibility.

author: Tia Mowry
quote: I like to embrace natural beauty. I try to get at least 8 hours of sleep, drinking a lot of water and exercising.

author: Sam Snead
quote: Practice puts brains in your muscles.

author: Charles M. Schulz
quote: Jogging is very beneficial. It's good for your legs and your feet. It's also very good for the ground. If makes it feel needed.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: Exercise is labor without weariness.

author: Kim Kardashian
quote: If I don't feel confident about my body, I'm not going to sit at home and feel sorry for myself and not do something about it. It's all about taking action and not being lazy. So you do the work, whether it's fitness or whatever. It's about getting up, motivating yourself and just doing it.

author: Kenneth H. Cooper
quote: The reason I exercise is for the quality of life I enjoy.

author: Richard Simmons
quote: Number one, like yourself. Number two, you have to eat healthy. And number three, you've got to squeeze your buns. That's my formula.

author: Paul Dudley White
quote: A vigorous five-mile walk will do more good for an unhappy but otherwise healthy adult than all the medicine and psychology in the world.

author: Franklin Pierce Adams
quote: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.

author: William Temple
quote: The only way for a rich man to be healthy is by exercise and abstinence, to live as if he were poor.

author: Josh Billings
quote: There's a lot of people in this world who spend so much time watching their health that they haven't the time to enjoy it.

author: George Best
quote: I spent a lot of money on booze, birds and fast cars. The rest I just squandered.

author: Alexandra Paul
quote: The cars we drive say a lot about us.

author: Dale Earnhardt
quote: It's a never ending battle of making your cars better and also trying to be better yourself.

author: E. B. White
quote: Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.

author: Tom Brokaw
quote: It's easy to make a buck. It's a lot tougher to make a difference.

author: Colin Powell
quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.

author: Elon Musk
quote: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.

author: J. Paul Getty
quote: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.

author: Mark Twain
quote: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.

author: Voltaire
quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.

author: Confucius
quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Nobody cares how much you know, until they know how much you care.

author: Thomas Browne
quote: Rough diamonds may sometimes be mistaken for worthless pebbles.

author: Josh Billings
quote: There's a great power in words, if you don't hitch too many of them together.

author: Thor Heyerdahl
quote: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity.

author: Mel Brooks
quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.

author: Tallulah Bankhead
quote: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.

author: Brooke Shields
quote: Smoking kills. If you're killed, you've lost a very important part of your life.

author: Katharine Hepburn
quote: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.

author: Samuel Beckett
quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.

author: Carrie Fisher
quote: Instant gratification takes too long.

author: Luis Bunuel
quote: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: When you focus on being a blessing, God makes sure that you are always blessed in abundance.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: We are never defeated unless we give up on God.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

author: Voltaire
quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

author: Voltaire
quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.

author: William Barclay
quote: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.

author: Morihei Ueshiba
quote: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.

author: Wilma Rudolph
quote: Winning is great, sure, but if you are really going to do something in life, the secret is learning how to lose. Nobody goes undefeated all the time. If you can pick up after a crushing defeat, and go on to win again, you are going to be a champion someday.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Ambition is the last refuge of the failure.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the road to achievement. One fails forward toward success.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: Remember that failure is an event, not a person.

author: John Burroughs
quote: A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he begins to blame somebody else.

author: J. K. Rowling
quote: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all, in which case you have failed by default.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The only source of knowledge is experience.

author: Vince Lombardi
quote: Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect.

author: Immanuel Kant
quote: Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.

author: Julius Caesar
quote: Experience is the teacher of all things.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.

author: Mark Twain
quote: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.

author: Cary Grant
quote: I pretended to be somebody I wanted to be until finally I became that person. Or he became me.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Fame is a fickle food upon a shifting plate.

author: Britney Spears
quote: The cool thing about being famous is traveling. I have always wanted to travel across seas, like to Canada and stuff.

author: Walt Disney
quote: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quote: The celebrity is a person who is known for his well-knownness.

author: Henry Kissinger
quote: The nice thing about being a celebrity is that, if you bore people, they think it's their fault.

author: Princess Margaret
quote: I have as much privacy as a goldfish in a bowl.

author: Annie Leibovitz
quote: I'm more interested in being good than being famous.

author: Kristen Stewart
quote: The strangest part about being famous is you don't get to give first impressions anymore. Everyone already has an impression of you before you meet them.

author: George Harrison
quote: I wanted to be successful, not famous.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Always do what you are afraid to do.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
quote: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.

author: W. Clement Stone
quote: Thinking will not overcome fear but action will.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.

author: Rosa Parks
quote: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment.

author: Thomas Paine
quote: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.

author: Clara Barton
quote: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: What is a fear of living? It's being preeminently afraid of dying. It is not doing what you came here to do, out of timidity and spinelessness. The antidote is to take full responsibility for yourself - for the time you take up and the space you occupy. If you don't know what you're here to do, then just do some good.

author: Ronald Reagan
quote: Don't be afraid to see what you see.

author: Henry Ford
quote: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.

author: Warren Buffett
quote: We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.

author: George Carlin
quote: The other night I ate at a real nice family restaurant. Every table had an argument going.

author: Charles Kuralt
quote: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.

author: Andre Maurois
quote: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.

author: Barbara Bush
quote: To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there.

author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel
quote: A family can develop only with a loving woman as its center.

author: George Santayana
quote: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.

author: Pope John XXIII
quote: The family is the first essential cell of human society.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: A family is a place where principles are hammered and honed on the anvil of everyday living.

author: Marie Curie
quote: I have frequently been questioned, especially by women, of how I could reconcile family life with a scientific career. Well, it has not been easy.

author: Jo Brand
quote: Anything is good if it's made of chocolate.

author: Calvin Trillin
quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.

author: Ken Hill
quote: Food is your body's fuel. Without fuel, your body wants to shut down.

author: George Orwell
quote: We may find in the long run that tinned food is a deadlier weapon than the machine-gun.

author: Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin
quote: Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you who you are.

author: Dolly Parton
quote: My weaknesses have always been food and men - in that order.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quote: A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food; therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: Let's face it, a nice creamy chocolate cake does a lot for a lot of people; it does for me.

author: Monica Bellucci
quote: When I eat with my friends, it is a moment of real pleasure, when I really enjoy my life.

author: John Walters
quote: The only think I like better than talking about Food is eating.

author: Elsa Schiaparelli
quote: Eating is not merely a material pleasure. Eating well gives a spectacular joy to life and contributes immensely to goodwill and happy companionship. It is of great importance to the morale.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Laws too gentle are seldom obeyed; too severe, seldom executed.

author: William Penn
quote: Let the people think they govern and they will be governed.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
quote: A democratic government is the only one in which those who vote for a tax can escape the obligation to pay it.

author: Milton Friedman
quote: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.

author: Mikhail Gorbachev
quote: The world will not accept dictatorship or domination.

author: Albert Camus
quote: By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.

author: Ludwig von Mises
quote: The worst evils which mankind has ever had to endure were inflicted by bad governments.

author: Sydney J. Harris
quote: Democracy is the only system that persists in asking the powers that be whether they are the powers that ought to be.

author: Warren Buffett
quote: Derivatives are financial weapons of mass destruction.

author: Herbert Hoover
quote: About the time we can make the ends meet, somebody moves the ends.

author: Suze Orman
quote: A big part of financial freedom is having your heart and mind free from worry about the what-ifs of life.

author: Bo Bennett
quote: As sure as the spring will follow the winter, prosperity and economic growth will follow recession.

author: Albert Camus
quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.

author: J. Paul Getty
quote: Money is like manure. You have to spread it around or it smells.

author: William Petty
quote: Money is the best rule of commerce.

author: Alfred Marshall
quote: Capital is that part of wealth which is devoted to obtaining further wealth.

author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
quote: Watch your finances like a hawk.

author: David Ricardo
quote: There can be no rise in the value of labour without a fall of profits.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.

author: A. Philip Randolph
quote: Freedom is never given; it is won.

author: Pericles
quote: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
quote: Freedom is something that dies unless it's used.

author: Peter Marshall
quote: May we think of freedom, not as the right to do as we please, but as the opportunity to do what is right.

author: John Adams
quote: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.

author: Rosa Parks
quote: I would like to be remembered as a person who wanted to be free... so other people would be also free.

author: Epictetus
quote: Is freedom anything else than the right to live as we wish? Nothing else.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.

author: Marcus Garvey
quote: Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our minds!

author: Thomas Paine
quote: Those who expect to reap the blessings of freedom must, like men, undergo the fatigue of supporting it.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.

author: Charles Evans Hughes
quote: When we lose the right to be different, we lose the privilege to be free.

author: Wilson Mizner
quote: A good listener is not only popular everywhere, but after a while, he knows something.

author: Barbara Jordan
quote: What the people want is very simple - they want an America as good as its promise.

author: Calvin Coolidge
quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
quote: Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.

author: Unknown
quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.

author: E. W. Howe
quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.

author: Edwin Markham
quote: The crest and crowning of all good, Life's final star, is brotherhood.

author: Debbi Fields
quote: Good enough never is.

author: Bertolt Brecht
quote: No one can be good for long if goodness is not in demand.

author: Stevie Wonder
quote: God gave me life to continue to do things that I would never have done.

author: Gloria Trevi
quote: Sometimes God writes straightforward in twisted lines.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: What ever disunites man from God, also disunites man from man.

author: Tertullian
quote: Nothing that is God's is obtainable by money.

author: William Blake
quote: Where mercy, love, and pity dwell, there God is dwelling too.

author: James Weldon Johnson
quote: Young man, young man, your arm's too short to box with God.

author: Martin Luther
quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection, not in books alone, but in every leaf in springtime.

author: King Solomon
quote: Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God; only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
quote: God, I can push the grass apart and lay my finger on Thy heart.

author: Karen Blixen
quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.

author: Frederick William Faber
quote: They always win who side with God.

author: Oscar de la Renta
quote: Gardening is how I relax. It's another form of creating and playing with colors.

author: Joseph Addison
quote: I value my garden more for being full of blackbirds than of cherries, and very frankly give them fruit for their songs.

author: James Douglas
quote: It is a good idea to be alone in a garden at dawn or dark so that all its shy presences may haunt you and possess you in a reverie of suspended thought.

author: Michael Pollan
quote: A lawn is nature under totalitarian rule.

author: Roberto Burle Marx
quote: A garden is a complex of aesthetic and plastic intentions; and the plant is, to a landscape artist, not only a plant - rare, unusual, ordinary or doomed to disappearance - but it is also a color, a shape, a volume or an arabesque in itself.

author: Katherine Dunham
quote: I have actually five honorary degrees.

author: Scott Hamilton
quote: I graduated a the top of my class in the '84 Olympic Games; I won a gold medal.

author: Ted Nelson
quote: In my second year in graduate school, I took a computer course and that was like lightening striking.

author: R. Lee Ermey
quote: Even though I disagree with many of the changes, when I see the privates graduate at the end of the day, when they walk off that drill field at the end of the ceremony, they are still fine privates; outstanding, well motivated privates.

author: Claire Danes
quote: I took three years off. I differentiated myself from the industry. Found my identity - sort of... I haven't graduated yet. I'm not legitimately educated yet, but maybe one day.

author: Daniel J. Evans
quote: I did graduate with a bachelor's degree in civil engineering in 1948.

author: James Green Somerville
quote: I dropped out of school for a semester, transferred to another college, switched to an art major, graduated, got married, and for a while worked as a graphic designer.

author: Robert M. Hutchins
quote: The college graduate is presented with a sheepskin to cover his intellectual nakedness.

author: Rick Santorum
quote: It's very interesting, if you look at a study that was done by the Brookings Institute back in 2009, they determined that if Americans do three things, they can avoid poverty. Three things. Work, graduate from high school, and get married before you have children.

author: Sai Baba
quote: What matters is to live in the present, live now, for every moment is now. It is your thoughts and acts of the moment that create your future. The outline of your future path already exists, for you created its pattern by your past.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: Happy is the person who knows what to remember of the past, what to enjoy in the present, and what to plan for in the future.

author: Mark Strand
quote: The future is always beginning now.

author: James Joyce
quote: I am tomorrow, or some future day, what I establish today. I am today what I established yesterday or some previous day.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: I don't try to describe the future. I try to prevent it.

author: George Santayana
quote: We must welcome the future, remembering that soon it will be the past; and we must respect the past, remembering that it was once all that was humanly possible.

author: John Adams
quote: Posterity! You will never know how much it cost the present generation to preserve your freedom! I hope you will make a good use of it.

author: Linus Pauling
quote: Satisfaction of one's curiosity is one of the greatest sources of happiness in life.

author: Baruch Spinoza
quote: Happiness is a virtue, not its reward.

author: Dennis Prager
quote: Happiness is dependent on self-discipline. We are the biggest obstacles to our own happiness. It is much easier to do battle with society and with others than to fight our own nature.

author: Bernard Meltzer
quote: Happiness is like a kiss. You must share it to enjoy it.

author: Jose Marti
quote: Happiness exists on earth, and it is won through prudent exercise of reason, knowledge of the harmony of the universe, and constant practice of generosity.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.

author: Ben Jonson
quote: True happiness consists not in the multitude of friends, but in the worth and choice.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.

author: Princess Diana
quote: Nothing brings me more happiness than trying to help the most vulnerable people in society. It is a goal and an essential part of my life - a kind of destiny. Whoever is in distress can call on me. I will come running wherever they are.

author: Adam Smith
quote: Happiness never lays its finger on its pulse.

author: Gloria Naylor
quote: Old as she was, she still missed her daddy sometimes.

author: Hedy Lamarr
quote: I am not ashamed to say that no man I ever met was my father's equal, and I never loved any other man as much.

author: Robert Frost
quote: You don't have to deserve your mother's love. You have to deserve your father's.

author: Al Unser
quote: Dad taught me everything I know. Unfortunately, he didn't teach me everything he knows.

author: Naveen Jain
quote: Being a father has been, without a doubt, my greatest source of achievement, pride and inspiration. Fatherhood has taught me about unconditional love, reinforced the importance of giving back and taught me how to be a better person.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote: Man becomes man only by his intelligence, but he is man only by his heart.

author: Conrad Hall
quote: Dad, wherever you are, you are gone but you will never be forgotten.

author: Kent Nerburn
quote: Until you have a son of your own... you will never know the joy, the love beyond feeling that resonates in the heart of a father as he looks upon his son.

author: Liam Neeson
quote: It's an ongoing joy being a dad.

author: Mark Wahlberg
quote: I pray to be a good servant to God, a father, a husband, a son, a friend, a brother, an uncle, a good neighbor, a good leader to those who look up to me, a good follower to those who are serving God and doing the right thing.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: I can forgive, but I cannot forget, is only another way of saying, I will not forgive. Forgiveness ought to be like a cancelled note - torn in two, and burned up, so that it never can be shown against one.

author: Les Brown
quote: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.

author: Joan Lunden
quote: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life.

author: Francis of Assisi
quote: It is in pardoning that we are pardoned.

author: Alan Paton
quote: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.

author: Elizabeth I
quote: God forgive you, but I never can.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: Rightful liberty is unobstructed action according to our will within limits drawn around us by the equal rights of others. I do not add 'within the limits of the law' because law is often but the tyrant's will, and always so when it violates the rights of the individual.

author: Will Rogers
quote: We will never have true civilization until we have learned to recognize the rights of others.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: There should be no discrimination against languages people speak, skin color, or religion.

author: Chief Joseph
quote: The earth is the mother of all people, and all people should have equal rights upon it.

author: Kofi Annan
quote: Gender equality is more than a goal in itself. It is a precondition for meeting the challenge of reducing poverty, promoting sustainable development and building good governance.

author: Ellen DeGeneres
quote: Here are the values that I stand for: honesty, equality, kindness, compassion, treating people the way you want to be treated and helping those in need. To me, those are traditional values.

author: W. C. Fields
quote: I am free of all prejudices. I hate everyone equally.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
quote: Democracy and socialism have nothing in common but one word, equality. But notice the difference: while democracy seeks equality in liberty, socialism seeks equality in restraint and servitude.

author: Frances Wright
quote: Equality is the soul of liberty; there is, in fact, no liberty without it.

author: Barry Goldwater
quote: Equality, rightly understood as our founding fathers understood it, leads to liberty and to the emancipation of creative differences; wrongly understood, as it has been so tragically in our time, it leads first to conformity and then to despotism.

author: Peggy Fleming
quote: I think exercise tests us in so many ways, our skills, our hearts, our ability to bounce back after setbacks. This is the inner beauty of sports and competition, and it can serve us all well as adult athletes.

author: James Freeman Clarke
quote: Never hurry. Take plenty of exercise. Always be cheerful. Take all the sleep you need. You may expect to be well.

author: Sarah Michelle Gellar
quote: I don't smoke, don't drink much, and go to the gym five times a week. I live a healthy lifestyle and feel great. I can run a marathon, you know.

author: Vanessa Hudgens
quote: Exercise is amazing, from the inside out. I feel so alive and have more energy.

author: Erin Gray
quote: I like exercise. I like a healthy body.

author: Vinoba Bhave
quote: If a man achieves victory over this body, who in the world can exercise power over him? He who rules himself rules over the whole world.

author: James Thomson
quote: Health is the vital principle of bliss, and exercise, of health.

author: Fred Perry
quote: Tactics, fitness, stroke ability, adaptability, experience, and sportsmanship are all necessary for winning.

author: James Woolsey
quote: We aren't addicted to oil, but our cars are.

author: E. L. Doctorow
quote: It's like driving a car at night. You never see further than your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.

author: Mitch Hedberg
quote: I know a lot about cars, man. I can look at any car's headlights and tell you exactly which way it's coming.

author: Mario Lopez
quote: There's three things men always talk about - women, sports, and cars.

author: Louis C. K.
quote: Cars and cameras are the two things I let myself be materialistic about. I don't care about other stuff.

author: Alfred P. Sloan
quote: A car for every purse and purpose.

author: Michael Bay
quote: Fast cars are my only vice.

author: Scott Baio
quote: I love driving cars, looking at them, cleaning and washing and shining them. I clean 'em inside and outside. I'm very touchy about cars. I don't want anybody leaning on them or closing the door too hard, know what I mean?

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Confucius
quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.

author: Audrey Hepburn
quote: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mode but the true beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows. The beauty of a woman grows with the passing years.

author: John Ray
quote: Beauty is power; a smile is its sword.

author: Charles Lamb
quote: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.

author: Sam Walton
quote: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.

author: Andy Warhol
quote: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.

author: Jeff Bezos
quote: A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.

author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.

author: Sanford I. Weill
quote: Details create the big picture.

author: Viktor E. Frankl
quote: Challenging the meaning of life is the truest expression of the state of being human.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.

author: Ethel Waters
quote: We are all gifted. That is our inheritance.

author: John Ruskin
quote: Quality is never an accident. It is always the result of intelligent effort.

author: Yogi Berra
quote: If you don't know where you are going, you might wind up someplace else.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
quote: In the kingdom of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.

author: Unknown
quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.

author: Lenny Bruce
quote: When you're eight years old nothing is your business.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: Every time I see an adult on a bicycle, I no longer despair for the future of the human race.

author: E. B. White
quote: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: I can resist everything except temptation.

author: Oscar Levant
quote: Roses are red, violets are blue, I'm schizophrenic, and so am I.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: If I knew for a certainty that a man was coming to my house with the conscious design of doing me good, I should run for my life.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: If a cluttered desk is the sign of a cluttered mind, what is the significance of a clean desk?

author: Chris Rock
quote: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.

author: Plato
quote: We are twice armed if we fight with faith.

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
quote: God, our Creator, has stored within our minds and personalities, great potential strength and ability. Prayer helps us tap and develop these powers.

author: Alan Watts
quote: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.

author: Iyanla Vanzant
quote: In my deepest, darkest moments, what really got me through was a prayer. Sometimes my prayer was 'Help me.' Sometimes a prayer was 'Thank you.' What I've discovered is that intimate connection and communication with my creator will always get me through because I know my support, my help, is just a prayer away.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: Belief is a wise wager. Granted that faith cannot be proved, what harm will come to you if you gamble on its truth and it proves false? If you gain, you gain all; if you lose, you lose nothing. Wager, then, without hesitation, that He exists.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Faith is an oasis in the heart which will never be reached by the caravan of thinking.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: It takes a long time to become young.

author: Satchel Paige
quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?

author: Denis Waitley
quote: The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence.

author: George Meredith
quote: Don't just count your years, make your years count.

author: Booth Tarkington
quote: Cherish all your happy moments; they make a fine cushion for old age.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.

author: Brian Tracy
quote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.

author: Boris Johnson
quote: My policy on cake is pro having it and pro eating it.

author: Marie Antoinette
quote: Let them eat cake.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: I think, at a child's birth, if a mother could ask a fairy godmother to endow it with the most useful gift, that gift should be curiosity.

author: Truman Capote
quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.

author: Andy Grove
quote: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.

author: Sumner Redstone
quote: Success is not built on success. It's built on failure. It's built on frustration. Sometimes its built on catastrophe.

author: Tony Robbins
quote: There is no such thing as failure. There are only results.

author: James Joyce
quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.

author: Richard Branson
quote: Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again.

author: William Whewell
quote: Every failure is a step to success.

author: John Keats
quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.

author: John W. Gardner
quote: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.

author: Queen Latifah
quote: I made decisions that I regret, and I took them as learning experiences... I'm human, not perfect, like anybody else.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The years teach much which the days never know.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: I learned a long time ago the wisest thing I can do is be on my own side, be an advocate for myself and others like me.

author: Mao Zedong
quote: If you want to know the taste of a pear, you must change the pear by eating it yourself. If you want to know the theory and methods of revolution, you must take part in revolution. All genuine knowledge originates in direct experience.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: The reward of suffering is experience.

author: Auguste Rodin
quote: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.

author: Jake Roberts
quote: Every moment is an experience.

author: Hedy Lamarr
quote: To be a star is to own the world and all the people in it. After a taste of stardom, everything else is poverty.

author: Adele
quote: I just want to make music, I don't want people to talk about me. All I've ever wanted to do was sing. I don't want to be a celebrity. I don't want to be in people's faces, you know, constantly on covers of magazine that I haven't even known I'm on.

author: Wynonna Judd
quote: My story of success and failure is not just about music and being famous. It's about living and loving and trying to find purpose in this crazy world.

author: David Bowie
quote: I'm an instant star. Just add water and stir.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: Fame is like caviar, you know - it's good to have caviar but not when you have it at every meal.

author: Sinead O'Connor
quote: I seek no longer to be a 'famous' person, and instead I wish to live a 'normal' life.

author: Pericles
quote: For famous men have the whole earth as their memorial.

author: Anna Kournikova
quote: I am beautiful, famous and gorgeous.

author: Taylor Swift
quote: I think fearless is having fears but jumping anyway.

author: Chanakya
quote: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.

author: Paul Sweeney
quote: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: What is needed, rather than running away or controlling or suppressing or any other resistance, is understanding fear; that means, watch it, learn about it, come directly into contact with it. We are to learn about fear, not how to escape from it.

author: Marilyn Ferguson
quote: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.

author: Dorothy Thompson
quote: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: I say I am stronger than fear.

author: Fernando Flores
quote: Great work is done by people who are not afraid to be great.

author: Jet Li
quote: I believe the world is one big family, and we need to help each other.

author: Harmon Killebrew
quote: My father used to play with my brother and me in the yard. Mother would come out and say, 'You're tearing up the grass'; 'We're not raising grass,' Dad would reply. 'We're raising boys.'

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: Family quarrels are bitter things. They don't go according to any rules. They're not like aches or wounds, they're more like splits in the skin that won't heal because there's not enough material.

author: John Ruskin
quote: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.

author: Brad Pitt
quote: A family is a risky venture, because the greater the love, the greater the loss... That's the trade-off. But I'll take it all.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.

author: Jamie Oliver
quote: What I've enjoyed most, though, is meeting people who have a real interest in food and sharing ideas with them. Good food is a global thing and I find that there is always something new and amazing to learn - I love it!

author: Martin Scorsese
quote: If your mother cooks Italian food, why should you go to a restaurant?

author: A. Whitney Brown
quote: I am not a vegetarian because I love animals; I am a vegetarian because I hate plants.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: Man is the only animal that can remain on friendly terms with the victims he intends to eat until he eats them.

author: M. F. K. Fisher
quote: Sharing food with another human being is an intimate act that should not be indulged in lightly.

author: Lord Byron
quote: A woman should never be seen eating or drinking, unless it be lobster salad and Champagne, the only true feminine and becoming viands.

author: Scarlett Johansson
quote: I still eat a burger at a counter with ketchup dripping down my face.

author: Fran Lebowitz
quote: My favorite animal is steak.

author: Robert Redford
quote: Health food may be good for the conscience but Oreos taste a hell of a lot better.

author: Demetri Martin
quote: I like to use 'I Can't Believe it's Not Butter' on my toast in the morning, because sometimes when I eat breakfast, I like to be incredulous. How was breakfast? Unbelievable.

author: Sarah Michelle Gellar
quote: I like food. I like eating. And I don't want to deprive myself of good food.

author: Robert Irvine
quote: Every meal should end with something sweet. Maybe it's jelly on toast at breakfast, or a small piece of chocolate at dinner - but it always helps my brain bring a close to the meal.

author: Rene Descartes
quote: A state is better governed which has few laws, and those laws strictly observed.

author: Herbert Spencer
quote: All socialism involves slavery.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: For in reason, all government without the consent of the governed is the very definition of slavery.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: America is a land of taxation that was founded to avoid taxation.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: Democracy is an abuse of statistics.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: It is error alone which needs the support of government. Truth can stand by itself.

author: Woody Allen
quote: I believe there is something out there watching us. Unfortunately, it's the government.

author: Richard Wagner
quote: Divorce is one of the most financially traumatic things you can go through. Money spent on getting mad or getting even is money wasted.

author: T. Harv Eker
quote: The only way to permanently change the temperature in the room is to reset the thermostat. In the same way, the only way to change your level of financial success 'permanently' is to reset your financial thermostat. But it is your choice whether you choose to change.

author: Ron Lewis
quote: Financial literacy is an issue that should command our attention because many Americans are not adequately organizing finances for their education, healthcare and retirement.

author: Saint Stephen
quote: We cannot both preach and administer financial matters.

author: Leif Garrett
quote: Stay on top of your finances. Don't leave that up to others.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: The poor don't know that their function in life is to exercise our generosity.

author: George Soros
quote: The financial markets generally are unpredictable. So that one has to have different scenarios... The idea that you can actually predict what's going to happen contradicts my way of looking at the market.

author: Regis Philbin
quote: I'm involved in the stock market, which is fun and, sometimes, very painful.

author: Henrik Ibsen
quote: These heroes of finance are like beads on a string; when one slips off, all the rest follow.

author: Ben Bernanke
quote: The lesson of history is that you do not get a sustained economic recovery as long as the financial system is in crisis.

author: Hjalmar Schacht
quote: The economy is a very sensitive organism.

author: Cliff Richard
quote: Financial support is one thing, but I always think what becomes really sacrificial is your time.

author: Merton Miller
quote: You only need to make one big score in finance to be a hero forever.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.

author: Alice Walker
quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.

author: Charles Darwin
quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.

author: Henry Van Dyke
quote: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.

author: Marlene Dietrich
quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.

author: William Blake
quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.

author: John Stuart Mill
quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good, in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.

author: Patrick Henry
quote: The liberties of a people never were, nor ever will be, secure, when the transactions of their rulers may be concealed from them.

author: William Morris
quote: No man is good enough to be another's master.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.

author: Daniel J. Boorstin
quote: Freedom means the opportunity to be what we never thought we would be.

author: Mike Tyson
quote: Real freedom is having nothing. I was freer when I didn't have a cent.

author: Lech Walesa
quote: We hold our heads high, despite the price we have paid, because freedom is priceless.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: Responsibility is the price of freedom.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The desire of gold is not for gold. It is for the means of freedom and benefit.

author: Marcel Marceau
quote: It's good to shut up sometimes.

author: Richard Whately
quote: A man is called selfish not for pursuing his own good, but for neglecting his neighbor's.

author: Horace Mann
quote: Evil and good are God's right hand and left.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I can live for two months on a good compliment.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: Less is only more where more is no good.

author: Robert Collier
quote: You cannot hold on to anything good. You must be continually giving - and getting. You cannot hold on to your seed. You must sow it - and reap anew. You cannot hold on to riches. You must use them and get other riches in return.

author: Lord Byron
quote: The 'good old times' - all times when old are good.

author: Frank Moore Colby
quote: Cast your cares on God; that anchor holds.

author: Emmeline Pankhurst
quote: Trust in God - she will provide.

author: John Locke
quote: The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men. It has God for its author; salvation for its end, and truth without any mixture for its matter. It is all pure.

author: Aiden Wilson Tozer
quote: In almost everything that touches our everyday life on earth, God is pleased when we're pleased. He wills that we be as free as birds to soar and sing our maker's praise without anxiety.

author: Ted Williams
quote: God gets you to the plate, but once your there your on your own.

author: Benny Hinn
quote: God sent Jesus as an example to see if we could retain and maintain the Holy Spirit in human flesh.

author: John Barth
quote: The Bible is not man's word about God, but God's word about man.

author: Geronimo
quote: I cannot think that we are useless or God would not have created us. There is one God looking down on us all. We are all the children of one God. The sun, the darkness, the winds are all listening to what we have to say.

author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things.

author: Wendell Berry
quote: We learn from our gardens to deal with the most urgent question of the time: How much is enough?

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote: Trees and plants always look like the people they live with, somehow.

author: Ted Nelson
quote: So in my uncertainty, I went to graduate school and there it all happened.

author: Maya Lin
quote: I went through withdrawal when I got out of graduate school. It's what you learn, what you think. That's all that counts.

author: Og Mandino
quote: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.

author: George Burns
quote: I look to the future because that's where I'm going to spend the rest of my life.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: The most glorious moments in your life are not the so-called days of success, but rather those days when out of dejection and despair you feel rise in you a challenge to life, and the promise of future accomplishments.

author: Nicole Kidman
quote: I'm not sure what the future holds but I do know that I'm going to be positive and not wake up feeling desperate. As my dad said 'Nic, it is what it is, it's not what it should have been, not what it could have been, it is what it is.'

author: Seneca
quote: Enjoy present pleasures in such a way as not to injure future ones.

author: Bubba Watson
quote: My dad's not here, but he's watching in heaven.

author: Bo Jackson
quote: I would say my greatest achievement in life right now - my greatest achievement period is - and I'm still trying to achieve it - is to be a wonderful father to my kids.

author: Gordon Brown
quote: I'm a father; that's what matters most. Nothing matters more.

author: Kojo Annan
quote: I admire my father greatly.

author: Tiger Woods
quote: My dad was my best friend and greatest role model. He was an amazing dad, coach, mentor, soldier, husband and friend.

author: Max Lucado
quote: I was raised in the greatest of homes... just a really great dad, and I miss him so much... he was a good man, a real simple man... Very faithful, always loved my mom, always provided for the kids, and just a lot of fun.

author: Nick Lachey
quote: To me, having kids is the ultimate job in life. I want to be most successful at being a good father.

author: Harry Connick, Jr.
quote: My Dad is my hero.

author: Maria Sharapova
quote: Without my dad, I wouldn't be here.

author: David Lauren
quote: My dad is my best friend, my father, and my boss. When I do something that is exciting and he likes it, it feels three times as good as you can imagine.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.

author: George Herbert
quote: He that cannot forgive others, breaks the bridge over which he himself must pass if he would ever reach heaven; for everyone has need to be forgiven.

author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin
quote: Never does the human soul appear so strong as when it foregoes revenge and dares to forgive an injury.

author: Hannah More
quote: Forgiveness is the economy of the heart... forgiveness saves the expense of anger, the cost of hatred, the waste of spirits.

author: Suzanne Somers
quote: Forgiveness is a gift you give yourself.

author: Alfred Korzybski
quote: God may forgive your sins, but your nervous system won't.

author: Corrie Ten Boom
quote: Forgiveness is an act of the will, and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart.

author: Bernard Baruch
quote: One of the secrets of a long and fruitful life is to forgive everybody everything everynight before you go to bed.

author: bell hooks
quote: For me, forgiveness and compassion are always linked: how do we hold people accountable for wrongdoing and yet at the same time remain in touch with their humanity enough to believe in their capacity to be transformed?

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: Forgotten is forgiven.

author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
quote: The history of the past is but one long struggle upward to equality.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.

author: George Orwell
quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.

author: Honore de Balzac
quote: Equality may perhaps be a right, but no power on earth can ever turn it into a fact.

author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
quote: No struggle can ever succeed without women participating side by side with men.

author: Bob Dylan
quote: All this talk about equality. The only thing people really have in common is that they are all going to die.

author: Barbara Jordan
quote: Do not call for black power or green power. Call for brain power.

author: Shirley Chisholm
quote: The emotional, sexual, and psychological stereotyping of females begins when the doctor says: It's a girl.

author: David Allan Coe
quote: All men are created equal, it is only men themselves who place themselves above equality.

author: Kerri Walsh Jennings
quote: My job is to be fit and I'm really blessed that I get to go and work out and live a really healthy lifestyle.

author: Mike Ditka
quote: Here's what I tell anybody and this is what I believe. The greatest gift we have is the gift of life. We understand that. That comes from our Creator. We're given a body. Now you may not like it, but you can maximize that body the best it can be maximized.

author: Knute Nelson
quote: In the midst of these hard times it is our good health and good sleep that are enjoyable.

author: Deborah Bull
quote: It's not about weight, it's about fitness, and one component of being fit is to have relatively low body fat, because fat is not very efficient, whereas muscle is.

author: Joan Rivers
quote: The first time I see a jogger smiling, I'll consider it.

author: Joely Fisher
quote: It's challenging, but you have to at least try to eat right and exercise.

author: Pink
quote: Women have fought so long and hard for our rights and equality, and now all our attention is put on being a size 0.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: I've exercised with women so thin that buzzards followed them to their cars.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.

author: John C. Maxwell
quote: People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.

author: Charles R. Swindoll
quote: We cannot change our past. We can not change the fact that people act in a certain way. We can not change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we have, and that is our attitude.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.

author: Lou Holtz
quote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.

author: Ralph Marston
quote: Excellence is not a skill, it's an attitude.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.

author: Walter Scott
quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.

author: Rudolf Diesel
quote: The automobile engine will come, and then I will consider my life's work complete.

author: Jason Behr
quote: Germans make nice cars.

author: Dudley Moore
quote: The best car safety device is a rear-view mirror with a cop in it.

author: Harry S Truman
quote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.

author: Conan O'Brien
quote: Work hard, be kind, and amazing things will happen.

author: Joe Namath
quote: When you have confidence, you can have a lot of fun. And when you have fun, you can do amazing things.

author: Les Brown
quote: If you set goals and go after them with all the determination you can muster, your gifts will take you places that will amaze you.

author: Anna Quindlen
quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.

author: Desmond Tutu
quote: Isn't it amazing that we are all made in God's image, and yet there is so much diversity among his people?

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.

author: Aristotle
quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.

author: Steve Prefontaine
quote: To give anything less than your best, is to sacrifice the gift.

author: George Halas
quote: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: The best way to keep one's word is not to give it.

author: e. e. cummings
quote: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: The best revenge is massive success.

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: I'm selfish, impatient, and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I'm out of control, and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I do the very best I know how - the very best I can; and I mean to keep on doing so until the end.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.

author: Laetitia Casta
quote: Real beauty is to be true to oneself. That's what makes me feel good.

author: Anatole France
quote: If the path be beautiful, let us not ask where it leads.

author: Jean Anouilh
quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.

author: Maria Mitchell
quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.

author: Anne Roiphe
quote: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.

author: John Keats
quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.

author: Ashley Smith
quote: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: Beauty awakens the soul to act.

author: Anne Frank
quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Whatever good things we build end up building us.

author: David Allan Coe
quote: It is not the beauty of a building you should look at; its the construction of the foundation that will stand the test of time.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: We shape our buildings; thereafter they shape us.

author: Philip Johnson
quote: Architecture is the art of how to waste space.

author: Julia Morgan
quote: Architecture is a visual art, and the buildings speak for themselves.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: We are called to be architects of the future, not its victims.

author: Louis Kahn
quote: Architecture is the reaching out for the truth.

author: Frank Gehry
quote: Architecture should speak of its time and place, but yearn for timelessness.

author: Le Corbusier
quote: Architecture is the learned game, correct and magnificent, of forms assembled in the light.

author: Thomas a Kempis
quote: The loftier the building, the deeper must the foundation be laid.

author: Elizabeth Kenny
quote: He who angers you conquers you.

author: Buddha
quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.

author: Douglas Horton
quote: While seeking revenge, dig two graves - one for yourself.

author: Peter Drucker
quote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.

author: Thomas A. Edison
quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.

author: Max de Pree
quote: The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality. The last is to say thank you. In between, the leader is a servant.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.

author: Jack Welch
quote: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.

author: Adam Smith
quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.

author: Don Marquis
quote: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.

author: Arnold H. Glasow
quote: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.

author: Robert H. Schuller
quote: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.

author: Henry Ford
quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote: The time is always right to do what is right.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: There are three classes of people: those who see, those who see when they are shown, those who do not see.

author: Louis Pasteur
quote: Fortune favors the prepared mind.

author: Aristotle
quote: Well begun is half done.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.

author: Matthew Henry
quote: None so deaf as those that will not hear. None so blind as those that will not see.

author: Marie Curie
quote: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.

author: Ellen DeGeneres
quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the hell she is.

author: David Lee Roth
