quote: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.

author: Hattie McDaniel
quote: I did my best, and God did the rest.

author: Aeschylus
quote: It is best for the wise man not to seem wise.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: The best road to progress is freedom's road.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.

author: Hannah Arendt
quote: This is the precept by which I have lived: Prepare for the worst; expect the best; and take what comes.

author: Marlee Matlin
quote: I have made the choices that work best for me. I know I cannot please everyone, and that's fine.

author: Douglas MacArthur
quote: The best luck of all is the luck you make for yourself.

author: Eric Butterworth
quote: One of the best things to do sometimes is simply to be.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody, it saves so much trouble.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
quote: I will do my best. That is all I can do. I ask for your help - and God's.

author: David Icke
quote: The best way of removing negativity is to laugh and be joyous.

author: Thomas Leonard
quote: Integrity reveals beauty.

author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
quote: In life, as in art, the beautiful moves in curves.

author: Jacqueline Bisset
quote: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.

author: Juvenal
quote: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.

author: Ovid
quote: Beauty is a fragile gift.

author: Voltaire
quote: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.

author: Daniel Burnham
quote: Make big plans; aim high in hope and work, remembering that a noble, logical diagram once recorded will not die, but long after we are gone be a living thing, asserting itself with ever-growing insistence.

author: Tadao Ando
quote: When you look at Japanese traditional architecture, you have to look at Japanese culture and its relationship with nature. You can actually live in a harmonious, close contact with nature - this very unique to Japan.

author: Bryant H. McGill
quote: Architects of grandeur are often the master builders of disillusionment.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: I don't build in order to have clients. I have clients in order to build.

author: John Osborne
quote: Don't clap too hard - it's a very old building.

author: Guillaume Apollinaire
quote: A structure becomes architectural, and not sculptural, when its elements no longer have their justification in nature.

author: Louis Kahn
quote: A great building must begin with the unmeasurable, must go through measurable means when it is being designed and in the end must be unmeasurable.

author: Saul Steinberg
quote: The frightening thought that what you draw may become a building makes for reasoned lines.

author: Yoshio Taniguchi
quote: Architecture is basically a container of something. I hope they will enjoy not so much the teacup, but the tea.

author: Arthur Erickson
quote: Space has always been the spiritual dimension of architecture. It is not the physical statement of the structure so much as what it contains that moves us.

author: Walter Gropius
quote: Architecture begins where engineering ends.

author: Philip Johnson
quote: All architecture is shelter, all great architecture is the design of space that contains, cuddles, exalts, or stimulates the persons in that space.

author: James Rouse
quote: For many years, I have lived uncomfortably with the belief that most planning and architectural design suffers for lack of real and basic purpose. The ultimate purpose, it seems to me, must be the improvement of mankind.

author: Bruce Jackson
quote: Bridges are perhaps the most invisible form of public architecture.

author: Richard Rogers
quote: Form follows profit is the aesthetic principle of our times.

author: Charles Simmons
quote: Ridicule is the first and last argument of a fool.

author: Colin Powell
quote: Get mad, then get over it.

author: Thomas a Kempis
quote: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.

author: Eva Mendes
quote: I don't usually lose my temper, but if I get angry, it's true - I'm scary.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.

author: Epictetus
quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.

author: Bob Marley
quote: If you get down and quarell everyday, you're saying prayers to the devil, I say.

author: Josh Billings
quote: Silence is one of the hardest arguments to refute.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.

author: Pythagoras
quote: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: People won't have time for you if you are always angry or complaining.

author: James H. Boren
quote: When in doubt, mumble; when in trouble, delegate; when in charge, ponder.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.

author: Walter Scott
quote: Success or failure in business is caused more by the mental attitude even than by mental capacities.

author: Leo Rosten
quote: First-rate people hire first-rate people; second-rate people hire third-rate people.

author: William Arthur Ward
quote: Wise are those who learn that the bottom line doesn't always have to be their top priority.

author: Blaine Lee
quote: The great leaders are like the best conductors - they reach beyond the notes to reach the magic in the players.

author: Igor Sikorsky
quote: The work of the individual still remains the spark that moves mankind ahead even more than teamwork.

author: Robert Kiyosaki
quote: When times are bad is when the real entrepreneurs emerge.

author: Edgar Fiedler
quote: If you have to forecast, forecast often.

author: Walter Lippmann
quote: The final test of a leader is that he leaves behind him in other men the conviction and the will to carry on.

author: Robin Williams
quote: Carpe per diem - seize the check.

author: David Ogilvy
quote: If it doesn't sell, it isn't creative.

author: Elon Musk
quote: It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.

author: A. C. Benson
quote: One's mind has a way of making itself up in the background, and it suddenly becomes clear what one means to do.

author: Andrew Carnegie
quote: You cannot push any one up a ladder unless he be willing to climb a little himself.

author: Rene Descartes
quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.

author: Democritus
quote: Nothing exists except atoms and empty space; everything else is opinion.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: What we plant in the soil of contemplation, we shall reap in the harvest of action.

author: Thomas More
quote: I die the king's faithful servant, but God's first.

author: John Dewey
quote: To me faith means not worrying.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.

author: Paula Abdul
quote: Keep the faith, don't lose your perseverance and always trust your gut extinct.

author: B. C. Forbes
quote: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.

author: Emmanuel Teney
quote: As your faith is strengthened you will find that there is no longer the need to have a sense of control, that things will flow as they will, and that you will flow with them, to your great delight and benefit.

author: John Wooden
quote: There are many things that are essential to arriving at true peace of mind, and one of the most important is faith, which cannot be acquired without prayer.

author: Tertullian
quote: You can judge the quality of their faith from the way they behave. Discipline is an index to doctrine.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.

author: Javier Bardem
quote: I do respect people's faith, but I don't respect their manipulation of that faith in order to create fear and control.

author: Corazon Aquino
quote: Faith is not simply a patience that passively suffers until the storm is past. Rather, it is a spirit that bears things - with resignations, yes, but above all, with blazing, serene hope.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.

author: Franka Potente
quote: To give somebody your time is the biggest gift you can give.

author: Robert Staughton Lynd
quote: Most of us can remember a time when a birthday - especially if it was one's own - brightened the world as if a second sun has risen.

author: E. Joseph Cossman
quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.

author: Mary Pickford
quote: I was forced to live far beyond my years when just a child, now I have reversed the order and I intend to remain young indefinitely.

author: George Burns
quote: At my age flowers scare me.

author: Nadine Gordimer
quote: People give one another things that can't be gift wrapped.

author: Aimee Bender
quote: I like birthday cake. It's so symbolic. It's a tempting symbol to load with something more complicated than just 'Happy birthday!' because it's this emblem of childhood and a happy day.

author: John Glenn
quote: There is still no cure for the common birthday.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: A gift, with a kind countenance, is a double present.

author: Kristin Armstrong
quote: I love the big fresh starts, the clean slates like birthdays and new years, but I also really like the idea that we can get up every morning and start over.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: The worst part about celebrating another birthday is the shock that you're only as well as you are.

author: Flip Wilson
quote: My happiest memory of childhood was my first birthday in reform school. This teacher took an interest in me. In fact, he gave me the first birthday presents I ever got: a box of Cracker Jacks and a can of ABC shoe polish.

author: Sam Levenson
quote: It was on my fifth birthday that Papa put his hand on my shoulder and said, 'Remember, my son, if you ever need a helping hand, you'll find one at the end of your arm.'

author: John Oates
quote: If you look over the years, the styles have changed - the clothes, the hair, the production, the approach to the songs. The icing to the cake has changed flavors. But if you really look at the cake itself, it's really the same.

author: Art Buchwald
quote: This is a wonderful way to celebrate an 80th birthday... I wanted to be 65 again, but they wouldn't let me - Homeland Security.

author: Navjot Singh Sidhu
quote: We'll take the cake with the red cherry on top.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: We have forty million reasons for failure, but not a single excuse.

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.

author: Mickey Rooney
quote: You always pass failure on your way to success.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Our best successes often come after our greatest disappointments.

author: Edwin Markham
quote: Defeat may serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.

author: Michel de Montaigne
quote: There are some defeats more triumphant than victories.

author: Soichiro Honda
quote: Success represents the 1% of your work which results from the 99% that is called failure.

author: Quentin Crisp
quote: If at first you don't succeed, failure may be your style.

author: Saint Teresa of Avila
quote: To reach something good it is very useful to have gone astray, and thus acquire experience.

author: Henrik Ibsen
quote: The spectacles of experience; through them you will see clearly a second time.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: The only thing we have learnt from experience is that we learn nothing from experience.

author: Louis C. K.
quote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Wood burns because it has the proper stuff in it; and a man becomes famous because he has the proper stuff in him.

author: Jeff Bridges
quote: For me, growing up, the downside of it was that as a kid you don't want to stand out. You don't want to have a famous father let alone get a job because of your famous father, you know? But I'm a product of nepotism. That's how I got my foot in the door, through my dad.

author: Al Roker
quote: I love cooking for myself and cooking for my family.

author: Sidney Poitier
quote: I decided in my life that I would do nothing that did not reflect positively on my father's life.

author: Sammy Davis, Jr.
quote: I wasn't anything special as a father. But I loved them and they knew it.

author: Christopher Meloni
quote: I had no expectations about fatherhood, really, but it's definitely a journey I'm glad to be taking. Number one, it's a great learning experience. When my mother told me it's a 24/7 job, she wasn't kidding.

author: Wendell Phillips
quote: To be as good as our fathers we must be better, imitation is not discipleship.

author: Ben Okri
quote: One of the greatest gifts my father gave me - unintentionally - was witnessing the courage with which he bore adversity. We had a bit of a rollercoaster life with some really challenging financial periods. He was always unshaken, completely tranquil, the same ebullient, laughing, jovial man.

author: Yehuda Berg
quote: I imagine God to be like my father. My father was always the voice of certainty in my life. Certainty in the wisdom, certainty in the path, certainty always in God. For me God is certainty in everything. Certainty that everything is good and everything is God.

author: Dante Hall
quote: I would want my legacy to be that I was a great son, father and friend.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
quote: Virtue can only flourish among equals.

author: Zadie Smith
quote: You can't state difference and also state equality. We have to state sameness to understand equality.

author: Philip James Bailey
quote: The sole equality on earth is death.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: It is better that some should be unhappy rather than that none should be happy, which would be the case in a general state of equality.

author: Andrew Jackson
quote: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.

author: Arthur Ashe
quote: You learn about equality in history and civics, but you find out life is not really like that.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: If your ego starts out, 'I am important, I am big, I am special,' you're in for some disappointments when you look around at what we've discovered about the universe. No, you're not big. No, you're not. You're small in time and in space. And you have this frail vessel called the human body that's limited on Earth.

author: Arthur Ashe
quote: The ideal attitude is to be physically loose and mentally tight.

author: Og Mandino
quote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.

author: Don Rickles
quote: You know what's funny to me? Attitude.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
quote: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.

author: George MacDonald
quote: Attitudes are more important than facts.

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: Cock your hat - angles are attitudes.

author: Earl Nightingale
quote: Our environment, the world in which we live and work, is a mirror of our attitudes and expectations.

author: Joe Biden
quote: Our future cannot depend on the government alone. The ultimate solutions lie in the attitudes and the actions of the American people.

author: Irving Berlin
quote: Our attitudes control our lives. Attitudes are a secret power working twenty-four hours a day, for good or bad. It is of paramount importance that we know how to harness and control this great force.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people whom we personally dislike.

author: Robert Herjavec
quote: Older cars tend to drive like older cars. That is not for me.

author: E. Joseph Cossman
quote: Drive-in banks were established so most of the cars today could see their real owners.

author: Elon Musk
quote: Tesla is here to stay and keep fighting for the electric car revolution.

author: Casey James
quote: I am a big car enthusiast. I totally understand guys like Jay Leno who have a thousand cars. But asking me my favorite car would be like asking my favorite song or favorite food - it changes everyday.

author: Sammy Davis, Jr.
quote: I had more clothes than I had closets, more cars than garage space, but no money.

author: Bud Abbott
quote: Well, I always had a chauffer, because I have never driven a car in my life. I still can't drive.

author: Matthew Barney
quote: I have a need to make these sorts of connections literal sometimes, and a vehicle often helps to do that. I have a relationship to car culture. It isn't really about loving cars. It's sort of about needing them.

author: Gore Vidal
quote: The greatest pleasure when I started making money was not buying cars or yachts but finding myself able to have as many freshly typed drafts as possible.

author: Mario Andretti
quote: You're safer in the race car than you are in cars going to and from the track.

author: Jim DeMint
quote: I drive Fords, and I've driven American cars all my life, and I want to have a strong American manufacturing sector, especially in automobiles.

author: Robbie Coltrane
quote: See, what you're meant to do when you have a mid-life crisis is buy a fast car, aren't you? Well, I've always had fast cars. It's not that. It's the fear that you're past your best. It's the fear that the stuff you've done in the past is your best work.

author: Lord Byron
quote: I only go out to get me a fresh appetite for being alone.

author: Joseph Conrad
quote: Who knows what true loneliness is - not the conventional word but the naked terror? To the lonely themselves it wears a mask. The most miserable outcast hugs some memory or some illusion.

author: Ellen Burstyn
quote: What a lovely surprise to finally discover how unlonely being alone can be.

author: Paul Tournier
quote: Nothing makes us so lonely as our secrets.

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life.

author: Jean Rostand
quote: To be adult is to be alone.

author: Pearl S. Buck
quote: Inside myself is a place where I live all alone and that is where I renew my springs that never dry up.

author: Sienna Miller
quote: As I get older I'm more and more comfortable being alone.

author: Roy Orbison
quote: Only the lonely know the way I feel tonight.

author: George Carlin
quote: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.

author: Conor Oberst
quote: When everything is lonely I can be my best friend.

author: Albert Camus
quote: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.

author: Amy Lowell
quote: Moon! Moon! I am prone before you. Pity me, and drench me in loneliness.

author: Tom Stoppard
quote: Age is a very high price to pay for maturity.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.

author: Daniel Craig
quote: As a kid, I kind of spent my life being amazed by being tricked. I love being tricked. I still love it today.

author: Nigel Farage
quote: It's amazing how ideas start out, isn't it?

author: Vin Diesel
quote: If it's an amazing role, I'll do anything.

author: Peter Max
quote: The '60s were an amazing time.

author: William Hurt
quote: But I am not going to live for ever. And the more I know it, the more amazed I am by being here at all.

author: Amy Grant
quote: The people I've been exposed to have been people of amazing integrity.

author: Conan O'Brien
quote: Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you're kind, amazing things will happen.

author: Chris Hughes
quote: People are doing amazing things right now on the Web.

author: Patrice Leconte
quote: Married people from my generation are like an endangered species!

author: A. P. Herbert
quote: The concept of two people living together for 25 years without a serious dispute suggests a lack of spirit only to be admired in sheep.

author: Jamie Lee Curtis
quote: My mother and stepfather were married 43 years, so I have watched a long marriage. I feel like I had a very good role model for that. And, you know, it's just a number.

author: Chris Daughtry
quote: You marry somebody; you love everything about them. You grow to learn about them. You never learn everything.

author: Pope John Paul II
quote: You will reciprocally promise love, loyalty and matrimonial honesty. We only want for you this day that these words constitute the principle of your entire life and that with the help of divine grace you will observe these solemn vows that today, before God, you formulate.

author: E. W. Howe
quote: Never tell a secret to a bride or a groom; wait until they have been married longer.

author: Henny Youngman
quote: I've been in love with the same woman for forty-one years. If my wife finds out, she'll kill me.

author: Caroline Kennedy
quote: In terms of my marriage, you know, falling in love with my husband was by far the best thing that's ever happened to me.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: Under this window in stormy weather I marry this man and woman together; Let none but Him who rules the thunder Put this man and woman asunder.

author: Julianna Margulies
quote: I love being my husband's wife.

author: Isla Fisher
quote: I love marriage. I think it's a wonderful institution and it's the most important decision you make.

author: Uta Hagen
quote: We had a relationship that lasted 44 years. Herbert and I lived together 10 years before we were married. He always gave me a little heart for whatever anniversary.

author: Blake Shelton
quote: I think you have to be willing to take a bullet for somebody if you're going to stand up there, take your vows, and be married to them for the rest of your life.

author: Todd Tiahrt
quote: Next month, I will celebrate my 30th anniversary of marriage with my beautiful bride, Vicki. Our marriage has been a blessing. I have gained even more respect for the institution over the past 3 decades and will defend it against attack.

author: Mac Thornberry
quote: The day before the anniversary of D-Day, we lost a man who was equaled by few and surpassed by none as a leader in the cause of freedom: Ronald Reagan.

author: Teri Polo
quote: My husband and I went to Bald Head Island for our four-year anniversary. We spent the night in bed with champagne, tequila and Krispy Kreme doughnuts and watched a boxing match on Showtime.

author: Mariella Frostrup
quote: We invest less in our friendships and expect more of friends than any other relationship. We spend days working out where to book for a romantic dinner, weeks wondering how to celebrate a partner or parent's birthday, and seconds forgetting a friend's important anniversary.

author: Unknown
quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
quote: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.

author: Thomas Merton
quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.

author: Georges Braque
quote: There is only one valuable thing in art: the thing you cannot explain.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure.

author: Charles Eames
quote: Art resides in the quality of doing, process is not magic.

author: Robert Schumann
quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.

author: Ernst Fischer
quote: In a decaying society, art, if it is truthful, must also reflect decay. And unless it wants to break faith with its social function, art must show the world as changeable. And help to change it.

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.

author: Arne Jacobsen
quote: If a building becomes architecture, then it is art.

author: James Whistler
quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.

author: Twyla Tharp
quote: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.

author: George Sand
quote: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.

author: Edward Steichen
quote: When that shutter clicks, anything else that can be done afterward is not worth consideration.

author: Le Corbusier
quote: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.

author: Christopher Walken
quote: At its best, life is completely unpredictable.

author: Dean Acheson
quote: The best thing about the future is that it comes only one day at a time.

author: George Orwell
quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.

author: John Selden
quote: Old friends are best.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: But I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things.

author: William Osler
quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is to do today's work superbly well.

author: Katharine Whitehorn
quote: Find out what you like doing best and get someone to pay you for it.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: But men are men; the best sometimes forget.

author: Red Auerbach
quote: Just do what you do best.

author: Joe DiMaggio
quote: A person always doing his or her best becomes a natural leader, just by example.

author: George Lopez
quote: When things are bad, it's the best time to reinvent yourself.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: The best work is not what is most difficult for you; it is what you do best.

author: Harvey S. Firestone
quote: You get the best out of others when you get the best out of yourself.

author: Mae West
quote: Look your best - who said love is blind?

author: Aristotle
quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.

author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
quote: The more often we see the things around us - even the beautiful and wonderful things - the more they become invisible to us. That is why we often take for granted the beauty of this world: the flowers, the trees, the birds, the clouds - even those we love. Because we see things so often, we see them less and less.

author: Ivana Trump
quote: Gorgeous hair is the best revenge.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.

author: Alicia Machado
quote: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.

author: David Hume
quote: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.

author: Helmut Jahn
quote: Every building is a prototype. No two are alike.

author: T. E. Lawrence
quote: All the revision in the world will not save a bad first draft: for the architecture of the thing comes, or fails to come, in the first conception, and revision only affects the detail and ornament, alas!

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.

author: Vitruvius
quote: Nothing requires the architect's care more than the due proportions of buildings.

author: Adolf Loos
quote: Architecture arouses sentiments in man. The architect's task therefore, is to make those sentiments more precise.

author: Ai Weiwei
quote: To work in architecture you are so much involved with society, with politics, with bureaucrats. It's a very complicated process to do large projects. You start to see the society, how it functions, how it works. Then you have a lot of criticism about how it works.

author: Arthur Erickson
quote: Great buildings that move the spirit have always been rare. In every case they are unique, poetic, products of the heart.

author: Robert A. M. Stern
quote: The dialogue between client and architect is about as intimate as any conversation you can have, because when you're talking about building a house, you're talking about dreams.

author: Le Corbusier
quote: A house is a machine for living in.

author: Kenzo Tange
quote: Architects today tend to depreciate themselves, to regard themselves as no more than just ordinary citizens without the power to reform the future.

author: Oscar Niemeyer
quote: Architecture is invention.

author: Donna Karan
quote: I love building spaces: architecture, furniture, all of it, probably more than fashion. The development procedure is more tactile. It's about space and form and it's something you can share with other people.

author: Ernest Dimnet
quote: Architecture, of all the arts, is the one which acts the most slowly, but the most surely, on the soul.

author: Louis Sullivan
quote: The building's identity resided in the ornament.

author: Christopher Morley
quote: A man who has never made a woman angry is a failure in life.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.

author: Wayne Dyer
quote: It is impossible for you to be angry and laugh at the same time. Anger and laughter are mutually exclusive and you have the power to choose either.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote: Grab the broom of anger and drive off the beast of fear.

author: Carl Jung
quote: A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them.

author: Oriana Fallaci
quote: I am a danger to myself if I get angry.

author: Dylan Thomas
quote: When one burns one's bridges, what a very nice fire it makes.

author: Aesop
quote: United we stand, divided we fall.

author: Frederick the Great
quote: He who defends everything defends nothing.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.

author: Henry Miller
quote: Every moment is a golden one for him who has the vision to recognize it as such.

author: Virginia Satir
quote: We can learn something new anytime we believe we can.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.

author: Bernard Williams
quote: Talent is a flame. Genius is a fire.

author: Bill Watterson
quote: Genius is never understood in its own time.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: Good order is the foundation of all things.

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: Everything that is beautiful and noble is the product of reason and calculation.

author: Ralph Marston
quote: Your goals, minus your doubts, equal your reality.

author: John Galsworthy
quote: Idealism increases in direct proportion to one's distance from the problem.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Never mistake motion for action.

author: Anne Frank
quote: The final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

author: Edward Gibbon
quote: The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: Physical strength can never permanently withstand the impact of spiritual force.

author: Lisa Loeb
quote: When someone asks if you'd like cake or pie, why not say you want cake and pie?

author: Mary Schmich
quote: Like many women my age, I am 28 years old.

author: Karl Jaspers
quote: Only then, approaching my fortieth birthday, I made philosophy my life's work.

author: Erma Bombeck
quote: A friend never defends a husband who gets his wife an electric skillet for her birthday.

author: Steven Wright
quote: I kept a diary right after I was born. Day 1: Tired from the move. Day 2: Everyone thinks I'm an idiot.

author: Frank McCourt
quote: The sky is the limit. You never have the same experience twice.

author: Franklin P. Jones
quote: Experience enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.

author: Fred Brooks
quote: Good judgment comes from experience and experience comes from bad judgment.

author: Henry Adams
quote: All experience is an arch, to build upon.

author: Alphonse de Lamartine
quote: Experience is the only prophecy of wise men.

author: George Best
quote: The best thing about being a dad? Well, I think it's just the thing that every man wants - to have a son and heir.

author: Paul Walker
quote: I think my mom put it best. She said, 'Little girls soften their daddy's hearts.'

author: Rod Stewart
quote: I can definitely say the older I've got the better I've become at being a dad and a husband.

author: Dwyane Wade
quote: Fatherhood is the best thing that could happen to me, and I'm just glad I can share my voice.

author: Michael Gurian
quote: Father's Day is hopefully a time when the culture says, 'This is our moment to look at who our men and boys are.'

author: Bella Abzug
quote: The test for whether or not you can hold a job should not be the arrangement of your chromosomes.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Women's rights is not only an abstraction, a cause; it is also a personal affair. It is not only about us; it is also about me and you. Just the two of us.

author: Maximilien Robespierre
quote: Again, it may be said, that to love justice and equality the people need no great effort of virtue; it is sufficient that they love themselves.

author: Bertrand Russell
quote: In America everybody is of the opinion that he has no social superiors, since all men are equal, but he does not admit that he has no social inferiors, for, from the time of Jefferson onward, the doctrine that all men are equal applies only upwards, not downwards.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Coming generations will learn equality from poverty, and love from woes.

author: Herodotus
quote: It is clear that not in one thing alone, but in many ways equality and freedom of speech are a good thing.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.
quote: I have no respect for the passion of equality, which seems to me merely idealizing envy - I don't disparage envy, but I don't accept it as legitimately my master.

author: Betty Ford
quote: I believe the equal rights amendment is a necessity of life for all citizens. The cabinet sometimes felt that I shouldn't be so outspoken.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.

author: Billy Graham
quote: It is not the body's posture, but the heart's attitude that counts when we pray.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: The meaning of things lies not in the things themselves, but in our attitude towards them.

author: Bo Bennett
quote: Having a positive mental attitude is asking how something can be done rather than saying it can't be done.

author: Marilu Henner
quote: Most of us start out with a positive attitude and a plan to do our best.

author: Alan Watts
quote: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.

author: Leonard Nimoy
quote: I think it's my adventure, my trip, my journey, and I guess my attitude is, let the chips fall where they may.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: What is pride? A rocket that emulates the stars.

author: Richard Pryor
quote: When you ain't got no money, you gotta get an attitude.

author: Terry Bradshaw
quote: Bad attitudes will ruin your team.

author: Stephen Covey
quote: Between stimulus and response, there is a space where we choose our response.

author: A. J. Foyt
quote: My dad was very successful running midgets in Texas. Then, his two drivers ran into some bad luck. People started saying that Daddy had lost his touch. That it was the cars and not the drivers. I wanted to race just to prove all those people wrong.

author: Ryan Tedder
quote: I wish people would spend their money on hybrid cars.

author: Catherine Bell
quote: We're just into toys, whether it's motorcycles or race cars or computers. I've got the Palm Pilot right here with me, I've got the world's smallest phone. Maybe it's just because I'm still a big little kid and I just love toys, you know?

author: Tom Arnold
quote: Environmentalists have a very conflicted relationship with their cars.

author: Marc Andreessen
quote: Google is working on self-driving cars, and they seem to work. People are so bad at driving cars that computers don't have to be that good to be much better.

author: ASAP Rocky
quote: I don't like new cars; I'm into vintage cars - there's a Jaguar E-Type in the 'Goldie' video.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: Chrysler builds great cars.

author: Lady Gaga
quote: The only big things I've purchased are my dad's heart valve and a Rolls-Royce for my parents, for their anniversary. And that was only because my dad had a Lady Gaga license plate on our old car and it was making me crazy because he was getting followed everywhere, so I bought him a new car.

author: Diane Johnson
quote: Not having to own a car has made me realize what a waste of time the automobile is.

author: Alexandra Paul
quote: Electric cars aren't pollution-free; they have to get their energy from somewhere.

author: Gordon Sinclair
quote: You talk about German technocracy and you get automobiles.

author: Jeanne Moreau
quote: To go out with the setting sun on an empty beach is to truly embrace your solitude.

author: Samuel Ullman
quote: Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.

author: Robert Frost
quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.

author: Anais Nin
quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.

author: Jules Renard
quote: It is not how old you are, but how you are old.

author: Dylan Thomas
quote: Do not go gentle into that good night but rage, rage against the dying of the light.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: None are so old as those who have outlived enthusiasm.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.

author: Sophocles
quote: A man growing old becomes a child again.

author: John Adams
quote: Old minds are like old horses; you must exercise them if you wish to keep them in working order.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.

author: John Lasseter
quote: There is such amazing talent at Disney. My job is 100% creative, and I am very excited to creatively lead them.

author: Shah Rukh Khan
quote: As far as the public is concerned, India is amazingly secular.

author: Matt Drudge
quote: You would be amazed what the ordinary guy knows.

author: Tom Ford
quote: When the youth of America gets together, amazing things happen.

author: Carrie Fisher
quote: I really love the internet. They say chat-rooms are the trailer park of the internet but I find it amazing.

author: M. H. Abrams
quote: It's amazing how, age after age, in country after country, and in all languages, Shakespeare emerges as incomparable.

author: Britney Spears
quote: I love Jessica Simpson. I love her voice. She's amazing.

author: Casey Kasem
quote: It's been amazing, the number of commercials that I've done, starting back in 1968. It must be 8,000.

author: Bill Sienkiewicz
quote: So much of 'Jaws' was amazing because the mind filled in what was missing.

author: Ritchie Blackmore
quote: I was impressed by Hendrix. His attitude was brilliant. Even the way he walked was amazing.

author: Brad Paisley
quote: That there's no more important decision in life than who you marry.

author: Adam Schiff
quote: Each year on the anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr.'s birth, America has the opportunity to reflect on our nation's progress towards the realization of his dream.

author: Annie Besant
quote: 'Easter' is a movable event, calculated by the relative positions of sun and moon, an impossible way of fixing year by year the anniversary of a historical event, but a very natural and indeed inevitable way of calculating a solar festival. These changing dates do not point to the history of a man, but to the hero of a solar myth.

author: Jean Cocteau
quote: Art is a marriage of the conscious and the unconscious.

author: Paul Gauguin
quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.

author: Paul Cezanne
quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.

author: Jerzy Kosinski
quote: The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: All art is but imitation of nature.

author: Rene Magritte
quote: Art evokes the mystery without which the world would not exist.

author: Don Miguel Ruiz
quote: Every human is an artist. The dream of your life is to make beautiful art.

author: Robert Rauschenberg
quote: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.

author: Priscilla Presley
quote: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.

author: William Butler Yeats
quote: I heard the old, old, men say 'all that's beautiful drifts away, like the waters.'

author: George Meredith
quote: A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power.

author: Socrates
quote: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.

author: Sylvester Stallone
quote: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone.

author: Austin O'Malley
quote: Revenge is often like biting a dog because the dog bit you.

author: Francis Quarles
quote: Beware of him that is slow to anger; for when it is long coming, it is the stronger when it comes, and the longer kept. Abused patience turns to fury.

author: Jules Renard
quote: It doesn't pay to say too much when you are mad enough to choke. For the word that stings the deepest is the word that is never spoke, Let the other fellow wrangle till the storm has blown away, then he'll do a heap of thinking about the things you didn't say.

author: Pope Paul VI
quote: Anger is as a stone cast into a wasp's nest.

author: Joseph Joubert
quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.

author: G. M. Trevelyan
quote: Anger is a momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.

author: Desmond Morris
quote: No matter how old we become, we can still call them 'Holy Mother' and 'Father' and put a child-like trust in them.

author: Novalis
quote: Knowledge is only one half. Faith is the other.

author: Charles Studd
quote: We have one life; it soon will be past; what we do for God is all that will last.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The love of heaven makes one heavenly.

author: John Paul Jones
quote: If fear is cultivated it will become stronger, if faith is cultivated it will achieve mastery.

author: Joel Osteen
quote: God didn't make a mistake when He made you. You need to see yourself as God sees you.

author: John Donne
quote: Reason is our soul's left hand, faith her right.

author: George MacDonald
quote: The principle part of faith is patience.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: The words printed here are concepts. You must go through the experiences.

author: John Legend
quote: Experience is a great teacher.

author: Patrick Henry
quote: I have but one lamp by which my feet are guided, and that is the lamp of experience.

author: Linda Ellerbee
quote: People are pretty much alike. It's only that our differences are more susceptible to definition than our similarities.

author: Harry A. Blackmun
quote: In order to get beyond racism, we must first take account of race. There is no other way. And in order to treat some persons equally, we must treat them differently.

author: E. F. Schumacher
quote: Eagles come in all shapes and sizes, but you will recognize them chiefly by their attitudes.

author: Alejandro Jodorowsky
quote: You live in the image you have of the world. Every one of us lives in a different world, with different space and different time.

author: William J. Brennan, Jr.
quote: There are no menial jobs, only menial attitudes.

author: Justin Timberlake
quote: The best part about being alone is that you really don't have to answer to anybody. You do what you want.

author: Lily Tomlin
quote: Remember we're all in this alone.

author: Evelyn Waugh
quote: Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun; as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.

author: Hosea Ballou
quote: Forty is the old age of youth, fifty is the youth of old age.

author: Golda Meir
quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.

author: Josh Billings
quote: In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us.

author: B. F. Skinner
quote: If you're old, don't try to change yourself, change your environment.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Adults are obsolete children.

author: Maurice Chevalier
quote: You don't stop laughing because you grow older. You grow older because you stop laughing.

author: Jonathan Swift
quote: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.

author: Casey Stengel
quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.

author: Wale
quote: I dated a lot, but I never really had anyone who was worthy of an anniversary. And most girlfriends never made it to a year, anyway.

author: Pope Paul VI
quote: Are there memories left that are safe from the clutches of phony anniversaries?

author: Don Shula
quote: And this year is going to be the 25th anniversary of the 17-0 team, the only undefeated season.

author: Lady Gaga
quote: The only big things I've purchased are my dad's heart valve and a Rolls-Royce for my parents, for their anniversary. And that was only because my dad had a Lady Gaga license plate on our old car and it was making me crazy because he was getting followed everywhere, so I bought him a new car.

author: Zbigniew Brzezinski
quote: Anniversaries are like birthdays: occasions to celebrate and to think ahead, usually among friends with whom one shares not only the past but also the future.

author: Barack Obama
quote: So while an incredible amount of progress has been made, on this fifth anniversary, I wanted to come here and tell the people of this city directly: My administration is going to stand with you - and fight alongside you - until the job is done. Until New Orleans is all the way back, all the way.

author: Kenny Marchant
quote: This year, as we celebrate the 230th anniversary of America's independence, please remember the symbols that are sacred to this country. Fly Old Glory high and show your respect and admiration for this great nation and the values we hold dear.

author: Aldo Leopold
quote: In June as many as a dozen species may burst their buds on a single day. No man can heed all of these anniversaries; no man can ignore all of them.

author: Claudia Winkleman
quote: I couldn't tell you my wedding anniversary (although I seem to remember it was in June. Or maybe July. Definitely a month beginning with a 'J,' anyhow. But not January. Um. I think) and people I went to school with get extremely fed up with me when I bump into them in the street and have absolutely no recollection of their faces.

author: Rosalind Russell
quote: Taking joy in living is a woman's best cosmetic.

author: Louis Nizer
quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that four of his fingers are pointing at himself.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Hatred is an affair of the heart; contempt that of the head.

author: Daniel Webster
quote: Keep cool; anger is not an argument.

author: Buchi Emecheta
quote: A hungry man is an angry one.

author: Horace
quote: Anger is a short madness.

author: Ang Lee
quote: Sometimes, you have to get angry to get things done.

author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
quote: Anger ventilated often hurries towards forgiveness; anger concealed often hardens into revenge.

author: Edward Albert
quote: Fear is the only true enemy, born of ignorance and the parent of anger and hate.

author: Tori Amos
quote: I have so many different personalities in me and I still feel lonely.

author: Jean de la Bruyere
quote: All of our unhappiness comes from our inability to be alone.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: The lonely become either thoughtful or empty.

author: Drew Barrymore
quote: There's a tremendous difference between alone and lonely. You could be lonely in a group of people. I like being alone. I like eating by myself. I go home at night and just watch a movie or hang out with my dog. I have to exert myself and really say, oh God, I've got to see my friends 'cause I'm too content being by myself.

author: Frida Kahlo
quote: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best.

author: Edward Gibbon
quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.

author: Cyrano de Bergerac
quote: I may climb perhaps to no great heights, but I will climb alone.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: I want to be with those who know secret things or else alone.

author: Yousuf Karsh
quote: I've also seen that great men are often lonely. This is understandable, because they have built such high standards for themselves that they often feel alone. But that same loneliness is part of their ability to create.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone.

author: Marvin Davis
quote: As men get older, the toys get more expensive.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Old age comes on suddenly, and not gradually as is thought.

author: C. S. Lewis
quote: Thirty was so strange for me. I've really had to come to terms with the fact that I am now a walking and talking adult.

author: Charles de Gaulle
quote: Old age is a shipwreck.

author: Pierre Corneille
quote: Oh rage! Oh despair! Oh age, my enemy!

author: Agatha Christie
quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets the more interested he is in her.

author: T. S. Eliot
quote: I don't believe one grows older. I think that what happens early on in life is that at a certain age one stands still and stagnates.

author: Pope Paul VI
quote: In youth, the days are short and the years are long. In old age, the years are short and days long.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Alas, after a certain age every man is responsible for his face.

author: Thomas Browne
quote: Let age, not envy, draw wrinkles on thy cheeks.

author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel
quote: Beauty is that which is simultaneously attractive and sublime.

author: Munshi Premchand
quote: Beauty doesn't need ornaments. Softness can't bear the weight of ornaments.

author: Clara Schumann
quote: Why hurry over beautiful things? Why not linger and enjoy them?

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: Every girl should use what Mother Nature gave her before Father Time takes it away.

author: Christian Dior
quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.

author: Billie Holiday
quote: Sometimes it's worse to win a fight than to lose.

author: Thomas Browne
quote: Be able to be alone. Lose not the advantage of solitude, and the society of thyself.

author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent - that is to triumph over old age.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Age merely shows what children we remain.

author: Doris Lessing
quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in seventy or eighty years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all. And that, of course, causes great confusion.

author: Voltaire
quote: What most persons consider as virtue, after the age of 40 is simply a loss of energy.

author: Annie Dillard
quote: The surest sign of age is loneliness.

author: Kevin Spacey
quote: If you haven't turned rebel by twenty you've got no heart; if you haven't turned establishment by thirty you've got no brains!

author: Bob Hope
quote: I don't feel old. I don't feel anything till noon. That's when it's time for my nap.

author: Jeanne Moreau
quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.

author: Judy Garland
quote: If I am a legend, then why am I so lonely?

author: Guru Nanak
quote: Alone let him constantly meditate in solitude on that which is salutary for his soul, for he who meditates in solitude attains supreme bliss.
